column1: agniḥ pūrvebhiḥ r̥ṣi bhiḥ īḍyaḥ nūtanaiḥ uta saḥ devān ā iha vakṣati
column2: Agni, worthy to be magnified by the ancient Rishis and by the present ones — may he conduct the gods hither.

column1: agninā rayim aśnavat poṣam eva dive dive yaśasam vīravat tamam
column2: May one obtain through Agni wealth and welfare day by day, which may bring glory and high bliss of valiant offspring.

column1: agne yam yajñam adhvaram viśvataḥ pari bhūḥ asi saḥ it deveṣu gacchati
column2: Agni, whatever sacrifice and worship 1 thou encompassest on every side, that indeed goes to the gods.

column1: agniḥ hotā kavi kratuḥ satyaḥ citraśravaḥ tamaḥ devaḥ devebhiḥ ā gamat
column2: May Agni the thoughtful Hotri, he who is true and most splendidly renowned, may the god come hither with the gods.

column1: yat aṅga dāśuṣe tvam agne bhadram kariṣyasi tava it tat satyam aṅgiraḥ
column2: Whatever good thou wilt do to thy worshipper, O Agni, that (work) verily is thine, O Angiras.

column1: upa tvā agne dive dive doṣāvastaḥ dhiyā vayam namaḥ bharantaḥ ā imasi
column2: Thee, O Agni, we approach day by day, O (god) who shinest in the darkness 1; with our prayer, bringing adoration to thee

column1: rājantam adhvarāṇām gopām r̥tasya dīdivim vardhamānam sve dame
column2: Who art the king of all worship, the guardian of Rita, the shining one, increasing in thy own house.

column1: saḥ naḥ pitāiva sūnave agne su upāyanaḥ bhava sacasva naḥ svastaye
column2: Thus, O Agni, be easy of access to us, as a father is to his son. Stay with us for our happiness.

column1: agnim dūtam vr̥ṇīmahe hotāram viśva vedasam asya yajñasya su kratum
column2: We choose Agni as our messenger, the all-possessor, as the Hotri of this sacrifice, the highly wise.

column1: agnim agnim havīma bhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim havya vāham puru priyam
column2: Agni and Agni again they constantly invoked with their invocations, the lord of the clans, the bearer of oblations, the beloved of many.

column1: agne devān iha ā vaha jajñānaḥ vr̥kta barhiṣe asi hotā naḥ īḍyaḥ
column2: Agni, when born, conduct the gods hither for him who has strewn the Barhis (sacrificial grass) 1; thou art our Hotri, worthy of being magnified 2.

column1: tān uśataḥ vi bodhaya yat agne yāsi dūtyam devaiḥ ā satsi barhiṣi
column2: Awaken them, the willing ones, when thou goest as messenger, O Agni. Sit down with the gods on the Barhis.

column1: ghr̥ta āhavana dīdi vaḥ prati sma riṣataḥ daha agne tvam rakṣasvinaḥ
column2: O thou to whom Ghnta oblations are poured out, resplendent (god), burn against the mischievous, O Agni, against the sorcerers.

column1: agninā agniḥ sam idhyate kaviḥ gr̥ha patiḥ yuvā havya vāṭ juhu āsyaḥ
column2: By Agni Agni is kindled (or, by fire fire is kindled), the sage, the master of the house, the young one, the bearer of oblations, whose mouth is the sacrificial spoon.

column1: kavim agnim upa stuhi satya dharmāṇam adhvare devam amīva cātanam
column2: Praise Agni the sage, whose ordinances for the sacrifice are true, the god who drives away sickness.

column1: yaḥ tvām agne haviḥ patiḥ dūtam deva saparyati tasya sma pra avitā bhava
column2: Be the protector, O Agni, of a master of sacrificial food who worships thee, O god, as his messenger.

column1: yaḥ agnim deva vītaye haviṣmān āvivāsati tasmai pāvaka mr̥l̥aya
column2: Be merciful, O purifier, unto the man who is rich in sacrificial food, and who invites Agni to the feast of the gods.

column1: saḥ naḥ pāvaka dīdi vaḥ agne devān iha ā vaha upa yajñam haviḥ ca naḥ
column2: Thus, O Agni, resplendent purifier, conduct the gods hither to us, to our sacrifice and to our food.

column1: saḥ naḥ stavānaḥ ā bhara gāyatreṇa navīyasā rayim vīra vatīm iṣam
column2: Thus praised by us with our new Gayatra hymn, bring us wealth of valiant men and food.

column1: agne śukreṇa śociṣā viśvābhiḥ devahūti bhiḥ imam stomam juṣasva naḥ
column2: Agni with thy bright splendour be pleased, through all our invocations of the gods, with this our praise.

column1: su samiddhaḥ naḥ ā vaha devān agne haviṣmate hotariti pāvaka yakṣi ca
column2: 1 Being well lighted, O Agni, bring us hither the gods to the man rich in sacrificial food, O Hotri, purifier, and perform the sacrifice.

column1: madhu mantam tanū napāt yajñam deveṣu naḥ kave adya kr̥ṇuhi vītaye
column2: Tanuinapat 1! Make our sacrifice rich in honey and convey it to-day to the gods, O sage, that they may feast.

column1: narāśaṁsam iha priyam asmin yajñe upa hvaye madhu jihvam haviḥ kr̥tam
column2: I invoke here at this sacrifice Narâsamsa 1, the beloved one, the honey-tongued preparer of the sacrificial food.

column1: agne sukha tame rathe devān il̥itaḥ ā vaha asi hotā manuḥ hitaḥ
column2: O magnified 1 Agni! Conduct the gods hither in an easy-moving chariot. Thou art the Hotri instituted by Manus 2.

column1: str̥ṇīta barhiḥ ānuṣak ghr̥ta pr̥ṣṭham manīṣiṇaḥ yatra amr̥tasya cakṣaṇam
column2: Strew, O thoughtful men, in due order 1 the sacrificial grass, the back (or surface) of which is sprinkled with butter, on which the appearance of immortality 2 (is seen).

column1: vi śrayantām r̥ta vr̥dhaḥ dvāraḥ devīḥ asaścataḥ adya nūnam ca yaṣṭave
column2: May the divine gates open, the increasers of Rita, which do not stick together, that to-day, that now the sacrifice may proceed.

column1: naktoṣāsā su peśasā asmin yajñe upa hvaye idam naḥ barhiḥ āsade
column2: I invoke here at this sacrifice Night and Dawn, the beautifully adorned goddesses, that they may sit down on this our sacrificial grass.

column1: tā su jihvau upa hvaye hotārā daivyā kavī iti yajñam naḥ yakṣatām imam
column2: I invoke these two divine Hotris 1, the sages with beautiful tongues. May they perform this sacrifice for us.

column1: il̥ā sarasvatī mahī tisraḥ devīḥ mayaḥ bhuvaḥ barhiḥ sīdantu asridhaḥ
column2: Ilâ ('Nourishment'), Sarasvatî, and Mahî ('the great one') 1, the three comfort-giving goddesses, they who do not fail, shall sit down on the sacrificial grass.

column1: iha tvaṣṭāram agriyam viśva rūpam upa hvaye asmākam astu kevalaḥ
column2: I invoke hither the foremost, all-shaped Tvashtri to come hither; may he be ours alone.

column1: ava sr̥ja vanaspate deva devebhyaḥ haviḥ pra dātuḥ astu cetanam
column2: O tree 1, let the sacrificial food go, O god, to the gods. May the giver's splendour be foremost.

column1: svāhā yajñam kr̥ṇotana indrāya yajvanaḥ gr̥he tatra devān upa hvaye
column2: Offer ye the sacrifice with the word Svâhâ to Indra in the sacrificers house. Thereto I invoke the gods.

column1: vasiṣva hi miyedhya vastrāṇi ūrjām pate saḥ imam naḥ adhvaram yaja
column2: Clothe thyself with thy clothing (of light), o sacrificial (god), lord of all vigour; and then perform this worship for us.

column1: ni naḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ sadā yaviṣṭha manma bhiḥ agne divitmatā vacaḥ
column2: Sit down, most youthful god, as our desirable Hotri, through (our prayerful) thoughts 1, O Agni, with thy word 2 that goes to heaven.

column1: ā hi sma sūnave pitā āpiḥ yajati āpaye sakhā sakhye vareṇyaḥ
column2: The father verily by sacrificing procures (blessings) for the son 1, the companion for the companion, the elect friend for the friend.

column1: ā naḥ barhiḥ riśādasaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā sīdantu manuṣaḥ yathā
column2: May Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, triumphant with riches (?) 1, sit down on our sacrificial grass as they did on Manu’s.

column1: pūrvya hotaḥ asya naḥ mandasva sakhyasya ca imāḥ oṁ iti su śrudhī giraḥ
column2: O ancient Hotri, be pleased with this our friendship also, and hear these prayers.

column1: yat cit hi śaśvatā tanā devam devam yajāmahe tve iti it hūyate haviḥ
column2: For whenever we sacrifice constantly 1 to this or to that god, in thee alone the sacrificial food is offered.

column1: priyaḥ naḥ astu viśpatiḥ hotām mandraḥ vareṇyaḥ priyāḥ su agnayaḥ vayam
column2: May he be dear to us, the lord of the clan, the joy-giving, elect Hotri; may we be clear (to him), possessed of a good Agni (i. e. of good fire).

column1: su agnayaḥ hi vāryam devāsaḥ dadhire ca naḥ su agnayaḥ manāmahe
column2: For the gods, when possessed of a good Agni, have given us excellent wealth, and we think ourselves possessed of a good Agni.

column1: atha naḥ ubhayeṣām amr̥ta martyānām mithaḥ santu pra śastayaḥ
column2: And may there be among us mutual praises of both the mortals, O immortal one, (and the immortals) 1.

column1: viśvebhiḥ agne agni bhiḥ imam yajñam idam vacaḥ canaḥ dhāḥ sahasa yaho iti
column2: With all Agnis (i. e. with all thy fires), O Agni, accept this sacrifice and this prayer, O young (son) of strength 1.

column1: aśvam na tvā vāra vantam vandadhyai agnim namobhiḥ sam rājantam adhvarāṇām
column2: With reverence I shall worship thee who art long-tailed like a horse, Agni, the king of worship.

column1: saḥ gha naḥ sūnuḥ śavasā pr̥thu pragāmā su śevaḥ mīḍhavān asmākam babhūyāt
column2: May he, our son of strength 1, proceeding on his broad way, the propitious, become bountiful to us.

column1: saḥ naḥ dūrāt ca āsāt ca ni martyāt agha yoḥ pāhi sadam it viśva āyuḥ
column2: Thus protect us always, thou who hast a full life, from the mortal who seeks to do us harm 1, whether near or afar.

column1: imam oṁ iti su tvam asmākam sanim gāyatram navyāṁsam agne deveṣu pra vocaḥ
column2: And mayest thou, O Agni, announce to the gods this our newest efficient Gâyatra song.

column1: ā naḥ bhaja parameṣu ā vājeṣu madhyameṣu śikṣā vasvaḥ antamasya
column2: Let us partake of all booty that is highest and that is middle (i. e. that dwells in the highest and in the middle world); help us to the wealth that is nearest.

column1: vi bhaktā asi citrabhāno iticitra bhāno sindhoḥ ūrmau upāke ā sadyaḥ dāśuṣe kṣarasi
column2: O god with bright splendour, thou art the distributor. Thou instantly flowest for the liberal giver in the wave of the river, near at hand.

column1: yam agne pr̥t su martyam avāḥ vājeṣu yam junāḥ saḥ yantā śaśvatīḥ iṣaḥ
column2: The mortal, O Agni, whom thou protectest in battles, whom thou speedest in the races 1, he will command constant nourishment:

column1: nakiḥ asya sahantya pari etā kayasya cit vājaḥ asti śravāyyaḥ
column2: Whosoever he may be, no one will overtake him, O conqueror (Agni)! His strength 2 is glorious.

column1: saḥ vājam viśva carṣaṇiḥ arvat bhiḥ astu tarutā viprebhiḥ astu sanitā
column2: May he (the man), known among all tribes 3, Win the race with his horses; may he with the help of his priests become a gainer.

column1: jarābodha tat viviḍḍhi viśe viśe yajñiyāya stomam rudrāya dr̥śīkam
column2: O Garabodha 1! Accomplish this (task) for every house 2: a beautiful song of praise for worshipful Rudra 3.

column1: saḥ naḥ mahān ani mānaḥ dhūma ketuḥ puru candraḥ dhiye vājāya hinvatu
column2: May he, the great, the immeasurable, the smoke-bannered, rich in splendour, incite us to (pious) thoughts and to strength.

column1: saḥ revān iva viśpatiḥ daivyaḥ ketuḥ śr̥ṇotu naḥ ukthaiḥ agniḥ br̥hat bhānuḥ
column2: May he hear us, like the rich lord of a clan, the banner of the gods, on behalf of our hymns, Agni with bright light.

column1: namaḥ mahat bhyaḥ namaḥ arbhakebhyaḥ namaḥ yuvabhyaḥ namaḥ āśinebhyaḥ yajāma devān yadi śaknavāma mā jyāyasaḥ śaṁsam ā vr̥kṣi devāḥ
column2: Reverence to the great ones, reverence to the lesser ones! Reverence to the young, reverence to the old 1! I Let us sacrifice to the gods, if we can. May I not, O gods, fall as a victim to the curse of my better 2.

column1: tvam agne prathamāḥ aṅgirā r̥ṣiḥ devaḥ devānām abhavaḥ śivaḥ sakhā tava vrate kavayaḥ vidmanāapasaḥ ajāyanta marutaḥ bhrājat r̥ṣṭayaḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, (who art) the first Angiras Rishi, hast become as god the kind friend of the gods. After thy law the sages, active in their wisdom 1, were born, the Maruts with brilliant spears.

column1: tvam agne prathamaḥ aṅgiraḥ tamaḥ kaviḥ devānām pari bhūṣasi vratam vi bhuḥ viśvasmai bhuvanāya medhiraḥ dvi mātā śayuḥ katidhā cit āyave
column2: Thou, O Agni, the first, highest Angiras, a sage, administerest the law of the gods, mighty for the whole world, wise, the son of the two mothers 1, reposing everywhere for (the use of ) the living 2.

column1: tvam agne prathamaḥ mātariśvane āviḥ bhava sukratū yā vivasvate arejetām rodasī iti hotr̥ vūrye asaghnoḥ bhāram ayajaḥ mahaḥ vaso iti
column2: Thou, O Agni, as the first, shalt become 1 manifest to Matarisvan, through thy high wisdom, to Vivasvat. The two worlds trembled at (thy) election as Hotri. Thou hast sustained the burthen; thou, O Vasu, hast sacrificed to the great (gods) 2.

column1: tvam agne manave dyām avāśayaḥ purūravase su kr̥te sukr̥t taraḥ śvātreṇa yat pitroḥ mucyase pari ā tvā pūrvam anayan ā aparam punariti
column2: Thou, O Agni, hast caused the sky to roar 1 for Manu, for the well-doing Purûravas, being thyself a greater well-doer. When thou art loosened by power (?) 2 from thy parents, they led thee hither before and afterwards again.

column1: tvam agne vr̥ṣabhaḥ puṣṭi vardhanaḥ udyata sruce bhavasi śravāyyaḥ yaḥ āhutim pari veda vaṣaṭ kr̥tim eka āyuḥ agne viśaḥ āvivāsasi
column2: Thou, O Agni, the bull, the augmenter of prosperity, art to be praised by the sacrificer who raises the Spoon, who knows all about the offering 1 and (the sacrifice performed with) the word Vashat. Thou (god) of unique vigour art the first to invite 2 the clans.

column1: tvam agne vr̥jina vartanim naram sakman piparṣi vidathe vi carṣaṇe yaḥ śūra sātā pari takmye dhane dabhrebhiḥ cit sam r̥tā haṁsi bhūyasaḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, leadest forward the man who follows crooked ways 1, in thy company at the sacrifice 2, O god dwelling among all tribes, who in the strife of heroes, in the decisive moment for the obtainment of the prize 3, even with few companions killest many foes in the battle 4.

column1: tvam tam agne amr̥ta tve ut tame martam dadhāsi śravase dive dive yaḥ tatr̥ṣāṇaḥ ubhayāya janmane mayaḥ kr̥ṇoṣi prayaḥ ā ca sūraye
column2: Thou, O Agni, keepest that mortal 1 in the highest immortality, in glory day by day, (thou) who being thirsty thyself 2 givest happiness to both races (gods and men), and joy to the rich.

column1: tvam naḥ agne sanaye dhanānām yaśasam kārum kr̥ṇuhi stavānaḥ r̥dhyāma karma apasā navena devaiḥ dyāvāpr̥thivī iti pra avatam naḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, praised by us, help the glorious singer to gain prizes. May we accomplish our work with the help of the young active (Agni). O Heaven and Earth! Bless us together with the gods.

column1: tvam naḥ agne pitroḥ upa sthe ā devaḥ deveṣu anavadya jāgr̥viḥ tanū kr̥t bodhi pra matiḥ ca kārave tvam kalyāṇa vasu viśvam ā ūpiṣe
column2: Thou, O Agni, in the lap of thy parents, a god among gods, O blameless one, always watchful, be the body’s creator and guardian to the singer. Thou, O beautiful one, pourest forth all wealth.

column1: tvam agne pra matiḥ tvam pitā asi naḥ tvam vayaḥ kr̥t tavajāmayaḥ vayam sam tvā rāyaḥ śatinaḥ sam sahasriṇaḥ suvīram yanti vrata pām adābhya
column2: Thou, O Agni, art our guardian, thou art our father. Thou art the giver of strength; we are thy kinsmen. Hundredfold, thousandfold treasures come together in thee, who art rich in heroes, the guardian of the law, O undeceivable one.

column1: tvām agne prathamam āyum āyave devāḥ akr̥ṇvan nahuṣasya viśpatim il̥ām akr̥ṇvan manuṣasya śāsanīm pituḥ yat putraḥ mamakasya jāyate
column2: Thee, O Agni, the gods have made for the living as the first living 1, the clan-lord of the Nahusha 2. They have made (the goddess) Ilâ the teacher of men (manusha), when a son of my father is born 3.

column1: tvam naḥ agne tava deva pāyu bhiḥ maghonaḥ rakṣa tanvaḥ ca vandya trātā tokasya tanaye gavām asi ani meṣam rakṣamāṇaḥ tava vrate
column2: Thou, O Agni, protect with thy guardians, O god, our liberal givers and ourselves, O venerable one! Thou art the protector of kith and kin 1 and of the cows, unremittingly watching over thy law.

column1: tvam agne yajyave pāyuḥ antaraḥ aniṣaṅgāya catuḥ akṣaḥ idhyase yaḥ rāta havyaḥ avr̥kāya dhāyase kīreḥ cit mantram manasā vanoṣi tam
column2: 1 Thou, O Agni, art kindled four-eyed, as the closest guardian for the sacrificer who is without (even) a quiver 2. Thou acceptest in thy mind the hymn even of the poor 3 who has made offerings 4, that he may prosper without danger.

column1: tvam agne uru śaṁsāya vāghate spārham yat rekṇaḥ paramam vanoṣi tat ādhrasya cit pra matiḥ ucyase pitā pra pākam śāssi pra diśaḥ viduḥ ṭaraḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, gainest 1 for the widely-renowned worshipper that property which is desirable and excellent. Thou art called the guardian and father even of the weak 2; thou instructest the simple, thou, the greatest sage, the quarters of the world 3.

column1: tvam agne prayata dakṣiṇam naram varma iva syūtam pari pāsi viśvataḥ svādu kṣadmā yaḥ vasatau syona kr̥t jīva yājam yajate saḥ upa mā divaḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, protectest on every side like well-stitched armour the man who gives sacrificial fees. He who puts sweet food (before the priests), who makes them comfortable in his dwelling, who kills living (victims), he (will reside) high in heaven 1.

column1: imām agne śaraṇim mīmr̥ṣaḥ naḥ imam adhvānam yam agāma dūrāt āpiḥ pitā pra matiḥ somyānām bhr̥miḥ asi r̥ṣi kr̥t martyānām
column2: Forgive, O Agni, this our fault (?) 1, (look graciously at) this way which we have wandered from afar. Thou art the companion, the guardian, the father of those who offer Soma; thou art the quick one 2 who makes the mortals Rishis 3.

column1: manuṣvat agne aṅgirasvat aṅgiraḥ yayāti vat sadane pūrva vat śuce accha yāhi ā vaha daivyam janam ā sādaya barhiṣi yakṣi ca priyam
column2: As thou didst for Manus, O Agni, for Angiras, O Angiras, for Yayâti on thy (priestly) seat, as for the ancients, O brilliant one, come hither, conduct hither the host of the gods, seat them on the sacrificial grass, and sacrifice to the beloved (host).

column1: etena agne brahmaṇā vavr̥dhasva śaktī vā yat te cakr̥ma vidā vā uta pra neṣi abhi vasyaḥ asmān sam naḥ sr̥ja su matyā vāja vatyā
column2: Be magnified, O Agni, through this spell which we have made for thee with our skill or with our knowledge. And lead us forward to better things. Let us be united with thy favour, which bestows strength.

column1: pra vaḥ yahvam purūṇām viśām deva yatīnām agnim su uktebhiḥ vacaḥ bhiḥ īmahe yam sīm it anye īl̥ate
column2: We implore 1 with well-spoken words the vigorous 2 Agni who belongs to many people 3, to the clans that worship the gods 4, whom other people (also) magnify.

column1: janāsaḥ agnim dadhire sahaḥ vr̥dham haviṣmantaḥ vidhema te saḥ tvam naḥ adya su manāḥ iha avitā bhava vājeṣu santya
column2: Men have placed Agni (on the altar) as the augmenter of strength. May we worship thee, rich in sacrificial food. Thus be thou here to-day gracious to us, a helper in our striving for gain, O good one!

column1: pra tvā dūtam vr̥ṇīmahe hotāram viśva vedasam mahaḥ te sataḥ vi caranti arcayaḥ divi spr̥śanti bhānavaḥ
column2: We choose thee, the all-possessor, as our messenger and as our Hotri. The flames of thee, who art great, spread around; thy rays touch the heaven.

column1: devāsaḥ tvā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā sam dūtam pratnam indhate viśvam saḥ agne jayati tvayā dhanam yaḥ te dadāśa martyaḥ
column2: The gods, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, kindle thee, the ancient messenger. The mortal, O Agni, who worships thee, gains through thee every prize.

column1: mandraḥ hotā gr̥ha patiḥ agne dūtaḥ viśām asi tve iti viśvā sam gatāni vratā dhruvā yāni devāḥ akr̥ṇvata
column2: Thou art the cheerful Hotri and householder, O Agni, the messenger of the clans. In thee all the firm laws are comprised which the gods have made 1.

column1: tve it agne subhage yaviṣṭhya viśvam ā hūyate haviḥ saḥ tvam naḥ adya su manāḥ uta aparam yakṣi devān su vīryā
column2: In thee, the blessed one, O Agni, youngest god, all sacrificial food is offered. Sacrifice then thou who art gracious to us to-day and afterwards 1 to the gods that we may be rich in valiant men.

column1: tam gha īm itthā namasvinaḥ upa sva rājam āsate hotrābhiḥ agnim manuṣaḥ sam indhate titirvāṁsaḥ ati sridhaḥ
column2: Him, the king, verily the adorers approach reverentially. With oblations men kindle Agni, having overcome all failures.

column1: ghnantaḥ vr̥tram ataran rodasī iti apaḥ uru kṣayāya cakrire bhuvat kaṇve vr̥ṣā dyumnī āhutaḥ krandat aśvaḥ go iṣṭiṣu
column2: Destroying the foe 1, they (victoriously) got through Heaven and Earth and the waters; they have made wide room for their dwelling. May the manly (Agni) 2, after he has received the oblations, become brilliant at the side of Kanva; may he neigh as a horse in battles.

column1: sam sīdasva mahān asi śocasva deva vītamaḥ vi dhūmam agne aruṣam miyedhya sr̥ja pra śasta darsatam
column2: Take thy seat; thou art great. Shine forth, thou who most excellently repairest to the gods. O Agni, holy god, emit thy red, beautiful smoke, O glorious one!

column1: yam tvā devāsaḥ manave dadhuḥ iha yajiṣṭham havya vāhana yam kaṇvaḥ medhya atithiḥ dhana spr̥tam yam vr̥ṣā yam upa stutaḥ
column2: Thou whom the gods have placed here for Manu as the best performer of the sacrifice, O carrier of oblations, whom Kanva and Medhyatithi, whom Vrishan and Upastuta 1 (have worshipped,) the winner of prizes.

column1: yam agnim medhya atithiḥ kaṇvaḥ īghe r̥tāt adhi tasya pra iṣaḥ dīdiyuḥ tam imāḥ r̥caḥ tam agnim vardhayāmasi
column2: That Agni's nourishment has shone brightly whom Medhyatithi and Kanva have kindled on behalf of Rita 1. Him do these hymns, him do we extol.

column1: rāyaḥ pūrdhi svadhā vaḥ asti hi te agne deveṣu āpyam tvam vājasya śrutyasya rājasi saḥ naḥ mr̥l̥ha mahān asi
column2: Fill (us with) wealth, thou self-dependent one, for thou, O Agni, hast companionship with the gods. Thou art lord over glorious booty. Have mercy upon us; thou art great.

column1: ūrdhvaḥ oṁ iti su naḥ ūtaye tiṣṭha devaḥ na savitā ūrdhvaḥ vājasya sanitā yat añji bhiḥ vāghat bhiḥ vi hvayāmahe
column2: Stand up straight for blessing us, like the god Savitri, straight a winner of booty, when we with our worshippers and with ointments 1 call thee 2 in emulation (with other people).

column1: ūrdhvaḥ naḥ pāhi aṁhasaḥ ni ketunā viśvam sam itriṇam daha kr̥dhi naḥ ūrdhvān carathāya jīvase vidāḥ deveṣu naḥ duvaḥ
column2: Standing straight, protect us by thy splendour from evil; burn down every ghoul 1. Let us stand straight that we may walk and live. Find out our worship 2 among the gods.

column1: pāhi naḥ agne rakṣasaḥ pāhi dhūrteḥ arāvṇaḥ pāhi riṣataḥ uta vā jighāṁsataḥ br̥hadbhāno itibr̥hat bhāno yaviṣṭhya
column2: Save us, O Agni, from the sorcerer, save us from mischief, from the niggard. Save us from him who does us harm or tries to kill us, O youngest god with bright splendour!

column1: ghanāiva viṣvak vi jahi arāvṇaḥ tapuḥ jambha yaḥ asma dhruk yaḥ martyaḥ śiśīte ati aktu bhiḥ mā naḥ saḥ ripuḥ īśata
column2: As with a club 1 smite the niggards in all directions, and him who deceives us, O god with fiery jaws. The mortal who makes (his weapons) very sharp by night, may that impostor not rule over us.

column1: agniḥ vavne su vīryam agniḥ kaṇvāya saubhagam agniḥ pra āvat mitrā uta medhya atithim agniḥ sātau upa stutam
column2: Agni has won abundance in heroes, Agni prosperity (for Kanva). Agni and the two Mitras (i.e. Mitra and Vanma) have blessed Medhyatithi, Agni (has blessed) Upastuta in the acquirement (of wealth) 1.

column1: agninā turvaśam yadum parāvataḥ ugra devam havāmahe agniḥ nayat nava vāstvam br̥hat ratham turvītim dasyave sahaḥ
column2: Through Agni we call hither from afar Turvasa, Yadu, and Ugradeva. May Agni, our strength against the Dasyu, conduct Navavâstva, Brihadratha, and Turvîti 1.

column1: ni tvām agne manuḥ dadhe jyotiḥ janāya śaśvate dīdetha kaṇve r̥ta jātaḥ ukṣitaḥ yam namasyanti kr̥ṣṭayaḥ
column2: Manu has established thee, O Agni, as a light for all people. Thou hast shone forth with Kanva, born from Rita, grown strong, thou whom the human races worship.

column1: tveṣāsaḥ agneḥ ama vantaḥ arcayaḥ bhīmāsaḥ na prati itaye rakṣasvinaḥ sadam it yātu māvataḥ viśvam sam atriṇam daha
column2: Agni's flames are impetuous and violent; they are terrible and not to be withstood. Always burn down the sorcerers, and the allies of the Yatus, every ghoul 1.

column1: agne vivasvat uṣasaḥ citram rādhaḥ amartya ā dāśuṣe jāta vedaḥ vaha tvam adya devām uṣaḥ budhaḥ
column2: Agni, at the rising of the dawn 1 bring splendid wealth, immortal Gâtavedas, to the worshipper, (and bring hither) to-day the gods awakening with the dawn.

column1: juṣṭaḥ hi dūtaḥ asi havya vāhanaḥ agne rathīḥ adhvarāṇām sa jūḥ aśvi bhyām uṣasā su vīryam asme iti dhehi śravaḥ br̥hat
column2: For thou art the accepted messenger, the bearer of sacrificial food, O Agni, the charioteer of worship. United with the two Asvins and with the Dawn bestow on us abundance of valiant heroes, and high glory.

column1: adya dūtam vr̥ṇīmahe vasum agnim puru priyam dhūma ketum bhāḥ r̥jīkam vi uṣṭiṣu yajñānām adhvara śriyam
column2: We choose to-day as our messenger Agni, the Vasu, the beloved of many, whose banner is smoke, whose … 1 is light, at the dawning of the day, the beautifier of sacrifices 2.

column1: śreṣṭham yaviṣṭham atithim su āhutam juṣṭam janāya dāśuṣe devān accha yātave jāta vedasam agnim īl̥e vi uṣṭiṣu
column2: I magnify at the dawning of the day Agni Gatavedas, the best, the youngest guest, the best receiver of offerings, welcome to pious people, that he may go to the gods 1.

column1: staviṣyāmi tvām aham viśvasya amr̥ta bhojana agne trātāram amr̥tam miyedhya yajiṣṭham havya vāhana
column2: I shall praise thee, O food on which everything lives, immortal one 1, Agni, the immortal protector, O holy god, the best sacrificer, O bearer of sacrificial food.

column1: suśaṁsaḥ bodhi gr̥ṇate yaviṣṭhya madhu jihvaḥ su āhutaḥ praskaṇvasya pra tiran āyuḥ jīvase namasya daivyam janam
column2: Be kind-spoken to him who praises thee, O youngest god, honey-tongued, the best receiver of offerings. Lengthening Praskanva's life, that he may reach old age, do homage 1 to the host of the gods.

column1: hotāram viśva vedasam sam hi tvā viśaḥ indhate saḥ ā vaha puru hūta pra cetasaḥ agne devān iha dravat
column2: The clans kindle thee, the all-possessing Hotri:  therefore conduct hither speedily, much-invoked Agni, the provident gods.

column1: savitāram uṣasam aśvinā bhagam agnim vi uṣṭiṣu kṣapaḥ kaṇvāsaḥ tvā suta somāsaḥ indhate havya vāham su adhvara
column2: Savitri, the Dawn, the two Arvins, Bhaga, Agni 1, at the dawning (of the day), (at the end) of night 2. The Kanvas, having pressed Soma, inflame thee, the bearer of sacrificial food, O best performer of worship.

column1: patiḥ hi adhvarāṇām agne dūtaḥ viśām asi uṣaḥ budhaḥ ā vaha soma pītaye devān adya svaḥ dr̥śaḥ
column2: As thou, O Agni, art the lord of worship, the messenger of the clans, conduct hither to-day the gods awakening with the dawn, of sun-like aspect, that they may drink Soma.

column1: agne pūrvāḥ anu uṣasaḥ vibhāvaso itivibhāvaso dīdetha viśva darśataḥ asi grāmeṣu avitā puraḥ hitaḥ asi yajñeṣu mānuṣaḥ
column2: Agni, rich in splendour! thou hast shone after the former dawns, visible to all. Thou art the guardian in the hamlets, the Purohita; thou be- longest to men at the sacrifices 1.

column1: ni tvā yajñasya sādhanam agne hotāram r̥tvijam manuṣvat deva dhīmahi pra cetasam jīram dūtam amartyam
column2: O Agni, let us put thee down (on the altar) as Manus did, O god, to be the performer of the sacrifice, the Hotri, the wise priest, the quick immortal messenger.

column1: yat devānām mitra mahaḥ puraḥ hitaḥ antaraḥ yāsi dūtyam sindhoḥ iva pra svanitāsaḥ ūrmayaḥ agneḥ bhrājante arcayaḥ
column2: When thou, the Purohita of the gods, who art great like Mitra, goest on thy errand as messenger in their midst, then the flames of Agni shine like the roaring waves of the Sindhu 1.

column1: śrudhi śrut karṇa vahni bhiḥ devaiḥ agne sayāva bhiḥ ā sīdantu barhiṣi mitraḥ aryamā prātaḥ yāvānaḥ adhvaram
column2: Agni with thy attentive ears, hear me, together with the gods driven (on their chariots) 1 who accompany thee. May Mitra and Aryaman sit down on the sacrificial grass, they who come to the ceremony early in the morning.

column1: śr̥ṇvantu somam marutaḥ su dānavaḥ agni jihvāḥ r̥ta vr̥dhaḥ pibatu somam varuṇaḥ dhr̥ta vrataḥ aśvi bhyām uṣasā sa jūḥ
column2: May the Maruts, they who give rain, the fire-tongued increasers of Rita, hear my praise. May Varuna, whose laws are firm, drink the Soma, united with the two Asvins and with the Dawn!

column1: tvam agne vasūn iha rudrān ādityān uta yaja su adhvaram janam manu jātam ghr̥ta pruṣam
column2: Sacrifice here, thou, O Agni, to the Vasus, the Rudras, and the Adityas, to the (divine) host that receives good sacrifices 1, the Ghrita-sprinkling offspring of Manu 2.

column1: śruṣṭī vānaḥ hi dāśuṣe devāḥ agne vicetasaḥ tān rohit aśva girvaṇaḥ trayaḥ triṁśatam ā vaha
column2: The wise gods, O Agni, are ready to listen to the worshippers: conduct them hither, the thirty-three, O lord of red horses, thou who lovest our praises.

column1: priyamedha vat atri vat jāta vedaḥ virūpa vat aṅgirasvat mahi vrata praskaṇvasya śrudhi havam
column2: As thou hast heard Priyamedha and Atri 1, O Gâtavedas, as thou hast heard Virupa and Angiras, thus hear the invocation of Praskanva, O lord of high laws.

column1: mahi keravaḥ ūtaye priya medhāḥ ahūṣata rājantam adhvarāṇām agnim śukreṇa śociṣā
column2: The Mahikerus 1, the Priyamedhas have invoked for their protection the lord of worship, Agni with his bright splendour.

column1: ghr̥ta āhavana santya imāḥ oṁ iti su śrudhi giraḥ yābhiḥ kaṇvasya sūnavaḥ havante avase tvā
column2: O thou to whom Ghrita oblations are poured out, good (Agni), hear these praises with which the sons of Kanva invoke thee for their protection.

column1: tvām citraśravaḥ tama havante vikṣu jantavaḥ śociḥ keśam puru priya agne havyāya vol̥have
column2: O Agni, whose glory is brightest, beloved of many, the people in the clans invoke thee, the radiant-haired, to convey the sacrificial food.

column1: ni tvā hotāram r̥tvijam dadhire vasuvit tamam śrut karṇam saprathaḥ tamam viprāḥ agne diviṣṭiṣu
column2: The priests have established thee, O Agni, in the striving for day 1, as their Hotri, the ministrant, the greatest acquirer of wealth, with attentive ears, the most widely extended 2.

column1: ā tvā viprāḥ acucyavuḥ suta somāḥ abhi prayaḥ br̥hat bhāḥ bibhrataḥ haviḥ agne martāya dāśuṣe
column2: The wise who have pressed Soma have made thee speed hither to the feast (which is offered to the gods), bringing great light 1 and sacrificial food, O Agni, on behalf of the mortal worshipper.

column1: prātaḥ yāvnaḥ sahaḥ kr̥ta soma peyāya santya iha adya daivyam janam barhiḥ ā sādaya vaso iti
column2: O strength-made, good (Agni), make the gods who come in the morning, the divine host, sit down here to-day on our sacrificial grass, O Vasu, to drink the Soma.

column1: arvāñcam daivyam janam agne yakṣva sahūti bhiḥ ayam somaḥ su dānavaḥ tam pāta tiraḥ ahnyam
column2: Sacrifice, O Agni, with joint invocations, and bring hither the divine host. This is the Soma, O rain-giving gods. Drink (the Soma) which has been kept over night 1.

column1: nu cit sahaḥ jāḥ amr̥taḥ ni tundate hotā yat dūtaḥ abhavat vivasvataḥ vi sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathi bhiḥ rajaḥ mame ā deva tātā haviṣā vivāsati
column2: Seizing his own food the undecaying, greedy (Agni) stands on the brushwood wishing to drink. When he has been sprinkled (with ghee), he shines like a racer with his back 1. Thundering he has roared like the ridge of heaven.

column1: kroṇā rudrebhiḥ vasu bhiḥ puraḥ hitaḥ hotā ni sattaḥ rayiṣāṭ amatyarḥ rathaḥ na vikṣu r̥ñjasānaḥ āyuṣu vi ānuṣak vāryā devaḥ r̥ṇvati
column2: As soon as 1 the Rudras, the Vasus have made him their Purohita, the immortal sitting down as Hotri, the conqueror of wealth, pressing forward like a chariot among the clans, among the Âyus 2, the god in due course discloses desirable boons.

column1: vi vāta jūtaḥ ataseṣu tiṣṭhate vr̥thā juhūbhiḥ sr̥ṇyā tuvi svaṇiḥ tr̥ṣu yat agne vaninaḥ vr̥ṣa yase kr̥ṣṇam te ema ruśat ūrme ajara
column2: Stirred by the wind he spreads among the brushwood lightly, 1 (driven forward) by the sacrificial ladles, with his sickle 2, loudly roaring. When thou, O Agni, thirstily rushest on the wooden sticks like a bull 3, thy course, O never-aging god with fiery waves, becomes black 4.

column1: tapuḥ jambhaḥ vane ā vāta coditaḥ yūthe na sāhvān ava vāti vaṁsagaḥ abhi vrajan akṣitam pājasā rajaḥ sthātuḥ caratham bhayate patatri ṇaḥ
column2: He who has fiery jaws, stirred by the wind, blazes down on the forest 1 as a strong bull (rushes) on the herd. When he proceeds 2 with his stream of light to the imperishable atmosphere, then what is moveable and immoveable (and) the winged (birds) are afraid.

column1: dadhuḥ tvā bhr̥gavaḥ mānuṣeṣu ā rayim na cārum su havam janebhyaḥ hotāram agne atithim vareṇyam mitram na śevam divyāya janmane
column2: The Bhrigus have placed thee among men, who art beautiful like a treasure, who art easy to invoke for people; thee the Hotri, O Agni, the excellent guest, a delightful friend like Mitra to the divine race!

column1: hotāram sapta juhvaḥ yajiṣṭham yam vāghataḥ vr̥ṇate adhvareṣu agnim viśveṣām aratim vasūnām saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam
column2: I worship with good cheer Agni the steward 1 of all treasures, whom the seven ladles 2 (of the priests), the worshippers choose as the Hotri, the best sacrificer at the rites, and I pray for treasure 3.

column1: acchidrā sūno iti sahasaḥ naḥ adya stotr̥ bhyaḥ mitra mahaḥ śarma yaccha agne gr̥ṇantam aṁhasaḥ uruṣya ūrjaḥ napāt pūḥ bhiḥ āyasībhiḥ
column2: Son of strength, great like Mitra, grant to-day flawless protection to us who magnify thee,  Agni! guard from distress with strongholds of iron him who praises thee, O offspring of vigour!

column1: bhava varūtham gr̥ṇate vibhāvaḥ bhava maghavan maghavat bhyaḥ śarma uruṣya agne aṁhasaḥ gr̥ṇantam prātaḥ makṣu dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
column2: Be a shelter to him who praises thee, O resplendent one; be protection, generous giver, to the generous. Agni! guard him who praises thee from distress. May he who gives wealth for our prayer, come quickly in the morning 1.

column1: vayāḥ it agne agnayaḥ te anye tve iti viśve amr̥tāḥ mādayante vaiśvānara nābhiḥ asi kṣitīnām sthūṇāiva janān upa mit yayantha
column2: The other Agnis (the other fires) are verily thy branches, O Agni. In thee all the immortals enjoy themselves 1. Vaisvânara! Thou art the centre 2 of human settlements; like a supporting column thou holdest men 3.

column1: mūrdhā divaḥ nābhiḥ agniḥ pr̥thivyāḥ atha abhavat aratiḥ rodasyoḥ tam tvā devāsaḥ ajanayanta devam vaiśvānara jyotiḥ it āryāya
column2: The head of heaven, the navel of the earth is Agni; he has become the steward 1 of both worlds. Thee, a god, the gods have engendered, O Vaisvânara, to be a light for the Ârya.

column1: ā sūrye na raśmayaḥ dhruvāsaḥ vaiśvānare dadhire agnā vasūni yā parvateṣu oṣadhīṣu ap su yā mānuṣeṣu asi tasya rājā
column2: As in the sun the rays are firmly fixed, thus in Agni Vaisvânara all treasures have been laid down 1. (The treasures) which dwell in the mountains, in the herbs, the waters, and among men—of all that thou art the king.

column1: br̥hatīivetibr̥hatī iva sūnave rodasī iti giraḥ hotā manuṣyaḥ na dakṣaḥ svaḥ vate satya śuṣmāya pūvīrḥ vaiśvānarāya nr̥ tamāya yahvīḥ
column2: As the two great worlds to their son 1, like a Hotri like a skilful man, (we bring) praises — manifold (praises) to him who is united with the sun, to the truly strong one, new (praises) to Vaisvanara, the manliest god.

column1: divaḥ cit te br̥hataḥ jāta vedaḥ vaiśvānara pra ririce mahi tvam rājā kr̥ṣṭīnām asi mānuṣīṇām yudhā devebhyaḥ varivaḥ cakartha
column2: Thy greatness, O Gâtavedas, Vaisvânara, has exceeded even the great heaven. Thou art the king of the human tribes; thou hast by fighting gained wide space for the gods.

column1: pra nu mahi tvam vr̥ṣabhasya vocam yam pūravaḥ vr̥tra hanam sacante vaiśvānaraḥ dasyum agniḥ jaghanvān adhūnot kāṣṭhāḥ ava śambaram bhet
column2: Let me now proclaim the greatness of the bull whom the Pûrus worship as the destroyer of enemies 1. Agni Vaisvânara, having slain the Dasyu, shook the (aerial) arena and cut down Sambara.

column1: vaiśvānaraḥ mahimnā viśva kr̥ṣṭiḥ bharat vājeṣu yajataḥ vibhāvā śāta vaneye śatinībhiḥ agniḥ puru nīthe jarate sūnr̥tāvān
column2: Agni Vaisvânara, extending by his greatness over all dominions, who is to be worshipped, the bright one, rich in loveliness, is awake (or, is praised) among the Bharadvâgas, in the homestead of Purunîtha .Sâtavaneya, with his hundredfold blessings.

column1: vahnim yaśasam vidathasya ketum supra avyam dūtam sadyaḥ artham dvi janmānam rayim iva pra śastam rātim bharat bhr̥gave mātariśvā
column2: Mâtarisvan brought (Agni) to Bhrigu as a gift precious like wealth, of double birth 1, the carrier, the famous, the beacon of the sacrifice 2, the ready and immediately successful messenger.

column1: asya śāsuḥ ubhayāsaḥ sacante haviṣmantaḥ uśijaḥ ye ca martāḥ d ivaḥ cit pūrvaḥ ni asādi hotā āpr̥cchyaḥ viśpatiḥ vikṣu vedhāḥ
column2: Both follow his command, the Usigs 1 offering sacrificial food, and the mortals. The Hotri (Agni) has sat down before daybreak among the clans, the lord of the clans, whose leave should be asked, the performer of worship.

column1: tam navyasī hr̥daḥ ā jāyamānam asmat su kīrtiḥ madhu jihvam aśyāḥ yam r̥tvijaḥ vr̥jane mānuṣāsaḥ prayasvantaḥ āyavaḥ jījananta
column2: May our new, beautiful praise, born 1 from our heart, reach him the honey-tongued (Agni), whom the human priests in our settlement 2, the Âyus, offering enjoyment have engendered.

column1: uśik pāvakaḥ vasuḥ mānuṣeṣu vareṇyaḥ hotā adhāyi vikṣu damūnā gr̥ha patiḥ dame ā agniḥ bhuvat rayi patiḥ rayīṇām
column2: The Usig 1, the purifier, the Vasu has been established among men, the best Hotri among the clans, the domestic 2 master of the house in the house: Agni has become the treasure-lord of treasures.

column1: tam tvā vayam patim agne rayīṇām pra śaṁsāmaḥ mati bhiḥ gotamāsaḥ āśum na vājam bharam marjayantaḥ prātaḥ makṣu dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
column2: Thus we, the Gotamas, praise thee, O Agni, the lord of treasures, with our (pious) thoughts, rubbing thee as (they rub down) a swift racer that wins the prize. May he who gives wealth for our prayer, come quickly in the morning 1.

column1: paśvā na tāyum guhā catantam namaḥ yujānam namaḥ vahantam
column2: 1 Thee who hidest thyself in secret like a thief with an animal 2 (which he has stolen) — who hadst harnessed 3 adoration and carriedst adoration —

column1: sajoṣāḥ dhīrāḥ padaiḥ anu gman upa tvā sīdan viśve yajatrāḥ
column2: The wise unanimously followed by thy foot-marks 1. All (gods) deserving worship (reverentially) sat down near thee.

column1: r̥tasya devāḥ anu vratā guḥ bhuvat pariṣṭiḥ dyauḥ na bhūma
column2: The gods followed the laws of Rita. There was an encompassing as the heaven (encompasses) the earth 1.

column1: vardhanti īm āpaḥ panvā su śiśvim r̥tasya yonā garbhe su jātam
column2: In the lap, in the womb of Rita, the waters nourish the fine child with praise, him who is well born.

column1: puṣṭiḥ na raṇvā kṣitiḥ na pr̥thvī giriḥ na bhujma kṣodaḥ na śam bhu
column2: Like good fortune, like a broad abode, like the fertile hill 1 like the refreshing stream,

column1: atyaḥ na ajman sarga prataktaḥ sindhuḥ na kṣodaḥ kaḥ im varāte
column2: Like a racer urged forward in the race, like the rapids of the Sindhu 1 — who can hold him back?

column1: jāmiḥ sindhūnām bhrātāiva svasrām ibhyān na rājā vanāni atti
column2: (He is) the kinsman of the rivers, as a brother of his sisters. He eats the forests as a king (eats, i. e. takes the wealth of) the rich 1.

column1: yat vāta jūtaḥ vanā vi asthāt agniḥ ha dāti roma pr̥thivyāḥ
column2: When he has spread through the forests, driven by the wind, Agni shears the hair of the earth.

column1: śvasiti ap su haṁsaḥ na sīdan kratvā cetiṣṭhaḥ viśām uṣaḥ bhut
column2: Sitting in the waters he hisses like a swan. (He is) most famous by his power of mind, he who belongs to the clans, awakening at dawn.

column1: somaḥ na vedhāḥ r̥ta prajātaḥ paśuḥ na śiśvā vi bhuḥ dūre bhāḥ
column2: A performer of worship like Soma, the god born from Rita, like a young (?) 1 beast, far-extending, far-shining.

column1: rayiḥ na citrā sūraḥ na sam dr̥k āyuḥ na prāṇaḥ nityaḥ na sūnuḥ
column2: Like unto excellent wealth, like unto the shine of the sun, like unto living breath, like unto one's own 1 son.

column1: takvā na bhūrṇiḥ vanā saisakti payaḥ na dhenuḥ śuciḥ vibhāvā
column2: Like unto a quick takvan 1 he (Agni) holds the wood, like milk, like a milch cow 2, bright and shining.

column1: dādhāra kṣemam okaḥ na raṇvaḥ yavaḥ na pakvaḥ jetā janānām
column2: He holds safety, pleasant like a homestead, like ripe barley, a conqueror of men,

column1: r̥ṣiḥ na stubhvā vikṣu pra śastaḥ vājī na prītaḥ vayaḥ dadhāti
column2: Like a Rishi uttering (sacred) shouts, praised among the clans; like a well-cared-for race-horse 1, Agni bestows vigour.

column1: duroka śociḥ kratuḥ na nityaḥ jāyāiva yonau aram viśvasmai
column2: He to whose flame men do not grow accustomed 1, who is like one's own mind 2, like a wife on a couch, enough for all (happiness).

column1: citraḥ yat abhrāṭ śvetaḥ na vikṣu rathaḥ na rukmī tveṣaḥ samat su
column2: When the bright (Agni) has shone forth, he is like a white (horse [?]) 1 among people, like a chariot with golden ornaments, impetuous in fights.

column1: senāiva sr̥ṣṭā amam dadhāti astuḥ na didyut tveṣa pratīkā
column2: Like an army which is sent forward he shows his vehemence, like an archer's shaft with sharp point.

column1: yamaḥ ha jātaḥ yamaḥ jani tvam jāraḥ kanīnām patiḥ janīnām
column2: He who is born is one twin; he who will be born 1 is the other twin—the lover of maidens, the husband of wives 2.

column1: tam vaḥ carāthā vayam vasatyā astam na gāvaḥ nakṣante iddham
column2: 1 As cows go to their stalls, all that moves and we, for the sake of a dwelling, reach him who has been kindled.

column1: sindhuḥ na kṣodaḥ pra nīcīḥ ainot navante gāvaḥ svaḥ dr̥śīke
column2: Like the flood of the Sindhu 1 he has driven forward the downwards-flowing (waters) 2. The cows lowed at the sight of the sun 3.

column1: vaneṣu jāyuḥ marteṣu mitraḥ vr̥ṇīte śruṣtim rājāiva ajuryam
column2: Victorious 1 in the forests, a friend among men, he demands obedience like a king, the undecaying one 2.

column1: kṣemaḥ na sādhuḥ kratuḥ na bhadraḥ bhuvat su ādhīḥ hotā havya vāṭ
column2: Like good peace, like fortunate wisdom, may he (Agni) be a kind Hotri, a carrier of offerings.

column1: haste dadhānaḥ nr̥mṇā viśvāni ame devān dhāt guhā ni sīdan
column2: Having taken in his hand all manly powers, he has made the gods fear, when sitting down in his hiding-place.

column1: vidanti īm atra naraḥ dhiyam dhāḥ hr̥dā yat taṣṭān mantrān aśaṁsan
column2: There the thoughtful men find him, when they have recited the spells which they had fashioned in their heart.

column1: ajaḥ na kṣām dādhāra pr̥thivīm tastambha dyām mantrebhiḥ satyaiḥ
column2: As the goat 1 (supports) the earth 2, thus he supports the earth 2; he upholds the sky by his efficacious spells.

column1: priyā padāni paśvaḥ ni pāhi viśva āyuḥ agne guhā guham gāḥ
column2: Protect the dear 1 footsteps of the cattle 2. O Agni, thou who hast a full life, thou hast gone from covert to covert 3.

column1: yaḥ īm ciketa guhā bhavantam ā yaḥ sasāda dhārām r̥tasya
column2: He who has seen him the hidden one, he who has got near to the stream of Rita 1.

column1: vi ye cr̥tanti r̥tā sapantaḥ āt it vasūni pra vavāca asmai
column2: They who get him off, doing service to Rita, to him he then indicates riches.

column1: vi yaḥ vīrut su rodhat mahi tvā uta pra jāḥ uta pra sūṣu antarit i
column2: He who grows up with might within the plants, and within the children 1, and within the sprouting grass 2.

column1: cittiḥ apām dame viśva āyuḥ sadma iva dhīrāḥ sam māya cakruḥ
column2: The splendour [?] in the home of the waters 1, the full-lived. The sages made him as if building a seat.

column1: śrīṇan upa sthāt divam bhuraṇyuḥ sthātuḥ caratham aktūn vi ūrṇot
column2: Cooking 1 (the oblations?) the quick one has approached the sky. He has revealed the nights and what stands and moves 2.

column1: pari yat eṣām ekaḥ viśveṣām bhuvat devaḥ devānām mahi tvā
column2: When he the god, alone of all these gods 1 encompassed (the others) by his greatness.

column1: āt it te viśve kratum juṣanta śuṣkāt yat deva jīvaḥ janiṣṭhāḥ
column2: When thou, O god, hadst been born living from the dry (wood), then all (gods and men?) were pleased with thy wisdom.

column1: bhajanta viśve deva tvam nāma r̥tam sapantaḥ amr̥tam evaiḥ
column2: They all obtained the name of divinity, of immortality 1, serving the Rita in due way.

column1: r̥tasya preṣāḥ r̥tasya dhītiḥ viśva āyuḥ viśve apāṁsi cakruḥ
column2: The instigations of Rita, the thought of Rita 1: they all performed the works of [?] the full-lived one 2.

column1: yaḥ tubhyam dāśāt yaḥ vā te śikṣāt tasmai cikitvān rayim dayasva
column2: Bestow wealth, thou who art the knowing one, on him who worships thee or who does service to thee 1.

column1: hotā ni sattaḥ manoḥ apatye saḥ cit nu āsām patiḥ rayīṇām
column2: He who sits down as the Hotri among the offspring of Manu: he verily is the master of all these riches.

column1: icchanta retaḥ mithaḥ tanūṣu sam jānata svaiḥ dakṣaiḥ amūrāḥ
column2: They longed together for the seed in their bodies 1, and the wise ones were concordant among each other in their minds.

column1: pituḥ na putrāḥ kratum juṣanta śroṣan ye asya śāsam turāsaḥ
column2: They took pleasure in his will, as sons (take pleasure) in their father's (will), the quick ones who have listened to his command.

column1: vi rāyaḥ aurṇot duraḥ puru kṣuḥ pipeśa nākam str̥ bhiḥ damūnāḥ
column2: He who is rich in food has opened the gates of wealth 1. The householder (Agni) has adorned the sky with stars.

column1: śukraḥ śuśukvān uṣaḥ na jāraḥ paprā samīcī itisam īcī divaḥ na jyotiḥ
column2: Bright, flaming, like the lover of the Dawn 1, he has, like the light of the sky, filled the two (worlds of Heaven and Earth) which are turned towards each other.

column1: pari pra jātaḥ kratvā babhūtha bhuvaḥ devānām pitā putraḥ san
column2: As soon as thou wert born thou hast excelled by thy power of mind; being the son of the gods thou hast become their father.

column1: vedhāḥ adr̥ptaḥ agniḥ vi janan ūdhaḥ na gonām svādma pitūnām
column2: (Agni is) a worshipper (of the gods), never foolish, (always) discriminating; (he is) like the udder of the cows; (he is) the sweetness of food 1.

column1: jane na śeva āhūryaḥ san madhye ni sattaḥ raṇvaḥ duroṇe
column2: Like a kind friend to men, not to be led astray 1, sitting in the midst, the lovely one, in the house;

column1: putraḥ na jātaḥ raṇvaḥ duroṇe vājī na prītaḥ viśaḥ vi tārīt
column2: Like a child when born, he is delightful in the house; like a race-horse which is well cared for 1, he has wandered across the clans 2.

column1: viśaḥ yat ahve nr̥ bhiḥ sa nīl̥āḥ agniḥ deva tvā viśvāni aśyāḥ
column2: When I call (to the sacrifice) the clans who dwell in the same nest with the heroes, may Agni then attain all divine powers 1.

column1: nakiḥ te etā vratā minanti nr̥ bhyaḥ yat ebhyaḥ śruṣṭim cakartha
column2: When thou hast listened to these heroes, no one breaks those laws of thine.

column1: tat tu te daṁsaḥ yat ahan samānaiḥ nr̥ bhiḥ yat yuktaḥ viveḥ rapāṁsi
column2: That verily is thy wonderful deed that thou hast killed 1, with thy companions, (all foes), that, joined by the heroes, thou hast accomplished thy works 2.

column1: tmanā vahantaḥ duraḥ vi r̥ṇvan navanta viśve svaḥ dr̥śīke
column2: Carrying (him) they opened by themselves the doors (of heaven). They all shouted at the aspect of the sun 1.

column1: vanema pūrvīḥ aryaḥ manīṣā agniḥ suśokaḥ viśvāni aśyāḥ
column2: May we, the poor 1, succeed in many (pious) thoughts 2. May Agni with his pure splendour attain everything.

column1: ā daivyāni vratā cikitvān ā mānuṣasya janasya janma
column2: He who understands the divine laws and the birth of the human race.

column1: garbhaḥ yaḥ apām garbhaḥ vanānām garbhaḥ ca sthātām garbhaḥ carathām
column2: He who is the child of the waters, the child of the trees, the child of that which stands, and the child of that which moves.

column1: adrau cit asmai antaḥ duroṇe viśām na viśvaḥ amr̥taḥ su ādhīḥ
column2: Even in the rock (they have done homage [?]) to him, in his dwelling 1. (He is) like a protector [?] 2 of the clans, the immortal one, he who is of a good mind.

column1: saḥ hi kṣapāvān agniḥ rayīṇām dāśat yaḥ asmai aram su uktaiḥ
column2: For he, Agni, (shows himself as) an earth-protecting (lord) of riches 1 to the man who satisfies him with well-spoken (prayers).

column1: etā cikitvaḥ bhūma ni pāhi devānām janma martān ca vidvān
column2: Protect, O knowing one, these beings, thou who knowest the birth of gods and men 1.

column1: vardhān yam pūrvīḥ kṣapaḥ vi rūpāḥ sthātuḥ ca ratham r̥ta pravītam
column2: He whom many nights (and dawns), in their different forms 1, may increase, whom that which moves 2 and that which stands (increases), the god penetrated by Rita.

column1: arādhi hotā svaḥ ni sattaḥ kr̥ṇvan viśvāni apāṁsi satyā
column2: That Hotri who has sat down in the sun 1, has been successfully worshipped 2 (by the human sacrificers), he who truly accomplishes all his works.

column1: goṣu pra śastim vaneṣu dhiṣe bharanta viśve balim svaḥ naḥ
column2: On the cows, on the trees thou hast conferred excellence. May all men bring us tribute in the sun 1.

column1: vi tvā naraḥ puru trā saparyan pituḥ na jivreḥ vi vedī bharanta
column2: In many places men have worshipped thee. They have brought (thee) to different places 1 as sons (divide) the property of an aged father 2.

column1: sādhuḥ na gr̥dhnuḥ astāiva śūraḥ yātāiva bhīmaḥ tveṣaḥ samat su
column2: 1 (He is) like a greedy man 2 who goes straight (to his aim), like a mighty archer, like a fearful avenger [?] 3, impetuous in contests 4.

column1: upa pra jinvan uśatīḥ uśantam patim na nityam janayaḥ sa nīl̥āḥ svasāraḥ śyāvīm aruṣīm ajuṣran citram ucchantīm uṣasam na gāvaḥ
column2: The loving (women) have (amorously) excited 1 their lover, as wives of the same nest (house) their own husband. The sisters have delighted in the dark and in the red (goddess) 2, as the cows in the brightly shining dawn.

column1: vīl̥u cit dr̥l̥hā pitaraḥ naḥ ukthaiḥ adrim rujan aṅgirasaḥ raveṇa cakruḥ divaḥ br̥hataḥ gātum asme iti ahariti svaḥ vividuḥ ketum usrāḥ
column2: Our fathers, the Aṅgiras 1, have broken even the strong fortresses by their hymns, the rock by their shouting. They have opened to us the path of the great heaven; they have obtained day and sun and the shine of the dawn 2.

column1: dadhan r̥tam dhanayan asya dhītim āt it aryaḥ dadhiṣvaḥ vi bhr̥trāḥ atr̥ṣyantīḥ apasaḥ yanti accha devān janma prayasā vardhayantīḥ
column2: They founded the Rita; they set into motion the thought of it 1. Thus then the widely-spread (prayers) 2 of the poor 3 which seek to obtain (wealth), which are free from thirst 4, the active, approach 5 the tribe of the gods 6, strengthening them by offering them delight.

column1: mathīt yat īm vi bhr̥taḥ mātariśvā gr̥he gr̥he śyetaḥ jenyaḥ bhūt ādīm rājñe na sahīyase sacā san ā dūtyam bhr̥gavāṇaḥ vivāya
column2: When Mâtarisvan had produced him by attrition, he, the reddish, the noble one, who was brought to many places 1, has come to every house. Then the Bhrigu-like 2 has undertaken the messengership 3 (for the mortal) as for a mightier king, being attached to him.

column1: mahe yat pitre īm rasam dive kaḥ ava tsarat pr̥śanyaḥ cikitvān sr̥jat astā dhr̥ṣatā didyum asmai svāyām devaḥ duhitari tviṣim dhāt
column2: When he had created sap to the great father Heaven, the knowing one stealthily approached the speckled (cows). The archer fiercely shot an arrow at him. The god turned his impetuous power against his daughter 1.

column1: sve ā yaḥ tubhyam dame ā vi bhāti namaḥ vā dāśāt uśataḥ anu dyūn vardhaḥ agne vayaḥ asya dvi barhāḥ yāsat rāyā sa ratham yam junāsi
column2: Augment, O Agni, twofold the strength of the man who worships 1 thee in his house, or offers adoration to the loving one 2 day by day. May he whom thou incitest be united with riches 3.

column1: agnim viśvāḥ abhi pr̥kṣaḥ sacante samudram na sravataḥ sapta yahvīḥ na jāmibhiḥ vi cikite vayaḥ naḥ vidāḥ deveṣu pra matim cikitvān
column2: Every nourishment goes towards Agni 1, as the seven young 2 rivers (flow) into the ocean. Our strength does not shine from kinsmen 3. Do thou therefore who knowest this, procure among the gods kindness for us.

column1: ā yat iṣe nr̥ patim tejaḥ ānaṭ śuci retaḥ ni siktam dyauḥ abhīke agniḥ śardham anavadyam yuvānam su ādhyam janayat sūdayat ca
column2: 1 When the sharp splendour 2 reached the lord of men to incite him 3, the bright sperm poured down from Heaven (or, from the god Dyaus)4, Agni produced 5 and furthered the blameless, young, well-wishing host 6.

column1: manaḥ na yaḥ adhvanaḥ sadyaḥ eti ekaḥ satrā sūraḥ vasvaḥ īśe rājānā mitrāvaruṇā supāṇī itisu pāṇī goṣu priyam amr̥tam rakṣamāṇā
column2: He who traverses the paths quickly 1 like thought, the Sun alone rules over wealth altogether. (There are) the two kings Mitra and Varuna with graceful hands 2, who watch over the beloved ambrosia 3 in the cows.

column1: mā naḥ agne sakhyā pitryāṇi pra marṣiṣṭhāḥ abhi viduḥ kaviḥ san nabhaḥ na rūpam jarimā mināti purā tasyāḥ abhi śasteḥ adhi ihi
column2: Do not forget, O Agni, who art a sage possessed of knowledge 1, our paternal friendship. Old age impairs the appearance (of men) as a cloud (covers the sun or the sky). Before this curse (attains us), think thou (of us) 2.

column1: ni kāvyā vedhasaḥ śaśvataḥ kaḥ haste dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi agniḥ bhuvat rayi patiḥ rayīṇām satrā cakrāṇaḥ amr̥tāni viśvā
column2: He has brought down (i. e. surpassed) the wisdom of many a worshipper 1, he who holds in his hand all manly power. Agni has become the lord of treasures, he who brought together all (powers of) immortality.

column1: asme iti vatsam pari santam na vindan icchantaḥ viśve amr̥tāḥ amūrāḥ śrama yuvaḥ padavyaḥ dhiyam dhāḥ tasthuḥ pade parame cāru agneḥ
column2: 1 All the clever immortals when seeking did not find the calf though sojourning round about us. The attentive (gods), wearying themselves, following his footsteps 2, stood at the highest, beautiful 3 standing-place of Agni.

column1: tisraḥ yat agne śaradaḥ tvām it śucim ghr̥tena śucayaḥ saparyān nāmāni cit dadhire yajñiyāni asūdayanta tanvaḥ su jātāḥ
column2: When the bright ones 1 had done service 2 to thee, the bright one, Agni, with Ghrita through three autumns, they assumed worshipful names; the well-born shaped their own bodies.

column1: ā rodasī iti br̥hatī iti vevidānāḥ pra rudriyā jabhrire yajñiyāsaḥ vidat martaḥ nema dhitā cikitvān agnim pade parame tasthi vāṁsam
column2: Acquiring (or, exploring?) for themselves the two great worlds, the worshipful ones brought forward their Rudra-like powers 1. The mortal, when (beings) were in discord 2, perceived and found out Agni standing in the highest place.

column1: sam jānānāḥ upa sīdan abhi jñu patnī vantaḥ namasyam namasyannitinamasyan ririkvāṁsaḥ tanvaḥ kr̥ṇvata svāḥ sakhā sakhyuḥ n i miṣi rakṣamāṇāḥ
column2: Being like-minded they reverentially approached him on their knees. Together with their wives they venerated the venerable one. Abandoning their bodies they made them their own, the (one) friend waking when the (other) friend closed his eyes.

column1: triḥ sapta yat guhyāni tveiti it padā avidan ni hitāḥ yajñiyāsaḥ tebhiḥ rakṣante amr̥tam sa joṣāḥ paśūn ca sthātr̥r̥n caratham ca pāhi
column2: When the worshipful (gods) have discovered the thrice seven secret steps (or, places) laid down in thee, they concordantly guard with them immortality. Protect thou the cattle and that which remains steadfast and that which moves.

column1: vidvān agne vayunāni kṣitīnām vi ānuṣak śurudhaḥ jīvase dhāḥ antaḥ vidvān adhvanaḥ deva yānān atandraḥ dūtaḥ abhavaḥ haviḥ vāṭ
column2: Knowing, O Agni, the established orders 1 of (human) dwellings, distribute in due order gifts 2 that they may live. Knowing the ways which the gods go 3, thou hast become the unwearied messenger, the bearer of oblations.

column1: svu ādhyaḥ divaḥ ā sapta yahvīḥ rāyaḥ duraḥ vi r̥ta jñāḥ ajānan vidat gavyam saramā dr̥l̥ham ūrvam yena nu kam mānuṣī bhojate viṭ
column2: They who knew the right way and were filled with good intentions, beheld from heaven the seven young 1 (rivers) and the doors of riches. Saramâ found the strong stable of the cows from which human clans receive their nourishment 2.

column1: ā ye viśvā su apatyāni tasthuḥ kr̥ṇvānāsaḥ amr̥ta tvāya gātum mahnā mahat bhiḥ pr̥thivī vi tasthe mātā putraiḥ aditiḥ dhāyase veḥ
column2: The Earth has spread herself far and wide with them who are great in their greatness, the mother Aditi, for the refreshment of the bird 1, with her sons who have assumed all powers of their own dominion 2, preparing (for themselves) the way to immortality.

column1: adhi śriyam ni dadhuḥ cārum asmin divaḥ yat akṣī iti amr̥tāḥ akr̥ṇvan adha kṣaranti sindhavaḥ na sr̥ṣṭāḥ pra nīcīḥ agne aruṣīḥ ajānan
column2: When the immortals created the two eyes of heaven 1, they placed fair splendour in him (Agni) 2. Then they rush down 3 like streams let loose. The red ones have recognised, O Agni, those which are directed downwards 4.

column1: rayiḥ na yaḥ pitr̥ vittaḥ vayaḥ dhāḥ su pranītiḥ cikituṣaḥ na śāsuḥ syona śīḥ atithiḥ na prīṇānaḥ hotāiva sadma vidhataḥ vi tārīt
column2: He who gives vigour like wealth acquired by the fathers 1, who is a good guide like the instruction of a sage, who is pleased (by worship) like a comfortably resting guest 2, (Agni) has crossed the (sacrificial) seat of the worshipper like a Hotri.

column1: devaḥ na yaḥ savitā satya manmā kratvā ni pāti vr̥janāni viśvā puru praśastaḥ amatiḥ na satyaḥ ātmāiva śevaḥ didhiṣāyyaḥ bhūt
column2: He who being truthful like the god Savitri 1 protects by his power of mind all settlements 2, praised by many like impetuous splendour 3, the truthful one has become dear like vital breath and worthy to be searched for 4.

column1: devaḥ na yaḥ pr̥thivīm viśva dhāyāḥ upa kṣeti hita mitraḥ na rājā puraḥ sadaḥ śarma sadaḥ na vīrāḥ anavadyā patijuṣṭāiva nārī
column2: (Agni) who possessing every refreshment dwells on the earth like a god, like a king who has made himself (valiant) friends 2, like heroes who sit in front and under shelter, like a blameless wife beloved by her husband.

column1: tam tvā naraḥ dame ā nityam iddham agne sacanta kṣitiṣu dhruvāsu adhi dyumnam ni dadhuḥ bhūri asmin bhava viśva āyuḥ dharuṇaḥ rayīṇām
column2: Thee, O Agni, who art constantly kindled in the house, men have worshipped in their firm dwellings. They have placed in him rich splendour 1. Be thou possessed of all life, a supporter of riches 2.

column1: vi pr̥kṣaḥ agne magha vānaḥ aśyuḥ vi sūrayaḥ dadataḥ viśvam āyuḥ sanema vājam sam itheṣu aryaḥ bhāgam deveṣu śravase dadhānāḥ
column2: May the liberal givers, O Agni, attain nourishment, may the rich 1 who bestow gifts (on us) attain to a full span of life. May we win in battles the booty of him who does not give 1, obtaining a (rich) share before the gods, that we may win glory 2.

column1: r̥tasya hi dhenavaḥ vāvaśānāḥ smat ūdhnīḥ pīpayanta dyu bhaktāḥ parāvataḥ su matim bhikṣamāṇāḥ vi sindhavaḥ samayā sasruḥ adrim
column2: The lowing milch-cows of Rita, assigned by Heaven, were exuberant with their full udders. The rivers imploring the favour (of the gods) from afar have broken through the midst of the rock with their floods.

column1: tve agne su matim bhikṣamāṇāḥ divi śravaḥ dadhire yajñiyāḥ naktā ca cakruḥ uṣasā virūpeitivi rūpe kr̥ṣṇam ca varṇam aruṇam ca sam dhurit idhuḥ
column2: Imploring favour from thee, O Agni, the worshipful (gods) have won glory in the sky. They have made Night and Dawn of different shapes; they have joined the black and red colour (to Night and Dawn).

column1: yān rāye martān susūdaḥ agne te syāma magha vānaḥ vayam ca chāyāiva viśvam bhuvanam sisakṣi āpapri vān rodasī iti antarikṣam
column2: And may we, our liberal givers and ourselves, be the mortals whom thou furtherest to wealth, O Agni 1. Like a shadow thou followest the whole world, having filled the two worlds (Heaven and Earth) and the air 2.

column1: arvat bhiḥ agne arvataḥ nr̥bhiḥ nr̥r̥n vīrair vīrān vanuyāmā tvotāḥ īśānāsaḥ pitr̥ vittasyar yaḥ vi sūrayaḥ śata himāḥ naḥ aśyuḥ
column2: May we, O Agni, guarded by thee, conquer with our racers the racers, with our men the men, with our heroes the heroes (of our enemies). Being masters of the riches which their fathers 1 have conquered, may our rich (givers) reach a hundred winters.

column1: etā te agne ucathāni vedhaḥ juṣṭāni santu manase hr̥de ca śakema rāyaḥ su dhuraḥ yamam te adhi śravaḥ deva bhaktam dadhānāḥ
column2: May these hymns, O Agni, worshipper (of the gods), be grateful to thee, to thy mind and heart. May we be able to bridle thee, the well-harnessed wealth 1, acquiring the glory which the gods have assigned us.

column1: upa prayantaḥ adhvaram mantram vocema agnaye āre asme iti ca śr̥ṇvate
column2: Going forward to the sacrifice let us repeat a prayer to Agni who hears us, may he be afar or with us—

column1: yaḥ snīhitīṣu pūrvyaḥ sam jagmānāsu kr̥ṣṭiṣu arakṣat dāśuṣe gayam
column2: He who foremost 1 in … 2, when the human tribes met (in battle), has preserved his home to the worshipper.

column1: uta bruvantu jantavaḥ ut agniḥ vr̥tra hā ajani dhanam jayaḥ raṇe raṇe
column2: And let the people say 'Agni is born, the slayer of foes (or, the slayer of Vritra), he who wins the prize in every battle.'

column1: yasya dūtaḥ asi kṣaye veṣi havyāni vītaye dasmat kr̥ṇoṣi adhvaram
column2: The man in whose home thou art a messenger, and to whose sacrificial food thou eagerly comest for feasting, to whose worship thou impartest wonderful power—

column1: tam it su havyam aṅgiraḥ su devam sahasaḥ yaho iti janāḥ āhuḥ su barhiṣam
column2: Such a man the people call a giver of good oblations, O Aṅgiras, a friend of the gods, O son of strength 1, and a possessor of a good Barhis (or sacrificial grass).

column1: ā ca vahāsi tān iha devān upa pra śastaye havyā su candra vītaye
column2: And thou shalt conduct them hither, the gods 1, that we may praise them, that they may eagerly come, O resplendent one, to the sacrificial offerings.

column1: na yoḥ upabdiḥ aśvyaḥ śr̥ṇve rathasya kat cana yat agne yāsi dūtyam
column2: No noise 1 of the horses of the moving chariot 2 is heard any way, when thou goest on thy messengership, O Agni.

column1: tvāūtaḥ vājī ahrayaḥ abhi pūrvasmāt aparaḥ pra dāśvān agne asthāt
column2: When guarded by thee the racer becomes fearless; the worshipper, O Agni, who is behind, gains the advantage 1 over him who is ahead.

column1: uta dyu mat su vīryam br̥hat agne vivāsasi devebhyaḥ deva dāśuṣe
column2: And thou winnest, O Agni, brilliant, high bliss in strong heroes from the gods, O god, for the worshipper.

column1: juṣasva saprathaḥ tamam vacaḥ devapsaraḥ tamam havyā juhvānaḥ āsani
column2: Accept gladly our most widely-sounding 1 speech, the most agreeable to the gods, thou who, in thy mouth, offerest the sacrificial food (to the gods).

column1: atha te aṅgiraḥ tama agne vedhaḥ tama priyam vocema brahma sānasi
column2: And may we then pronounce to thee, O highest Aṅgiras, Agni, best worshipper, a prayer agreeable to thee and successful.

column1: kaḥ te jāmiḥ janānām agne kaḥ dāśu adhvaraḥ kaḥ ha kasmin asi śritaḥ
column2: Who is thy kinsman among men, O Agni? Who performs worship to thee 1? Who art thou, and where dost thou rest?

column1: tvam jāmiḥ janānām agne mitraḥ asi priyaḥ sakhā sakhi bhyaḥ īḍyaḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, art the kinsman, the dear friend ('Mitra') of men, a friend who is to be magnified by his friends.

column1: yaja naḥ mitrāvaruṇā yaja devān r̥tam br̥hat agne yakṣi svam damam
column2: Sacrifice for us to Mitra and Varuna. Sacrifice to the gods, (a sacrifice conforming to) the great Rita 1. Sacrifice, O Agni, to thy own house.

column1: kā te upa itiḥ manasaḥ varāya bhuvat agne śam tamā kā manīṣā kaḥ vā yajñaiḥ pari dakṣam te āpa kena vā te manasā dāśema
column2: What supplication is to thy mind's taste 1? What (pious) thought may be, O Agni, most agreeable to thee? Or who has won for himself thy wisdom by sacrifices? Or with what thoughts may we worship thee 2?

column1: ā ihi agne iha hotā ni sīda adabdhaḥ su puraḥ etā bhava naḥ avatām tvā rodasī iti viśvaminve itiviśvam inve yaja mahe saumanasāya devān
column2: Come hither, Agni, sit down here as a Hotri. Become our undeceivable leader 1. May Heaven and Earth, the all-embracing, protect thee. Offer the sacrifice to the gods that they may be highly gracious to us.

column1: pra su viśvān rakṣasaḥ dhakṣi agne bhava yajñānām abhiśasti pāvā atha ā vaha soma patim hari bhyām ātithyam asmai cakr̥ma su dāvne
column2: Burn down all sorcerers, O Agni; become a protector of the sacrifices against imprecations. And. conduct hither the lord of Soma (Indra) with his two bay horses. We have prepared hospitality for him, the good giver.

column1: prajāvatā vacasā vahniḥ āsā ā ca huve ni ca satsi iha devaiḥ veṣi hotram uta potram yajatra bodhi pra yantaḥ janitaḥ vasūnām
column2: With words procuring offspring, carrying thee (to our sacrifice) with my mouth 1, I call 2 thee hither, and thou shalt sit down here with the gods. Perform the service of a Hotri and of a Potri 3, O worshipful one. Be thou a giver and a father 4 of riches.

column1: yathā viprasya manuṣaḥ haviḥ bhiḥ devān ayajaḥ kavi bhiḥ kaviḥ san eva hotariti satya tara tvam adya agne mandrayā juhvā yajasva
column2: As thou didst perform sacrifice to the gods with the sacrificial food of the wise Manu 1, a sage together with sages, thus, O highly truthful Hotri, perform thou the sacrifice to-day, O Agni, with thy joy-giving sacrificial ladle 2.

column1: kathā dāśema agnaye kā asmai deva juṣṭā ucyate bhāmine gīḥ yaḥ martyeṣu amr̥taḥ r̥ta vā hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ it kr̥ṇoti devān
column2: How shall we sacrifice to Agni? What words, agreeable to the god, shall be addressed to him, the luminous one, who, being immortal and righteous, the Hotri, the best sacrificer, conveys the gods to the mortals 1?

column1: yaḥ adhvareṣu śam tamaḥ r̥ta vā hotā tam oṁ iti namaḥ bhiḥ ā kr̥ṇudhvam agniḥ yat veḥ martāya devān saḥ ca bodhāti manasā yajāti
column2: Bring hither by adoration the Hotri who is most beneficial in sacrifices and righteous. When Agni repairs to the gods on behalf of the mortal 1, may he be attentive in his mind, and may he perform the sacrifice 2.

column1: saḥ hi kratuḥ saḥ maryaḥ saḥ sādhuḥ mitraḥ na bhūt adbhutasya rathīḥ tam medheṣu prathamam deva yantīḥ viśaḥ upa bruvate dasmam ārīḥ
column2: For he is wisdom 1, he is manly, he is straightforward; like Mitra he has become the charioteer of the mysterious 2. Therefore the Aryan clans 3, longing for the gods, address him, the wonderful one, as the first at the sacrifices.

column1: saḥ naḥ nr̥ṇām nr̥ tamaḥ riśādāḥ agniḥ giraḥ avasā vetu dhītim tanā ca ye magha vānaḥ śaviṣṭhāḥ vāja prasūtāḥ iṣayanta manma
column2: May that Agni, the manliest of men, triumphant with riches [?] 1, come with help to our words, to our devotion, and (to the devotion) of those most powerful liberal givers who bent on the prize 2 have constantly stirred up our prayers 3.

column1: eva agniḥ gotamebhiḥ r̥ta vā viprebhiḥ astoṣṭa jāta vedāḥ saḥ eṣu dyumnam pīpayat saḥ vājam saḥ puṣṭim yāti joṣam ā cikitvān
column2: Thus Agni, the righteous Gâtavedas, has been praised by the priestly Gotamas 1. May he augment their splendour and their strength. He the knowing one gains increase according to his desire.

column1: abhi tvā gotamāḥ girā jāta vedaḥ vi carṣaṇe dyumnaiḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ
column2: O Gâtavedas, who dwellest among all tribes, we the Gotamas (praise) thee with our song—we praise thee aloud with (songs full of) splendour.

column1: tam oṁ iti tvā gotamaḥ girā rāyaḥ kāmaḥ duvasyati dyumnaiḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ
column2: Gotama 1 desirous of riches exalts thee, as thou art, with his song. We praise thee aloud with (songs full of) splendour.

column1: tam oṁ iti tvā vāja sātamam aṅgirasvat havāmahe dyumnaiḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ
column2: We call thee, such as thou art, the highest winner of booty, as Aṅgiras did. We praise thee aloud with (songs full of) splendour.

column1: tam oṁ iti tvā vr̥trahan tamam yaḥ dasyūn ava dhūnuṣe dyumnaiḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ
column2: (We praise) thee, the greatest destroyer of enemies (or, of Vritra), who hurlest the Dasyus away—we praise thee, such as thou art, aloud with (songs full of) splendour.

column1: avocāma rahūgaṇāḥ agnaye madhu mat vacaḥ dyumnaiḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ
column2: We the Rahûganas 1 have recited a honey-sweet speech to Agni. We praise thee aloud with (songs full of) splendour.

column1: hiraṇya keśaḥ rajasaḥ vi sāre ahiḥ dhuniḥ vātaḥ iva dhrajīmān śuci bhrājāḥ uṣasaḥ navedāḥ yaśasvatīḥ apasyuvaḥ na satyāḥ
column2: The golden-haired in the expanse 1 of the atmosphere, the roaring 2 snake, is hasting (through the air) like the wind; the brightly resplendent watcher of the dawn 3, he who is like the glorious, ever active and truthful (goddesses) 4.

column1: ā te su parṇāḥ aminanta evaiḥ kr̥ṣṇaḥ nonāva vr̥ṣabhaḥ yadi idam śivābhiḥ na smayamānābhiḥ ā agāt patanti mihaḥ stanayanti abhr̥ā
column2: By thy goings the beautifully-winged (birds) were disparaged 1; the black bull 2 has roared, when here 3 (all this happened). He has come as if with the bounteous smiling (women) 4. The mists fly, the clouds thunder.

column1: yat īm r̥tasya payasā piyānaḥ nayan r̥tasya pathi bhiḥ rajiṣṭhaiḥ ayarmā mitraḥ varuṇaḥ pari jmā tvacam pr̥ñcanti uparasya yonau
column2: When they have led him, who swells 1 with the milk of Rita, on the straightest paths of Rita, then Aryaman, Mitra, and Varuna, he who walks round the earth 2, fill the leather-bag (the cloud) in the womb of the lower (atmosphere [?]) 3.

column1: agne vājasya gomataḥ īśānaḥ sahasaḥ yaho iti asme iti dhehi jāta vedaḥ mahi śravaḥ
column2: Agni, who art lord of booty, rich in cows, young son of strength 1, bestow on us, O Gâtavedas, great glory.

column1: saḥ idhānaḥ vasuḥ kaviḥ agniḥ īl̥enyaḥ girā revat asmabhyam puru aṇīka dīdihi
column2: Being lighted, a Vasu, a sage, Agni who is to be magnified by (pious) words, O (god) with many faces, shine to us so that riches may be ours.

column1: kṣapaḥ rājan uta tmanā agne vastoḥ uta uṣasaḥ saḥ tigma jambha rakṣasaḥ daha prati
column2: Reigning 1 by night by thy own power, O Agni, and at the break of dawn, O god with sharp teeth, burn against the sorcerers.

column1: ava naḥ agne ūti bhiḥ gāyatrasya pra bharmaṇi viśvāsu dhīṣu vandya
column2: Bless us, O Agni, with thy blessings, when our Gâyatra song is brought forward (to thee), thou to whom reverence is due in all our prayers.

column1: ā naḥ agne rayim bhara satrāsaham vareṇyam viśvāsu pr̥t su dustaram
column2: Bring us wealth, O Agni, which may be always conquering, excellent and invincible 1 in all battles.

column1: ā naḥ agne su cetunā rayim viśvāyu poṣasam mārḍīkam dhehi jīvase
column2: Bestow on us, Agni, through thy kindness 1 wealth which may last all our life 2, and have mercy 3 on us that we may live.

column1: pra pūtāḥ tigma śociṣe vācaḥ gotama agnaye bharasva sumna yuḥ giraḥ
column2: O Gotama 1, bring forward purified words, bring songs to the sharp-flaming Agni, desirous of his favour.

column1: yaḥ naḥ agne abhi dāsati anti dūre padīṣṭa saḥ asmākam it vr̥dhe bhava
column2: May he who tries to harm us, whether nigh or afar, fall down. Do thou lead us alone to increase.

column1: sahasra akṣaḥ vi carṣaṇiḥ agniḥ rakṣāṁsi sedhati hotā gr̥ṇīte ukthyaḥ
column2: The thousand-eyed Agni, who dwells among all tribes, scares away the Rakshas. The praiseworthy Hotri (Agni) is praised 1.

column1: imam stomam arhate jāta vedase ratham iva sam mahema manīṣayā bhadrā hi naḥ pra matiḥ asya sam sadi agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: We have sent forward 1 with thoughtful mind this song of praise like a chariot to the worthy Gâtavedas. For blissful is his care for us in his companionship. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: yasmai tvam āyajase saḥ sādhati anarvā kṣeti dadhate su vīryam saḥ tūtāva na enam aśnoti aṁhatiḥ agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: He prospers for whom thou performest the sacrifice; he dwells untouched 1; he acquires abundance of heroes. He is strong; no distress overtakes him. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: śakema tvā sam idham sādhaya dhiyaḥ tve devāḥ haviḥ adanti āhutam tvam ādityān ā vaha tān hi uśmasi agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: May we be able to light thee. Prosper our prayers. The gods eat the sacrificial food that is offered in thee. Bring thou hither the Âdityas, for we long for them. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: bharāma idhmam kr̥ṇavāma havīṁṣi te citayantaḥ parvaṇāparvaṇā vayam jīvātave pra taram sādhaya dhiyaḥ agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: Let us bring fuel and prepare sacrificial gifts for thee, awaking thy attention at each joint 1 (of the month). Help forward our prayers that we may live. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: viśām gopāḥ asya caranti jantavaḥ dvi pat ca yat uta catuḥ pat aktu bhiḥ citraḥ pra ketaḥ uṣasaḥ mahān asi agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: (He is) the shepherd of the clans 1; by his nightly light the creatures walk, the two-footed and four-footed. Thou art the bright, great splendour of dawn. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: tvam adhvaryuḥ uta hotā asi pūrvyaḥ pra śāstā potā januṣā puraḥ hitaḥ viśvā vidvān ārtvijyā dhīra puṣyasi agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: Thou art the Adhvaryu and the ancient Hotri, the Prasâstri 1, the Potri, the born Purohita 2. Knowing the duties of every priest thou givest success, O wise one. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: yaḥ viśvataḥ su pratīkaḥ sa dr̥ṅ asi dūre cit san tal̥it iva ati rocase rātryāḥ cit andhaḥ ati deva paśyasi agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: Thou who art beautiful, of like appearance on all sides, thou shinest forth even when afar like lightning. Thou seest, O god, even over the darkness of night. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: pūrvaḥ devāḥ bhavatu sunvataḥ rathaḥ asmākam śaṁsaḥ abhi astu duḥ dhyaḥ tat ā jānīta uta puṣyata vacaḥ agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: May the chariot of him who presses Soma, be to the front 1, O gods. May our curse overcome the malicious ones. Accept (O gods) this prayer and make it prosper. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: vadhaiḥ duḥ śaṁsān apa duḥ dhyaḥ jahi dūre vā ye anti vā ke cit atri ṇaḥ atha yajñāya gr̥ṇate su gam kr̥dhi agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: Strike away with thy weapons those who curse us, the malicious ones, all ghouls, be they near or afar. And make a good path to the sacrifice of him who praises thee. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: yat ayukthāḥ aruṣā rohitā rathe vāta jūtā vr̥ṣabhasya iva te āt invasi vaninaḥ dhūma ketunā agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: When thou hast yoked to thy chariot the two ruddy, red horses, whom the wind drives forward, and thy roaring is like that of a bull, then thou movest the trees with thy banner of smoke 1. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: adha svanāt uta bibhyuḥ patatriṇaḥ drapsā yat te yavasa adaḥ vi asthiran su gam tat te tāvakebhyaḥ rathebhyaḥ agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: And when thy grass-consuming sparks are scattered, the winged (birds) 1 also fear the noise. Then all goes well with thee and thy chariots. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: ayam mitrasya varuṇasya dhāyase ava yātām marutām hel̥aḥ adbhutaḥ mr̥l̥a su naḥ bhūtu eṣām manaḥ punaḥ agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: He makes Mitra and Varuna get refreshing drink. He mysteriously turns away the anger of the Maruts 1. Be merciful towards us. May their mind be again (as it was before). Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: devaḥ devānām asi mitraḥ adbhutaḥ vasuḥ vasūnām asi cāruḥ adhvare śarman syāma tava saprathaḥ tame agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: Thou art god of the gods, a wonderful Mitra (i. e. friend, of the gods) 1. Thou art the Vasu of the Vasus, welcome at the sacrifice. May we be under thy most wide-reaching protection. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: tat te bhadram yat sam iddhaḥ sve dame soma āhutaḥ jarase mr̥l̥ayat tamaḥ dadhāsi ratnam draviṇam ca dāśuṣe agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava
column2: That is thy glorious (nature) that when kindled in thy own house, and fed with Soma, thou art awake 1, the most merciful one. Thou bestowest treasures and wealth on the worshipper. Agni! May we suffer no harm in thy friendship.

column1: yasmai tvam su draviṇaḥ dadāśaḥ anāgāḥ tvam adite sarva tātā yam bhadreṇa śavasā codayāsi prajāvatā rādhasā te syāma
column2: May we be of those to whom thou, O possessor of beautiful wealth, O Aditi 1, art pleased to grant sinlessness in health and wealth 2, and whom thou wilt quicken with glorious strength and with abundance of progeny.

column1: saḥ tvam agne saubhaga tvasya vidvān asmākam āyuḥ pra tira iha deva tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ mamahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pr̥thivī uta dyauḥ
column2: Do thou, O Agni, thou who knowest (how to grant) happiness, prolong our life here, O God! May Mitra and Varuna grant us this, may Aditi, the Sindhu, the Earth, and the Sky 1!

column1: dve virūpeitivi rūpe carataḥ svartheitisu arthe anyāanyā vatsam upa dhāpayeteiti hariḥ anyasyām bhavati svadhāvān śukraḥ anyasyām dadr̥śe su varcāḥ
column2: Two (sisters) of different shapes wander along, pursuing a good aim. The one and the other suckles the calf 1. With the one (the calf) is golden, moving according to its wont 2. With the other it is seen clear, full of fine splendour.

column1: daśa imam tvaṣṭuḥ janayanta garbham atandrāsaḥ yuvatayaḥ vi bhr̥tram tigma anīkam sva yaśasam janeṣu vi rocamānam pari sīm nayanti
column2: The ten unwearied 1 young women 2 have brought forth this widely-spread germ of Tvashtri 3. Him, the sharp-faced (Agni) who is endowed with his own splendour, the shining one, they 4 carry around among men.

column1: trīṇi jānā pari bhūṣanti asya samudre ekam divi ekam ap su pūrvām anu pra diśam pārthivānām r̥tūn pra śāsat vi dadhau anuṣṭhu
column2: They celebrate his three births: one in the sea, one in heaven, one in the waters 1. In the eastern region 2 he commanding determines the seasons of the dwellers on earth by his present power 3.

column1: kaḥ imam vaḥ niṇyam ā ciketa vatsaḥ mātr̥r̥ḥ janayata sva dhābhiḥ bahvīnām garbhaḥ apasām upa sthāt mahān kaviḥ niḥ carati svadhāvān
column2: Who among you has understood this hidden (god)? 1 The calf has by itself given birth to its mothers 2. The germ of many (mothers), the great seer, moving by his own strength, comes forward from the lap of the active ones 3.

column1: iti tvaṣṭuḥ bibhyatuḥ jāyamānāt pratīcī iti siṁham prati joṣayeteiti
column2: 1 The fair (child Agni) grows up visibly in them in his own glory, standing erect in the lap of the down-streaming (waters). Both (Heaven and Earth) fled away in fear of (the son of) Tvashtri 2, when he was born, but turning back they caress the lion.

column1: ubhe iti bhadre iti joṣayeteiti na mene gāvaḥ na vāśrāḥ upa tasthuḥ evaiḥ saḥ dakṣāṇām dakṣa patiḥ babhūva añjanti yam dakṣiṇataḥ haviḥ bhiḥ
