column2: They have spread with might the eastward-turned sacrificial grass, blessing (our tribe) with a thousand men 1, (at the place) where you reign, O Âdityas!

column1: virāṭ samrāṭ vibhvīḥ pra bhvīḥ bahvīḥ ca bhūyasīḥ ca yāḥ duraḥ ghr̥tāni akṣaran
column2: The Prince, the Sovereign, the mighty ones, the eminent ones 1, the (Divine) Doors, which are many and more than many, have sent forth streams of ghee.

column1: surukmeitisu rukme hi su peśasā adhi śriyā vi rājataḥ uṣasau ā iha sīdatām
column2: Adorned with gold, wearing beautiful ornaments you verily reign high 1 in your splendour. Sit down here, ye two Dawns 2.

column1: prathamā hi su vācasā hotārā daivyā kavī iti yajñam naḥ yakṣatām imam
column2: May the two fine-voiced divine Hotris, the sages, perform as the first this sacrifice for us.

column1: bhārati il̥e sarasvati yāḥ vaḥ sarvāḥ upa bruve tāḥ naḥ codayata śriye
column2: Bhâratî! Ilâ! Sarasvatî! All ye (goddesses) whom I invoke, promote us to splendour.

column1: tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi hi pra bhuḥ paśūn viśvān sam ānaje teṣām naḥ sphātim ā yaja
column2: Tvashtri indeed, the eminent (god) has shaped all forms, all cattle. Do thou by sacrifice produce their increase.

column1: upa tmanyā vanaspate pāthaḥ devebhyaḥ sr̥ja agniḥ havyāni sisvadat
column2: Yield up by thyself, O tree, (the sacrificial food) to the abode of the gods 1. May Agni make the offerings relishable.

column1: puraḥ gāḥ agniḥ devānām gāyatreṇa sam ajyate svāhākr̥tīṣu rocate
column2: Agni going in front of the gods is anointed with this Gâyatra song; he shines when Svâhâ is pronounced (over the oblations).

column1: agne naya su pathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān yuyodhi asmat juhurāṇam enaḥ bhūyiṣṭhām te namaḥ uktim vidhema
column2: Agni! Lead us to wealth on a good path, O god who knowest all rules. Drive away from us sin which leads us astray. We will offer to thee the fullest praise.

column1: agne tvam pāraya navyaḥ asmān svasti bhiḥ ati duḥ gāṇi viśvā pūḥ ca pr̥thvī bahulā naḥ urvī bhava tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
column2: Agni! Thou who art young, help us safely across all difficulties. Be for us a broad, large, wide stronghold, for our kith and kin, with luck and weal 1.

column1: agne tvam asmat yuyodhi amīvāḥ anagni trāḥ abhi amanta kr̥ṣṭīḥ punaḥ asmabhyam suvitāya deva kṣām viśvebhiḥ amr̥tebhiḥ yajatra
column2: Agni! Drive away from us all plagues. (Then) they shall plague 1 peoples who do not stand under Agni's protection. (Give) us back again the earth, O god, together with all the immortals, O worshipful one, that it may go well with us.

column1: pāhi naḥ agne pāyu bhiḥ ajasraiḥ uta priye sadane ā śuśukvaan mā te bhayam jaritāram yaviṣṭha nūnam vidat mā aparam sahasvaḥ
column2: Protect us, Agni, with thy unwearied guardians, thou who flamest in thy beloved seat. May no danger, O youngest of the gods, attain thy praiser, not now nor in future, O mighty one!

column1: mā naḥ agne ava sr̥jaḥ aghāya aviṣyave ripave ducchunāyai mā datvate daśate mā adate naḥ mā rīṣate sahasāvan parā dāḥ
column2: Do not deliver us, O Agni, to the harmful foe, to the greedy one, to the impostor, to misfortune. Do not surrender us, O mighty one, to one who has teeth, who bites, nor to one who has no teeth, nor to one who will hurt us.

column1: vi gha tvāvān r̥ta jāta yaṁsat gr̥ṇanaḥ agne tanve varūtham viśvāt ri rikṣoḥ uta vā ninitsoḥ abhi hrutām asi hi deva viṣpaṭ
column2: May a (god) like thee, O Agni, who art born according to Rita, being praised spread out a shelter for the body (of the worshipper that protects) from every one who tries to harm or to revile him. For thou, O god, art a descrier 1 of everything that leads us astray.

column1: tvam tām agne ubhayān vi vidvān veṣi pra pitve manuṣaḥ yajatra abhi pitve manave śāsyaḥ bhūḥ marmr̥jenyaḥ uśik bhiḥ na akraḥ
column2: 1 Thou, O Agni, distinguishing both (kinds of men, the pious and the impious, or the Aryans and the Dasyus 2), eagerly approachest (Aryan) men at (the time of) the advancing (day) 3, O worshipful one. At (the time of) rest thou hast become governable to the man (or, to Manu; or, thou art to be praised by men 4); thou art to be smoothed down like a horse 5 by the Usigs.

column1: avocāma ni vacanāni asmin mānasya sūnuḥ sahasāne agnau vayam sahasram r̥ṣi bhiḥ sanema vidyāma iṣam vr̥janam jīra dānum
column2: We have pronounced our invocations, I the son of Mâna 1, before this mighty Agni. May we obtain (our wishes) through a thousand Rishis. May we find a food-giving … rich in quickening rain 2.

column1: tvam agne dyu bhiḥ tvam āśuśukṣaṇiḥ tvam at bhyaḥ tvam aśmanaḥ pari tvam vanebhyaḥ tvam oṣadhībhyaḥ tvam nr̥ṇām nr̥ pate jāyase śuciḥ
column2: 1 Thou, O Agni, the flaming one, (art born) from out the Heavens 2, thou (art born) from out the Waters and the stone (the flint); thou (art born) from out the forests and the herbs; thou art born bright, O Lord of men, (as belonging) to men 3.

column1: tava agne hotram tava potram r̥tviyam tava neṣṭram tvam agnit r̥ta yataḥ tava pra śāstram tvam adhvari yasi brahmā ca asi gr̥ṭha patiḥ ca naḥ dame
column2: 1 To thee, O Agni, belongs the Hotri's and the Potri's office exercised at the appointed season; to thee belongs the office of the Neshtri; thou art the Agnîdh 2 for the righteous. To thee belongs the office of the Prasâstri; thou actest as an Adhvaryu, and thou art the Brahman and the master of the house in our house 3.

column1: tvam agne indraḥ vr̥ṣabhaḥ satām asi tvam viṣṇuḥ uru gāyaḥ namasyaḥ tvam brahmā rayi vit brahmaṇaḥ pate tvam vidhartaritivi dhartaḥ sacase puram dhyā
column2: 1 Thou, O Agni, art Indra, a bull among (all) beings. Thou art the wide-ruling Vishnu, worthy of adoration. Thou art the Brahman, a gainer of wealth, O Brahmanaspati 2. Thou, O Vidhartri (i. e. who keepest asunder all things), art united with Puramdhi (or the Liberality of the gods) 3.

column1: tvam agne rājā varuṇaḥ dhr̥ta vrataḥ tvam mitraḥ bhavasi dasmaḥ īḍyaḥ tvam aryamā sat patiḥ yasya sam bhujam tvam aṁśaḥ vidathe deva bhājayuḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, art the king Varuna whose laws are firm; thou becomest Mitra, the wondrous one, worthy of being magnified. Thou art Aryaman, the lord of beings, whom I may enjoy 1. Thou, O god, art Amsa 2, desirous of distributing (goods) in the assembly 3.

column1: tvam agne tvaṣṭā vidhate su vīryam tava gnāvaḥ mitra mahaḥ sa jātyam tvam āśu hemā rariṣe su aśvyam tvam narām śardhaḥ asi puru vasuḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, being Tvashtri, (grantest) to thy worshipper abundance in heroes. To thee, who art accompanied by the (divine) wives 1, who art great like Mitra, belongs relationship 2. Thou, the quick inciter 3, givest abundance in horses. Thou, rich in wealth, art the host of men 4.

column1: tvam agne rudraḥ asuraḥ mahaḥ divaḥ tvam śardhaḥ mārutam pr̥kṣaḥ īśiṣe tvam vātaiḥ aruṇaiḥ yāsi śam gayaḥ tvam pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā
column2: Thou, O Agni, art Rudra, the Asura of the high Heaven 1; thou, being the host of the Maruts, rulest over nourishment. Thou goest along with the flame-coloured Winds, bringing happiness to our home. Thou, being Pûshan, protectest thy worshippers by thy own might.

column1: tvam agne draviṇaḥ dāḥ aram kr̥te tvam devaḥ savitā ratna dhāḥ asi tvam bhagaḥ nr̥ pate vasvaḥ īśiṣe tvam pāyuḥ dame yaḥ te avidhat
column2: Thou, O Agni, art a giver of wealth to him who does service to thee 1; thou art the god Savitri, a bestower of treasures. Thou, being Bhaga, O lord of men, rulest over wealth. Thou art a protector in his house to him who has worshipped thee. 2.

column1: tvām agne dame ā viśpatim viśaḥ tvām rājānam su vidatram r̥ñjate tvam viśvāni su anīka patyase tvam sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati
column2: Towards thee, in the house, the lord of the clan, O Agni, the clans strive, towards thee, the bounteous king. Thou with the beautiful face possessest all things. Thou art equal to thousands, to hundreds, to ten (of others).

column1: tvām agne pitaram iṣṭi bhiḥ naraḥ tvām bhrātrāya śamyā tanū rucam tvam putraḥ bhavasi yaḥ te avidhat tvam sakhā su śevaḥ pāsi ādhr̥ṣaḥ
column2: Thee, O Agni, men (make) their father by their sacrifices 1; thee who shinest with thy body they (invite) to brotherhood by their (sacrificial) work. Thou becomest a son to him who has worshipped thee. As a kind friend thou protectest against attack.

column1: tvam agne r̥bhuḥ āke namasyaḥ tvam vājasya kṣu mataḥ rāyaḥ īśiṣe tvam vi bhāsi anu dhakṣi dāvane tvam vi śikṣuḥ asi yajñam ātaniḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, art Ribhu, to be adored when near. Thou rulest over strength 1, over wealth rich in food. Thou shinest 2, thou burnest for the sake of giving (wealth). Thou art a hewer 3, an expander of sacrifice.

column1: tvam agne aditiḥ deva dāśuṣe tvam hotrā bhāratī vardhase girā tvam il̥ā śata himā asi dakṣase tvam vr̥tra hā vasu pate sarasvatī
column2: Thou, Agni, O god, art Aditi to the worshipper. Thou, being Hotrâ Bhâratî 1, growest strong by prayer. Thou art Idâ, living a hundred winters, for (the increase of) ability. Thou, the killer of Vritra, O Lord of wealth, art Sarasvatî 2.

column1: tvam agne su bhr̥taḥ ut tamam vayaḥ tava spārhe varṇe ā sam dr̥śi śriyaḥ tvam vājaḥ pra taraṇaḥ br̥han asi tvam rayiḥ bahulaḥ viśvataḥ pr̥thuḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, well kept, art the highest vital power. In thy lovely colour and in thy appearance (dwell all) beauties. Thou art great strength that carries us forward. Thou art abundant wealth, extending on all sides.

column1: tvām agne ādityāsaḥ āsyam tvām jihvām śucayaḥ cakrire kave tvām rāti sācaḥ adhvareṣu saścire tve iti devāḥ haviḥ adanti āhutam
column2: The Âdityas have made thee, O Agni, their mouth; the bright ones have made thee their tongue, O Sage. The Râti-sâk gods (i. e. the 'bounteous' gods) accompany thee at the sacrifices. In thee the gods eat the offering which is offered to them.

column1: tve iti agne viśve amr̥tāsaḥ adruhaḥ āsā devāḥ haviḥ adanti āhutam tvayā martāsaḥ svadante āsutim tvam garbhaḥ vīrudhām jajñiṣe śuciḥ
column2: In thee, O Agni, with (thy) mouth 1 all the guileless 2 immortal gods eat the offering which is offered to them. Through thee the mortals taste their drink. Thou hast been born, the bright one, as the child of the plants.

column1: tvam tān sam ca prati ca asi majmanā agne su jāta pra ca deva ri cyase pr̥kṣaḥ yat atra mahinā vi te bhuvat anu dyāvāpr̥thivī iti rodasī iti ubhe iti
column2: 1 Thou art united with them and equal to them in strength, O well-born Agni, nay, thou surpassest them, O god, when thy power 2 has expanded here in its greatness over Heaven and Earth, over both worlds.

column1: ye stotr̥ bhyaḥ go agrām aśva peśasam agne rātim upa sr̥janti sūrayaḥ asmān ca tān ca pra hi neṣi vasyaḥ ā br̥hat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
column2: The liberal lords who pour out, O Agni, over thy praisers gifts at the head of which there are cows 1, the ornament of which are horses: lead both ourselves and them to welfare. May we speak loud in the assembly 2, rich in valiant men.

column1: yajñena vardhata jāta vedasam agnim yajadhvam haviṣā tanā girā sam idhānam su prayasam svaḥ naram dyukṣam hotāram vr̥janeṣu dhūḥ sadam
column2: Increase Gâtavedas by your sacrifice 1, worship Agni for ever with your offering and your prayer 2—him who has been kindled, the receiver of good offerings, the solar hero, the heavenly Hotri, the charioteer 3 in our settlements 4.

column1: abhi tvā naktīḥ uṣasaḥ vavāśire agne vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ divaḥ iva it aratiḥ mānuṣā yugā ā kṣapaḥ bhāsi puru vāra sam yataḥ
column2: For thee Nights and Dawns have been lowing, O Agni, as milch-cows in the folds for their calf 1. A steward 2, as it were, of Heaven, thou shinest on the human tribes, O bountiful one, on continuous nights 3.

column1: taṁ devāḥ budhne rajasaḥ su daṁsasam divaḥpr̥thivyoḥ aratim ni er ire ratham iva vedyam śukra śociṣam agnim mitram na kṣitiṣu pra śaṁsyam
column2: The gods have set him to work, as a steward 1 of Heaven and Earth, endowed with wonderful power, at the bottom of the air: Agni who is well known like a chariot 2, brightly shining, deserving of praise like Mitra (or, like a friend) in (human) dwellings.

column1: tam ukṣamāṇam rajasi sve ā dame candram iva su rucam hvāre ā dadhuḥ pr̥śnyāḥ pataram citayantam akṣa bhiḥ pāthaḥ na pāyum janasī iti ubhe iti anu
column2: They have established him who grows in the air, in his house, the serpent 1 with beautiful splendour like gold 2, the winged (son?) of Prisni 3 who lights up with his eyes both tribes (of gods and of men), like a guardian of the way (?) 4.

column1: saḥ hotā viśvam pari bhūtu adhvaram tam oṁ iti havyaiḥ manuṣaḥ r̥ñjate girā hiri śipraḥ vr̥dhasānāsu jarbhurat dyauḥ na str̥ bhiḥ citayat rodasī iti anu
column2: May he, the Hotri, encompass the whole sacrifice. Men strive towards him with offerings and prayer. (Agni) with golden jaws 1, hurrying around in the growing (plants) 2, lighted up the two worlds like the Sky with the stars.

column1: saḥ naḥ revat sam idhānaḥ svastaye sam dadasvān rayim asmāsu dīdihi ā naḥ kr̥ṇuṣva suvitāya rodasī iti agne havyā manuṣaḥ deva vītaye
column2: Thus mayst thou, being brightly kindled for our welfare or being exhausted (?) 1, shine upon us with thy wealth. Carry hither to us the two worlds for the sake of happiness, Agni, O god, that they may eagerly partake 2 of the offering of the man (or, of Manus).

column1: dāḥ naḥ agne br̥hataḥ dāḥ sahasriṇaḥ duraḥ na vājam śrutyai apa vr̥dhi prācī iti dyāvāpr̥thivī iti brahmaṇā kr̥dhi svaḥ na śukram uṣasaḥ vi didyutuḥ
column2: Give us, Agni, mighty, give us thousandfold (gifts). Open strength for us like a door 1 for the sake of glory. Make Heaven and Earth inclined towards us through (our) spell. Make the Dawns shine like the brilliant Sun.

column1: saḥ idhānaḥ uṣasaḥ rāmyāḥ anu svaḥ na dīdet aruṣeṇa bhānunā hotrābhiḥ agniḥ manuṣaḥ su adhvaraḥ rājā viśām atithiḥ cāruḥ āyave
column2: Being kindled after dawns and nights may he shine with his red light like the sun, Agni, being a good sacrificer with the help of the offerings of man (or, of Manus) 1, the king of the clans, and the welcome guest of Âyu.

column1: eva naḥ / agne amr̥teṣu pūrvya dhīḥ pīpāya br̥hat diveṣu mānuṣā duhānā dhenuḥ vr̥janeṣu kārave tmanā śatinam puru rūpam iṣaṇi
column2: Thus, O Agni, ancient one, our human prayer has prospered among the immortals who dwell in the great heaven. May the cow 1 when milked, yield 2 freely to the singer in our settlements hundredfold (wealth) of all kinds.

column1: vayam agne arvatā vā su vīryam brahmaṇā vā citayema janān ati asmākam dyumnam adhi pañca kr̥ṣṭiṣu uccā svaḥ na śuśucīta dustaram
column2: May we, O Agni, (attain) bliss in valiant men by our racers, or may we shine over (all) people by our sacred spells. May our unconquerable lustre beam on high like the sun over the fivefold dwellings (of the five peoples).

column1: saḥ naḥ bodhi sahasya pra śaṁsyaḥ yasmin su jātāḥ iṣayanta sūrayaḥ yam agne yajñam upa yanti vājinaḥ nitye toke dīdi vāṁsam sve dame
column2: Be thou, O mighty one, worthy of praise among us, (thou) from whom the well-born, liberal (lords) have sought nourishment 1, unto whom the strong ones, O Agni, go for sacrifice, who shinest in thy abode among (the worshipper's) own kith.

column1: ubhayāsaḥ jāta vedaḥ syāma te stotāraḥ agne sūrayaḥ ca śarmaṇi vasvo rāyaḥ puru candrasya bhūyasaḥ prajāvataḥ su apatyasya śagdhi naḥ
column2: May we both, O Gâtavedas, the praisers and the liberal (lords), be in thy protection, O Agni. Help us to good, resplendent, abundant wealth which is accompanied by offspring, by good progeny.

column1: sam iddhaḥ agniḥ ni hitaḥ pr̥thivyām pratyaṅ viśvāni bhuvanāni asthāt hotā pāvakaḥ pra divaḥ su medhāḥ devaḥ devān yajatu agniḥ arhan
column2: Agni being kindled, set down on the earth, has stood up with his face towards all worlds. May the Hotri, the purifier, the ancient, wise one, may god Agni sacrifice to the gods, he who is worthy (of being the sacrificer).

column1: narāśaṁsaḥ prati dhāmāni añjan tisraḥ divaḥ prati mahnā su arci ḥ ghr̥ta pruṣā manasā havyam undan mūrdhan yajñasya sam anaktu devān
column2: Narâsamsa, anointing the abodes (of the sacrifice), equal by his greatness to the three heavens, endowed with beautiful light, moistening the offering, his mind being intent on scattering ghrita—may he anoint the gods on the summit of sacrifice.

column1: īl̥itaḥ agne manasā naḥ arhan devān yakṣi mānuṣāt pūrvaḥ adya saḥ ā vaha marutām śardhaḥ acyutam indram naraḥ barhi sadam yajadhvam
column2: Being magnified 1 in our mind, Agni, sacrifice for us to-day to the gods before the human (sacrificer) 2, thou who art worthy (of being the sacrificer). Conduct hither the unshakable host of the Maruts. Sacrifice, O men, to Indra who sits on the Barhis.

column1: deva barhiḥ vardhamānam su vīram stīrṇam rāye su bharam vedī iti asyām ghr̥tena aktam vasavaḥ sīdata idam viśve devāḥ ādityāḥ yajñiyāsaḥ
column2: O divine Barhis! On this (Barhis) which is large, rich in valiant men, which has been spread on this Vedi (or sacrificial altar) rich in gain, ready for wealth, which is anointed with ghrita, sit down, O Vasus, O Visve devâs, O Âdityas 1 worthy of worship!

column1: vi śrayantām urviyā hūyamānāḥ dvāraḥ devīḥ supra ayanāḥ namaḥ bhiḥ vyacasvatīḥ vi prathantām ajuryāḥ varṇam punānāḥ yaśasam su vīram
column2: May the divine doors which are easily passable, open themselves wide when invoked with adoration. May they, the far-embracing, undecaying ones, open wide, purifying our glorious race 1 which is rich in valiant men.

column1: sādhu apāṁsi sanatā naḥ ukṣite iti uṣasānaktā vayyāiva raṇvite iti tantum tatam saṁvayantī itisam vayantī samīcī itisam īcī yajñasya peśaḥ sudugheitisu dughe payasvatī iti
column2: May Dawn and Night, grown strong from of old, joyful like two birds (?) 1, (do) their work well for us—they who weave, turned towards each other, the stretched-out warp, the ornamented form of the sacrifice 2, (the two goddesses) flowing with plenty, rich in milk.

column1: daivyā hotārā prathamā viduḥ tarā r̥ju yakṣataḥ sam r̥cā vapuḥ tarā devān yajantau r̥tu thā sam añjataḥ nābhā pr̥thivyāḥ adhi sānuṣu triṣu
column2: May the two divine Hotris, the first ones, very knowing, very marvellous, perform the sacrifice rightly with their (sacrificial) verse. Sacrificing to the gods they anoint (them) 1, observing the right time, on the navel of the Earth, over the three ridges (of the three worlds).

column1: sarasvatī sādhayantī dhiyam naḥ il̥ā devī bhāratī viśva tūrtiḥ tisraḥ devīḥ svadhayā barhiḥ ā idam acchidram pāntu śaraṇam ni sadya
column2: May Sarasvatî, the accomplisher of our prayer, may the goddess Ilâ, all-victorious Bhâratî—may the three goddesses, according to their wont, sit down on this Barhis and protect it, the faultless shelter.

column1: piśaṅga rūpaḥ su bharaḥ vayaḥ dhāḥ śruṣṭī vīraḥ jāyate deva kāmaḥ pra jām tvaṣṭā vi syatu nābhim asme iti atha devānām api etu pāthaḥ
column2: Through (the god's) hearing (our prayer) a manly son is born (to us), tawny-coloured, rich in gain, bringing vigour, loving the gods. May Tvashtri deliver for us a son, the navel (i. e. the tie that binds generations together), and may he then go to the abode of the gods.

column1: vanaspatiḥ ava sr̥jan upa sthāt agniḥ haviḥ sūdayāti pra dhībhiḥ tridhā sam aktam nayatu pra jānan devebhyaḥ daivyaḥ śamitā upa havyam
column2: 1 May the tree (i. e. the sacrificial post) stand by, letting loose (the offering which goes to the gods). May Agni make the offering ready in consequence of our prayers. May the prescient divine butcher carry the thrice-anointed offering to the gods.

column1: ghr̥tam mimikṣe ghr̥tam asya yoniḥ ghr̥te śritaḥ ghr̥tam oṁ iti asya dhāma anu svadham ā vaha mādayasva svāhākr̥tam vr̥ṣabha vakṣi havyam
column2: He 1 is joined with ghrita 2. His womb (on the altar) is ghrita. He rests on ghrita. His abode is ghrita. Carry hither (the gods) according to thy wont! Rejoice 3! Carry, O bull, the offering, over which the Svâhâ has been spoken, (to the gods).

column1: huve vaḥ su dyotmānam su vr̥ktim viśām agnim atithim su prayasam m itraḥ iva yaḥ didhiṣāyyaḥ bhūt devaḥ ādeve jane jāta vedāḥ
column2: I call for you Agni, shining with beautiful shine, praised with beautiful praise 1, the guest of the clans, the receiver of fine offerings, who is desirable like Mitra (or, like an ally), Gâtavedas the god, among godly people.

column1: imam vidhantaḥ apām sadha sthe dvitā adadhuḥ bhr̥gavaḥ vikṣu āyoḥ eṣaḥ viśvāni abhi astu bhūma devānām agniḥ aratiḥ jīra aśvaḥ
column2: The Bhrigus worshipping him in the abode of the waters 1 have verily 2 established him among the clans of Âyu. Let him surpass all worlds, Agni, the steward of the gods 3, the possessor of quick horses.

column1: agnim devāsaḥ mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyam dhuḥ kṣeṣyantaḥ na mitram saḥ dīdayat uśatīḥ ūrmyāḥ ā dakṣāyyaḥ yaḥ dāsvate dame ā
column2: The gods have established beloved Agni among the human clans as (people) going to settle (establish) Mitra 1. May he illuminate the nights that are longing (for him), he who should be treated kindly by the liberal (worshipper) in his house.

column1: asya raṇvā svasya iva puṣṭiḥ sam dr̥ṣṭiḥ asya hiyānasya dhakṣoḥ vi yaḥ bharibhrat oṣadhīṣu jihvām atyaḥ na rathyaḥ dodhavīti vārān
column2: His prosperity is delightful as good pasture (?) 1; delightful is his appearance when the burning one is driven forward, he who quickly shaking his tongue among the plants waves 2 his tail mightily like a chariot-horse.

column1: ā yat me abhvam vanadaḥ pananta uśik bhyaḥ na amimīta varṇam saḥ citreṇa cikite ram su bhāsā jujurvān yaḥ muhuḥ ā yuvā bhūt
column2: When they praised 1 to me the monstrous might of the eater of the forests 2, he produced his (shining) colour as (he has done) for the Usigs 3. With shining splendour he has shone joyously, he who having grown old has suddenly become young (again).

column1: ā yaḥ vanā tatr̥ṣāṇaḥ na bhāti vāḥ na pathā rathyāiva svānīt kr̥ṣṇa adhvā tapuḥ raṇvaḥ ciketa dyauḥ iva smayamānaḥ nabhaḥ bhiḥ
column2: He who shines on the forests 1 as if he were thirsty, who resounded like water on its path, like (the rattle of the wheels) of a chariot 2—he whose path is black, the hot, the joyous one has shone, laughing 3 like the sky with its clouds.

column1: saḥ yaḥ vi asthāt abhi dhakṣat urvīṁ paśuḥ na eti sva yuḥ agopāḥ agniḥ śociṣmān atasān yuṣṇan kr̥ṣṇa vyathiḥ asvadayat na bhūma
column2: He who has spread himself burning over the wide (earth), moves about like an animal, free, without a keeper. The naming Agni, burning down the brushwood, with a black trail 1, has, as it were, tasted the earth.

column1: nu te pūrvasya avasaḥ adhi itau tr̥tīye vidathe manma śaṁsi asme iti agne saṁyat vīram br̥hantam kṣu mantam vājam su apatyam rayim dāḥ
column2: Now in the remembrance of thy former blessings this prayer has been recited to thee at the third sacrifice 1. Give to us, Agni, mighty strength with a succession of valiant men, with plenty of food; (give us) wealth with good progeny 2.

column1: tvayā yathā gr̥tsa madāsaḥ agne guhā vanvantaḥ uparān abhi syuritisyuḥ su vīrāsaḥ abhimāti sahaḥ smat sūri bhyaḥ gr̥ṇate tat vayaḥ dhāḥ
column2: Give, O Agni, such vigour to thy praiser together with his liberal (lords), that the Gritsamadas, rich in valiant men, victorious over hostile plots, attaining (their aim) in secret, may overcome through thee (their rivals) who get behind 1.

column1: hotā ajaniṣṭa cetanaḥ pitā pitr̥ bhyaḥ ūtaye pra yakṣan jenyam vasu śakema vājinaḥ yamam
column2: The brilliant Hotri 1 has been born 2, the father to protect the fathers 3, aspiring after noble wealth. May we be able to bridle the strong (horse) 4.

column1: ā yasmin sapta raśmayaḥ tatāḥ yajñasya netari manuṣvat daivyam aṣṭamam potā viśvam tat invati
column2: He the leader of the sacrifice towards whom the seven reins (or rays) are stretched, the Potri promotes, as (he has done) for Manu, the divine eighth (rein); all those (reins he promotes) 1.

column1: dadhanve vā yat īm anu vocat brahmāṇi veḥ oṁ iti tat pari viśvāni kāvyā nemiḥ cakram iva abhavat
column2: Or when he has run along, and has recited the sacred words 1, and has pursued that (duty) 2, he has encompassed every kind of wisdom as the felly (encircles) the wheel.

column1: sākam hi śucinā śuciḥ pra śāstā kratunā ajani vidvān asya vratā dhruvā vayāḥ iva anu rohate
column2: For He has been born as the bright Prasâstri, with bright power of mind. (A man) who knows his firm laws, mounts up on them as on the branches (of a tree) 1.

column1: tāḥ asya varṇam āyuvaḥ neṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenavaḥ kuvit tisr̥ bhyaḥ ā varam svasāraḥ yāḥ idam yayuḥ
column2: The lively milch-cows were attached to his, the Neshtri's, (bright) colour 1. Was it according to the wish of the three sisters who have gone there 2?

column1: yadi mātuḥ upa svasā ghr̥tam bharantī asthita tāsām adhvaryuḥ āgatau yavaḥ vr̥ṣṭī iva modate
column2: When (coming) from the mother the sister has approached, bringing ghrita 1, the Adhvaryu rejoices at their 2 coming as corn (rejoices) at rain.

column1: svaḥ svāya dhāyase kr̥ṇutām r̥tvik r̥tvijam stomam yajñam ca āt aram vanema rarima vayam
column2: May He the Ritvig (priest) himself make the Ritvig (serve) for his own refreshment 1. And may we readily gain the praise and the sacrifice 2; we have offered it.

column1: yathā vidvān aram karat viśvebhyaḥ yajatebhyaḥ ayam agne tve iti api yam yajñam cakr̥ma vayam
column2: In order that He the knowing one (Agni) may readily serve all the worshipful (gods), this sacrifice, O Agni, which we have performed, rests in thee.

column1: imām me agne sam idham imām upa sadam vaneritivaneḥ imāḥ oṁ iti su śrudhi giraḥ
column2: Accept, O Agni, this my piece of wood and this my sitting down (reverentially) 1, and hear these words of mine.

column1: ayā te agne vidhema ūrjaḥ napāt aśvam iṣṭe enā su uktena su jāta
column2: Let us worship thee, Agni, child of vigour, with this (piece of wood?) 1, O winner of horses 2, with this well-spoken (hymn), O well-born one.

column1: tam tvā gīḥ bhiḥ girvaṇasam draviṇasyum draviṇaḥ daḥ saparyema saparyavaḥ
column2: May we thus as thy devoted servants pay devotion by our words to thee who acceptest words (of prayer), to thee who aspirest after wealth, O giver of wealth.

column1: saḥ bodhi sūriḥ maghavā vasu pate vasu dāvan yuyodhi asmat dveṣāṁsi
column2: Thus be thou a liberal, bountiful lord, O lord of goods, O giver of goods. Drive hatred away from us.

column1: saḥ naḥ vr̥ṣṭim divaḥ pari saḥ naḥ vājam anarvāṇam saḥ naḥ sahasriṇīḥ iṣaḥ
column2: Thus (give) us 1 rain from the sky; thus (give) us unattainable strength; thus (give) us thousandfold food.

column1: īl̥ānāya avasyave yaviṣṭha dūta naḥ girā yajiṣṭha hotaḥ ā gahi
column2: To him who magnifies thee, who desires thy help, O youngest messenger, (invoked) by our word, best sacrificing Hotri, come near.

column1: antaḥ hi agne īyase vidvān janma ubhayā kave dūtaḥ janyāiva mitryaḥ
column2: For thou, Agni, O sage, who knowest both races (of gods and of men), passest (to and fro) between them, like a messenger belonging to thy own people 1, belonging to thy allies.

column1: saḥ vidvān ā ca piprayaḥ yakṣi cikitvaḥ ānuṣak ā ca asmin satsi barhiṣi
column2: Thus gladden (the gods) 1 as the knowing one; sacrifice, O intelligent one, in due order, and sit down on this Barhis.

column1: śreṣṭham yaviṣṭha bhārata agne dyu mantam ā bhara vaso iti puru spr̥ham rayim
column2: Bring us, O youngest god, Bhârata 1, Agni, the best, resplendent, much-desired wealth, O Vasu 2!

column1: mā naḥ arātiḥ īśata devasya martyasya ca parṣi tasyāḥ uta dviṣaḥ
column2: May no malign power of a god or of a mortal overcome us. Help us across such hostile power.

column1: viśvāḥ uta tvayā vayam dhārāḥ udanyāḥ iva ati gāhemahi dviṣaḥ
column2: And may we dive with thee across all hostile powers as across streams of water.

column1: śuciḥ pāvaka vandyaḥ agne br̥hat vi rocase tvam ghr̥tebhiḥ āhutaḥ
column2: Bright, O purifier, worthy of adoration, Agni, thou shinest mightily; thou hast been worshipped by offerings of ghrita 1.

column1: tvam naḥ asi bhārata agne vaśābhiḥ ukṣa bhiḥ aṣṭāpadībhiḥ āhutaḥ
column2: Thou, O Bhârata 1, Agni! hast been worshipped by us with offerings of heifers, of bulls, of eight-footed (cows) 2.

column1: dru annaḥ sarpiḥ āsutiḥ pratnaḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ sahasaḥ putraḥ adbhutaḥ
column2: The old excellent Hotri who feeds on wood and drinks butter, he is the wonderful son of strength.

column1: vājayan iva nu rathān yogān agneḥ upa stuhi yaśaḥ tamasya mīl̥huṣaḥ
column2: As one who runs a race 1 (praises) his chariots, praise thou the yoking of Agni (to the chariot of sacrifice), of the most glorious, bountiful (god)—

column1: yaḥ su nīthaḥ dadāśuṣe/ ajuryaḥ jarayan arim cāru pratīkaḥ āhutaḥ
column2: Who is the best leader for his worshipper, who undecaying makes the malign decay 1, the cheerful-faced who has been worshipped with offerings—

column1: yaḥ oṁ iti śriyā dameṣu ā doṣā uṣasi pra śasyate yasya vratam na mīyate
column2: He who is praised in the houses on account of his beauty in the evening and at dawn, whose law is not set at nought,

column1: ā yaḥ svaḥ na bhānunā citraḥ vi bhāti arciṣā añjānaḥ ajaraiḥ abhi
column2: The bright one who shines with his light as the Sun with his splendour, with his undecaying (flames) 1, he who is anointed (with ghrita).

column1: atrim anu sva rājyam agnim ukthāni vavr̥dhuḥ viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ dadhe
column2: The hymns have strengthened Agni the devourer 1 along (the extent of) his own royalty 2. He has assumed every beauty.

column1: agneḥ indrasya somasya devānām ūti bhiḥ vayam ariṣyantaḥ sacemahi abhi syāma pr̥tanyataḥ
column2: May we unharmed stand under the protection of Agni, Indra, Soma, of the gods; may we overcome our foes.

column1: ni hotā hotr̥ sadane vidānaḥ tveṣaḥ dīdi vān asadat su dakṣaḥ adabdha vratapramatiḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ sahasram bharaḥ śuci jihvaḥ agniḥ
column2: The Hotri who is found on the Hotri's seat has sat down (there), the fierce, the resplendent, the dexterous one, the protector of (his own) infallible laws 1, the highest Vasu, he who brings thousandfold (gain), the pure-tongued Agni.

column1: tvam dūtaḥ tvam oṁ iti naḥ paraḥ pāḥ tvam vasyaḥ ā vr̥ṣabha pra netā agne tokasya naḥ tane tanūnām apra yucchan dīdyat bodhi gopāḥ
column2: Be thou our messenger, be our protector far and wide; be thou, O bull, a leader towards greater wealth. O Agni! for the continuation of our children and of ourselves be thou an unremitting, brilliant protector.

column1: vidhema te parame janman agne vidhema stomaiḥ avare sadha sthe yasmāt yoneḥ ut āritha yaje tam pra tve iti havīṁṣi juhure sam iddhe
column2: May we worship thee at thy highest birth (-place), O Agni; may we worship thee with praises in thy lower abode. I honour the womb from which thou hast sprung. When thou hast been kindled, they have offered offerings in thee.

column1: agne yajasva haviṣā yajīyān śruṣṭī deṣṇam abhi gr̥ṇīhi rādhaḥ tvam h i asi rayi patiḥ rayīṇām tvam śukrasya vacasaḥ manotā
column2: Agni, being the best sacrificer perform thou the sacrifice with the oblation. With thy readiness to hear (us) hail our gift, the wealth (which we offer). For thou art the treasure-lord of treasures; thou art the deviser of brilliant speech.

column1: ubhayam te na kṣīyate vasavyam dive dive jāyamānasya dasma kr̥dhi kṣu mantam jaritāram agne kr̥dhi patim su apatyasya rāyaḥ
column2: Thy wealth of both kinds 1 never fails, when thou art born (kindled) day by day, O wonderful one. Make thy singer, O Agni, rich in food; make him the lord of wealth with excellent offspring.

column1: saḥ enā anīkena su vidatraḥ asme iti yaṣṭā devān āyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti adabdhaḥ gopāḥ uta naḥ paraḥ pāḥ agne dyu mat uta revat didīhi
column2: With this face of thine, as a bounteous (lord), a sacrificer to the gods, the best performer of sacrifices with happiness, as an undeceivable guardian and far-reaching protector, shine among us, O Agni, with light and wealth.

column1: johūtraḥ agniḥ prathamaḥ pitāiva il̥aḥ pade manuṣā yat sam iddhaḥ śriyam vasānaḥ amr̥taḥ vi cetāḥ marmr̥jenyaḥ śravasyaḥ saḥ vājī
column2: Agni is to be invoked as the first like a father, when he has been inflamed by Manus 1 in the abode of Id 2. When he has invested himself with beauty, the wise immortal, he, the glorious strong (horse) is to be smoothed (by the worshippers as by grooms).

column1: śruyāḥ agniḥ citra bhānuḥ havam me viśvābhiḥ gīḥ bhiḥ amr̥taḥ vi cetāḥ śyāvā ratham vahataḥ rohitā vā uta aruṣā aha cakre vi bhr̥traḥ
column2: Agni with bright splendour, mayest thou hear my call with all my prayers, thou a wise immortal. The two tawny (horses) draw thy chariot or the two red (horses), or He the wide-ranging one has made the two ruddy (horses draw his chariot) 1.

column1: uttānāyām ajanayan su sūtam bhuvat agniḥ puru peśāsu garbhaḥ śiriṇāyām cit aktunā mahaḥ bhiḥ apari vr̥taḥ vasati pra cetāḥ
column2: They have generated the well-born (Agni) in her who lies on her back 1. Agni became a germ in the manifoldly-adorned (wives) 2. Even in the … 3 the wise one dwells by night uncovered in his powers 4.

column1: jigharmi agnim haviṣā ghr̥tena prati kṣiyantam bhuvanāni viśvā pr̥thum t iraścā vayasā br̥hantam vyaciṣṭham annaiḥ rabhasam dr̥śānam
column2: I besprinkle with my offering, with Ghrita, Agni who abides turned towards all beings, who widely extends throughout, who is mighty in his vigour, who shows himself most capacious by the food (which he consumes), and robust 1.

column1: ā viśvataḥ pratyañcam jigharmi arakṣasā manasā tat juṣeta marya śrīḥ spr̥hayat varṇaḥ agniḥ na abhi mr̥śe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ
column2: I besprinkle Him who is turned towards (us) from all sides; may he gladly accept that with his benevolent mind. Agni, who is like a beautiful youth, who has the appearance of one eagerly striving, is not to be touched, when he hurries around with his body.

column1: jñeyāḥ bhāgam sahasānaḥ vareṇa tvādūtāsaḥ manu vat vadema anūnam agnim juhvā vacasyā madhu pr̥cam dhana sāḥ johavīmi
column2: Mayst thou know the portion (belonging to thee), being strong through thy desire. With thee as our messenger may we speak like Manu. Gaining wealth 1 I invoke with my (sacrificial) ladle, with my eloquence, the faultless Agni who mixes the honey-drink.

column1: somasya mā tavasam vakṣi agne vahnim cakartha vidathe yajadhyai devān accha dīdyat yuñje adrim śam āye agne tanvam juṣasva
column2: Thou wilt have me, O Agni, as a strong (master) of Soma 1: therefore thou hast made me the carrier (of the gods?) to perform worship at the sacrifice 2. Sending my thoughts to the gods 3 I make the (press-) stone ready 4; I toil, O Agni: find thou pleasure in thy own body 5.

column1: prāñcam yajñam cakr̥ma vardhatām gīḥ samit bhiḥ agnim namasā duvasyan divaḥ śaśāsuḥ vidathā kavīnām gr̥sāya cit tavase gātum īṣuḥ
column2: 1 Eastward we have turned the sacrifice 2; may the prayer increase. They honoured Agni with fuel and adoration. They have taught (him) the sacrificial ordinances of the sages of Heaven 3. Though he (Agni) is clever and strong, they have sought a way for him.

column1: mayaḥ dadhe medhiraḥ pūta dakṣaḥ divaḥ su bandhuḥ januṣā pr̥thivyāḥ avindan oṁ iti darśatam ap su antaḥ devāsaḥ agnim apasi svasr̥r̥ṇām
column2: He has conceived freshness 1, the wise one of pure 2 powers, he who is by his birth well allied with Heaven and Earth. The gods have found Agni the conspicuous one in the waters, in the work 3 of the sisters.

column1: avardhayan su bhagam sapta yahvīḥ śvetam jajñānam aruṣam mahi tvā śiśum na jātam abhi āruḥ aśvāḥ devāsaḥ agnim janiman vapuṣyan
column2: The seven young (wives) 1 made the blessed one grow who had been born white, ruddy in his growth. They ran up to him like mares 2 to a newborn foal. The gods wondered at Agni at his birth.

column1: śukrebhiḥ aṅgaiḥ rajaḥ ātatanvān kratum punānaḥ kavi bhiḥ pavitraiḥ śociḥ vasānaḥ pari āyuḥ apām śriyaḥ mimīte br̥hatīḥ anūnāḥ
column2: Spreading with his bright limbs to the aerial space, purifying his power 1 by wise purifications, clothing himself in light, the life of the waters 2, he creates mighty, perfect beauty.

column1: vavrāja sīm anadatīḥ adabdhāḥ divaḥ yahvīḥ avasānāḥ anagnāḥ sanāḥ atra yuvatayaḥ sa yonīḥ ekam garbham dadhire sapta vāṇīḥ
column2: He has gone to (the waters) who do not eat, the undeceived ones, the young (daughters) of Heaven who are not clothed and (yet) are not naked. Here the former young (women) having the same origin, the seven sounds 1 have conceived one germ.

column1: stīrṇāḥ asya sam hataḥ viśva rūpā ghr̥tasya yonau sravathe madhūnām asthuḥ atra dhenavaḥ pinvamānāḥ mahī iti dasmasya mātarā samīcī itisam īcī
column2: His compact masses assuming every shape are spread in the womb of ghee, in the streaming of honey. There the swelling milch-cows have stationed themselves. Great are the parents of the wonderfully mighty (Agni) who are turned towards each other 1.

column1: babhrāṇaḥ sūno iti sahasaḥ vi adyaut dadhānaḥ śukrā rabhasā vapūṁṣi ścotanti dhārāḥ madhunaḥ ghr̥tasya vr̥ṣā yatra vavr̥dhe kāvyena
column2: Having been carried (in the waters) thou hast shone forth, O son of strength, assuming wonderful shapes brilliant and fierce. The streams of honey and ghee drip, where the male has grown by wisdom.

column1: pituḥ cit ūdhaḥ januṣā viveda vi asya dhārāḥ asr̥jat vi dhenāḥ guhā carantam sakhi bhiḥ śivebhiḥ divaḥ yahvībhiḥ na guhā babhūva
column2: By (his) nature he has found his father's udder 1; he has sent forth his streams and his showers 2. Walking 3 hidden to his dear friends he has not been hidden to the young (daughters) of Heaven 4.

column1: pituḥ ca garbham janituḥ ca babhre pūrvīḥ ekaḥ adhayat pīpyānāḥ vr̥ṣṇe sapatnī itisapatnī śucaye sabandhū itisa bandhū ubhe iti asmai manuṣye iti ni pāhi
column2: He bore (in his womb) the germ of the sire, of the father who begat him 1. He, being one, sucked many (nurses) rich in milk 2. Observe for this manly, bright one the two wives bound in kinship, belonging to men 3.

column1: urau mahān ani bādhe vavardha āpaḥ agnim yaśasaḥ sam hi pūrvīḥ r̥tasya yonau aśayat damūnāḥ jāmīnām agniḥ apasi svasr̥r̥r̥ṇām
column2: The great one has grown up in the wide unbounded space 1. The Waters (have made) Agni (grow): for many glorious ones 2 (have come) together 3. He lay in the womb of Rita, the domestic (god) Agni, in the work 4 of the uterine sisters.

column1: akraḥ na babhriḥ sam ithe mahīnām didr̥kṣeyaḥ sūnave bhāḥ r̥jīkaḥ ut usriyāḥ janitā yaḥ jajāna apām garbhaḥ nr̥ tamaḥ yahvaḥ agniḥ
column2: Like a horse that carries (the prize), in the assembly of the great (waters) 1, visible to his son 2, he whose … is light 3: he who as father begat the ruddy cows 4, he the son of the waters is the most manly, restless 5 Agni.

column1: apām garbham darśatam oṣadhīnām vanā jajāna su bhagā vi rūpam devāsaḥ cit manasā sam hi jagmuḥ paniṣṭham jātam tavasam duvasyan
column2: To him, the glorious son of the waters and of the plants, the blessed wood 1 has given birth, in his many shapes. Even the gods, for they agreed in their mind, honoured him who had been born the most wonderful and strong.

column1: br̥hantaḥ it bhānavaḥ bhāḥ r̥jīkam agnim sacanta vi dyutaḥ na śukrāḥ guhāiva vr̥ddham sadasi sve antaḥ apāre ūrve amr̥tam duhānāḥ
column2: Mighty rays of light like brilliant lightnings, milking (the sap of) immortality in the boundless stable, accompanied Agni whose … is light 1, who had grown up in his own house, as it were in secret.

column1: īl̥e ca tvā yajamānaḥ haviḥ bhiḥ īl̥e sakhi tvam su matim ni kāmaḥ devaiḥ avaḥ mimīhi sam jaritre rakṣa ca naḥ damye bhiḥ anīkaiḥ
column2: I magnify thee, worshipping thee with offerings; I magnify (thee) desirous of thy friendship, of thy favour. Together with the gods give help to him who praises thee, and protect us with thy domestic faces.

column1: upa kṣetāraḥ tava su pranīte agne viśvāni dhanyā dadhānāḥ su retasā śravasā tuñjamānāḥ abhi syāma pr̥tanāyūn adevān
column2: As thy followers, O Agni, best leader, winning all precious (treasures), pressing onward with fertile glory, may we overcome the godless who seek to combat us.

column1: ā devānām abhavaḥ ketuḥ agne mandraḥ viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān prati martān avāsayaḥ damūnāḥ anu devān rathiraḥ yāsi sādhan
column2: Thou hast been here as the banner of the gods, Agni, joy-giving, knowing all wisdom. As the domestic (god) thou hast harboured the mortals. As the charioteer thou goest along straightway after the gods.

column1: ni duroṇe amr̥taḥ martyānām rājā sasāda vidathāni sādhan ghr̥ta pratīkaḥ urviyā vi adyaut agniḥ viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān
column2: The immortal, the king, has sat down in the dwelling of the mortals, performing the sacrifices 1. He the ghee-faced one has shone forth widely, Agni knowing all wisdom.

column1: ā naḥ gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhiḥ mahān mahībhiḥ ūti bhiḥ saraṇyan asme iti rayim bahulam sam tarutram su vācam bhāgam yaśasam kr̥dhi naḥ
column2: 1 Come to us with thy gracious friendship, speeding, great, with thy great blessings. Bestow on us plentiful victorious wealth; make our share glorious and adorned with fine speech.

column1: etā te agne janima sanāni pra pūrvyāya nūtanāni vocam mahānti vr̥ṣṇe savanā kr̥tā imā janman janman ni hitaḥ jāta vedāḥ
column2: These old births of thine, O Agni, and the recent ones I have told forth to thee the ancient one. These great libations (of Soma) have been prepared for the manly one; generation by generation Gâtavedas has been placed (on the altar).

column1: janman janman ni hitaḥ jāta vedāḥ viśvāmitrebhiḥ idhyate ajasraḥ tasya vayam su matau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma
column2: Gâtavedas, placed (on the altar) generation after generation, is kindled by the Visvâmitras, the indefatigable (or everlasting). May we dwell in the grace of him the worshipful, yea, in his blissful kindness.

column1: imam yajñam sahasāvan tvam naḥ deva trā dhehi su krato itisu krato rarāṇaḥ pra yaṁsi hotaḥ br̥hatīḥ iṣaḥ naḥ agne mahi draviṇam ā yajasva
