column1: urau vā ye antarikṣe madanti divaḥ vā ye rocane santi devāḥ ūmāḥ vā ye su havāsaḥ yajatrāḥ āyemire rathyaḥ agne aśvāḥ
column2: Whether it be the gods who rejoice in the wide air, or those who dwell in the heavenly light, or those who are helpful 1, ready to hear our call, and worshipful; or whether the horses of thy chariot, O Agni, have turned themselves hither—

column1: ā ebhiḥ agne sa ratham yāhi arvāṅ nānāratham vā vi bhavaḥ hi aśvāḥ patnī vataḥ triṁśatam trīn ca devān anu svadham ā vaha mādayasva
column2: Come hither with them, O Agni, on one chariot or on many chariots, for thy horses are powerful. Bring hither, after thy nature, the thirty and the three gods with their wives, and rejoice (in the Soma).

column1: saḥ hotā yasya rodasī iti cit urvī iti yajñam yajñam abhi vr̥dhe gr̥ṇītaḥ prācī iti adhvarāiva tasthatuḥ sumeke itisu meke r̥tavarī ity r̥ta varī r̥ta jātasya satye iti
column2: He is the Hotri whose sacrifice even the two wide worlds salute over and over again for the sake of prosperity. Turned to the east 1, the two well-established 2 (goddesses, Heaven and Earth), the righteous, true ones stand as at the sacrifice 3 of (Agni) the right-born.

column1: il̥ām agne puru daṁsam sanim goḥ śaśvat tamam havamānāya sādha syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te su matiḥ bhūtu asme iti
pra ye āruḥ śiti pr̥ṣṭhasya dhāseḥ ā mātarā viviśuḥ sapta vāṇīḥ pari kṣitāḥ pitarā sam carete pra sarsrāteiti dīrgham āyuḥ pra yakṣe
column2: They who have risen out of the drink of the white-backed one, have entered the two parents, the seven sounds. The (all-)encompassing parents come together; they go forth to aspire after long life 1.

column1: divakṣasaḥ dhenavaḥ vr̥ṣṇaḥ aśvāḥ devīḥ ā tasthau madhu mat vahantīḥ r̥tasya tvā sadasi kṣema yantam pari ekā carati vartanim gauḥ
column2: The milch-cows dwelling in heaven 1 are the mares of the manly one. He has bestridden the goddesses who carry the sweet (food) 2. Thee who livest in peace in the abode of Rita, the one cow 3 circumambulates, making her way.

column1: ā sīm arohat su yamāḥ bhavantīḥ patiḥ cikitvān rayi vit rayīṇām pra nīla pr̥ṣṭhaḥ atasasya dhāseḥ tāḥ avāsayat purudha pratīkaḥ
column2: He has mounted the (mares) 1 that became well-manageable, the wise lord, the finder of riches. He with the dark blue back, with many faces, has made them depart from the drink of the brush-wood 2.

column1: mahi tvāṣṭram ūrjayantīḥ ajuryam stabhu yamānam vahataḥ vahant i vi aṅgebhiḥ didyutānaḥ sadha sthe ekām iva rodasī iti ā viveśa
column2: Giving mighty vigour to the never-ageing son of Tvashtri 1, the streams 2 carry Him the firmly fixed one. Flashing in his abode with his limbs he has entered upon the two worlds as if they were one.

column1: jānanti vr̥ṣṇaḥ aruṣasya śevam uta bradhnasya śāsane raṇanti divaḥ rucaḥ su rucaḥ rocamānāḥ il̥ā yeṣām gaṇyā māhinā gīḥ
column2: They know friendship towards the manly, the red one, and they delight in the command of ruddy (Agni), (the gods) shining from heaven, resplendent with bright shine, to whose host Ilâ belongs, the mighty praise.

column1: uto iti pitr̥ bhyām pra vidā anu ghoṣam mahaḥ mahat bhyām anayanta śūṣam ukṣā ha yatra pari dhānam aktoḥ anu svam dhāma jarituḥ vavakṣa
column2: And finding it out by following the noise they brought to the great one's great parents a song of praise, when the bull about nightfall (?) has grown strong according to the singer's own law 1.

column1: adhvaryu bhiḥ pañca bhiḥ sapta viprāḥ priyam rakṣante ni hitam padam veḥ prāñcaḥ madanti ukṣaṇaḥ ajuryāḥ devāḥ devānām anu hi vratā guritiguḥ
column2: With the five Adhvaryus the seven priests watch the beloved footstep which the bird has made 1. Turned forwards the never-ageing bulls 2 rejoice: for they, being gods, have followed the laws of the gods.

column1: daivyā hotārā prathamā ni r̥ñje sapta pr̥kṣāsaḥ svadhayā madanti r̥tam śaṁsantaḥ r̥tam it te āhuḥ anu vratam vrata pā dīdhyānāḥ
vr̥ṣāyante mahe atyāya pūrvīḥ vr̥ṣṇe citrāyaḥraśmayaḥḥsu yāmāḥḥdevaḥhotaḥḥmandra taraḥḥcikitvānḥmahaḥḥdevānḥrodasī itiḥāḥihaḥvakṣi
column2: The many (mares) are full of desire for the mighty stallion. For the manly, bright one, the reins easily direct (the horses) 1. Divine Hotri! Thou who art a great joy-giver and wise, bring hither the great gods and the two worlds 2.

column1: pr̥kṣa prayajaḥ draviṇaḥ su vācaḥ su ketavaḥ uṣasaḥ revat ūṣuḥ uto iti cit agne mahinā pr̥thivyāḥ kr̥tam cit enaḥ sam mahe daśasya
column2: The dawns, O wealth-giver, the mighty sacrificers 1, well spoken and bright have shone with wealth. And by the earth's greatness 2, O Agni, forgive us even committed sin 3, that we may be great.

column1: il̥ām agne puru daṁsam sanim goḥ śaśvat tamam havamānāya sādha syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te su matiḥ bhūtu asme iti
añjanti tvām adhvare deva yantaḥ vanaspate madhunā daivyena yat ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhāḥ dravinā iha dhattāt yat vā kṣayaḥ mātuḥ asyāḥ upa sthe
column2: The worshippers of the gods anoint thee at the sacrifice, O lord of the forest 1, with heavenly honey 2. When standing upright bestow wealth (on us) here, or when abiding in this mother's lap 3.

column1: sam iddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastāt brahma vanvānaḥ ajaram su vīram āre asmat amatim bādhamānaḥ ut śrayasva mahate saubhagāya
column2: Situated in front of the kindled (fire), accepting our sacred spell which protects from old age and gives valiant offspring, driving away far from us lack of thoughts 1, rise up 2 for the sake of great prosperity.

column1: ut śrayasva vanaspate varṣman pr̥thivyāḥ adhi su mitī mīyamānaḥ varcaḥ dhāḥ yajña vāhase
column2: Rise up, O lord of the forest, on the summit of the earth. Erected by skilful erection bestow splendour on (the worshipper) who fits out the sacrifice as a vehicle 1.

column1: yuvā su vāsāḥ pari vītaḥ ā agāt saḥ oṁ iti śreyān bhavati jāyamānaḥ tam dhīrāsaḥ kavayaḥ ut nayanti su ādhyaḥ manasā deva yantaḥ
column2: A well-clothed youth dressed has come hither. He becomes more excellent when born 1. Wise sages full of pious thoughts, longing for the gods in their mind, bring him forth.

column1: jātaḥ jāyate sudina tve ahnām sa marye ā vidathe vardhamānaḥ punanti dhīrāḥ apasaḥ manīṣā deva yāḥ vipraḥ ut iyarti vācam
column2: He who has been born is born 1 in the auspiciousness of days, growing up in the assembly and at the sacrifice 2. Wise, active men purify him by pious thoughts; the priest approaching the gods raises his voice 3.

column1: yān vaḥ naraḥ deva yantaḥ ni mimyuḥ vanaspate sva dhitiḥ vā tatakṣa te devāsaḥ svaravaḥ tasthi vāṁsaḥ prajāvat asme iti didhiṣantu ratnam
column2: You whom the worshippers of the gods have fastened down (in the earth), or whom the axe has fashioned, O lord of the forest: may those divine posts 1 standing (here) take care to bestow on us treasures with offspring.

column1: ye vr̥kṇāsaḥ adhi kṣami ni mitāsaḥ yata srucaḥ te naḥ vyantu vāyarm deva trā kṣetra sādhasaḥ
column2: (The posts) which have been hewn on the earth and fastened down, and to which the sacrificial ladles have been raised 1: may they, giving bliss to our fields 2, eagerly seek precious goods for us among the gods.

column1: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ su nīthāḥ dyāvākṣāmā pr̥thivī antarikṣam sa joṣasaḥ yajñam avantu devāḥ ūrdhvam kr̥ṇvantu adhvarasya ketum
column2: May the Âdityas, the Rudras, the Vasus, the good leaders, Heaven and Earth, the Earth 1 and the Air—may the gods unanimously bless this sacrifice; may they raise up the banner of the sacrifice (the Yûpa).

column1: haṁsāḥ iva śreṇiśaḥ yatānāḥ śukrāḥ vasānāḥ svaravaḥ naḥ ā aguḥ ut nīyamānāḥ kavi bhiḥ purastāt devāḥ devānām api yanti pāthaḥ
column2: Like swans ranging themselves in rows, arraying themselves in brightness the sacrificial posts have come to us. Led up by the sages they go forward as gods to the abode of the gods.

column1: śr̥ṅgāṇi iva śr̥ṅgiṇām sam dadr̥śre caṣāla vantaḥ svaravaḥ pr̥thivyām vāghat bhiḥ vā vi have śroṣamāṇāḥ asmān avantu pr̥tanājyeṣu
column2: Like horns of horned animals the sacrificial posts with their head-pieces 1 are seen on the earth. Hearing (us) in the emulating call of the invoking (priests) may they protect us in the racings of battles.

column1: vanaspate śata valśaḥ vi roha sahasra valśāḥ vi vayam ruhema yam tvām ayam sva dhitiḥ tejamānaḥ pra nināya mahate saubhagāya
column2: O lord of the forest, rise with a hundred branches; may we rise with a thousand branches (offspring)—thou whom this sharpened axe has led forward to great prosperity.

column1: sakhāyaḥ tvā vavr̥mahe devam martāsaḥ ūtaye apām napātam su bhagam su dīditim su pratūrtim anehasam
column2: We, thy friends 1, have chosen thee for our protection, (we) the mortals (thee) the god, the offspring of the Waters, the blessed one with fine splendour 2, who gloriously advances, the unmenaced one.

column1: kāyamānaḥ vanā tvam yat mātr̥r̥ḥ ajagan apaḥ na tat te agne pra mr̥ṣe ni vartanam yat dūre san iha abhavaḥ
column2: When thou, finding pleasure in the wood, hast gone to thy mothers, the Waters, that return of thine, Agni, (to this world) should not be slighted, when dwelling afar thou hast come hither.

column1: ati tr̥ṣṭam vavakṣitha atha eva su manāḥ asi pra pra anye yanti pari anye āsate yeṣām sakhye asi śritaḥ
column2: High above (all) pungent sharpness thou hast grown up 1, and verily thou art kind-hearted. Some go forward here and there; others sit around thee, in whose friendship thou abidest 2.

column1: īyi vāṁsam ati sridhaḥ śaśvatīḥ ati saścataḥ anu īm avindan ni cirāsaḥ adruhaḥ ap su siṁham iva śritam
column2: He who has passed beyond (all) failures, beyond all hindrances 1, the guileless, watchful ones 2 have found him as a lion (is found), when he had gone into the Waters;

column1: sasr̥vāṁsam iva tmanā agnim itthā tiraḥ hitam ā enam nayat mātar iśvā parāvataḥ devebhyaḥ mathitam pari
column2: He who had run as it were by his own might, Agni, who thus dwelt in concealment—Him Mâtarisvan brought hither from afar, from the gods, when he had been produced by attrition (of the woods).

column1: tam tvā martāḥ agr̥bhṇata devebhyaḥ havya vāhana viśvān yat yajñān abhi pāsi mānuṣa tava kratvā yaviṣṭhya
column2: (And thus) the mortals have taken thee up, O carrier of sacrificial food towards the gods 1, because thou, O (god) belonging to Manus, protectest all sacrifices by the power of thy mind, O youngest one!

column1: tat bhadram tava daṁsanā pākāya cit chadayati tvām yat agne paśavaḥ sam āsate sam iddham api śarvare
column2: 1 This is something glorious; herein thy wonderful power shows itself even to the simple, that the cattle lie down round about thee when thou hast been kindled, O Agni, at the approach of darkness 2.

column1: ā juhota su adhvaram śīram pāvaka śociṣam āśum dūtam ajiram pratnam īḍyam śruṣṭī devam saparyata
column2: Make your offerings in (Agni), the best performer of worship, the sharp one who purifies with his flames 1. Serve ye, obediently the god, the quick messenger, the agile, the old, the adorable.

column1: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇi agnim triṁśat ca devāḥ nava ca asaparyan aukṣan ghr̥taiḥ astr̥ṇan barhiḥ asmai āt it hotāram ni asādayanta
column2: 1 Three hundred and three thousand gods and thirty and nine did service to Agni. They sprinkled him with ghee and spread out for him the sacrificial grass: then they made him sit down as a Hotri.

column1: tvām agne manīṣiṇaḥ sam rājam carṣaṇīnām devam martāsaḥ indhate sam adhvare
column2: 1 Thee, O Agni, the highest king of human tribes, the god, thoughtful mortals kindle at their worship.

column1: tvām yajñeṣu r̥tvijam agne hotāram īl̥ate gopāḥ r̥tasya dīdihi sve dame
column2: Thee, O Agni, the Ritvig, the Hotri, they magnify at the sacrifices. Shine as the guardian of Rita in thy own house 1.

column1: saḥ gha yaḥ te dadāśati samidhā jāta vedase saḥ agne dhatte su vīryam saḥ puṣyati
column2: He indeed who may worship thee, the Gâtavedas, with fuel, acquires abundance in valiant men, O Agni; he will prosper.

column1: saḥ ketuḥ adhvarāṇām agniḥ devebhiḥ ā gamat añjānaḥ sapta hotr̥ bhiḥ haviṣmate
column2: May He, the banner of the sacrifices, Agni, come hither with the gods, anointed by the seven Hotris 1 for the sake of the man who offers sacrificial food.

column1: pra hotre pūrvyam vacaḥ agnaye bharata br̥hat vipām jyotīṁṣi bibhrate na vedhase
column2: Bring ye forward an ancient, mighty speech to Agni, the Hotri, who is like a worshipper bearing the lights of prayers 1.

column1: agnim vardhantu naḥ giraḥ yataḥ jāyate ukthyaḥ mahe vājāya draviṇāya darśataḥ
column2: May our prayers increase Agni, since he is born deserving of praises, the conspicuous one, for the sake of great strength and wealth.

column1: agne yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvare devān deva yate yaja hotā mandraḥ vi rājasi ati sridhaḥ
column2: 1 May Agni, as the best sacrificer at the worship (of men), perform the sacrifice to the gods for the man devoted to the gods. As a joyous Hotri thou reignest (passing) beyond (all) failures.

column1: saḥ naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyu mat asme iti su vīryam bhava stotr̥ bhyaḥ antamaḥ svastaye
column2: Thus, O purifier, shine on us glorious abundance in heroes. Be the nearest (friend) to those who praise thee, for their welfare.

column1: tam tvā viprāḥ vipanyavaḥ jāgr̥ vāṁsaḥ sam indhate havya vāham amartyam sahaḥ vr̥dham
column2: Thus the priests full of admiring praise, having awoke, kindle thee, the immortal carrier of sacrificial food, the increaser of strength.

column1: agniḥ hotā puraḥ hitaḥ adhvarasya vi carṣaṇiḥ saḥ veda yajñam ānuṣak
column2: Agni is the Hotri, the Purohita of our worship, he who dwells among many tribes, He knows the sacrifice in due order.

column1: saḥ havya vāṭ amartyaḥ uśik dūtaḥ canaḥ hitaḥ agniḥ dhiyā sam r̥ṇvati
column2: He, the immortal carrier of oblations, the Usig 1, the messenger, with satisfied mind, Agni sets himself in motion 2 (incited) by the thought (of praying men?).

column1: agniḥ dhiyā saḥ cetati ketuḥ yajñasya pūrvyaḥ artham hi asya taraṇi
column2: Agni takes heed 1 (of us) by the thought (the prayer?), the banner of the sacrifice, the ancient one; for his purpose triumphs 2.

column1: agnim sūnum sana śrutam sahasaḥ jāta vedasam vahnim devāḥ akr̥ṇvata
column2: The gods have made Agni, the old-renowned son of strength, the Gâtavedas, their carrier (towards the sacrifice) 1.

column1: adābhyaḥ puraḥ etā viśām agniḥ mānuṣīṇām tūrṇiḥ rathaḥ sadā navaḥ
column2: Agni the undeceivable one who goes before the human tribes, he is the quick chariot 1, ever new.

column1: sāhvān viśvāḥ abhi yujaḥ kratuḥ devānām amr̥ktaḥ agniḥ tuviśravaḥ tamaḥ
column2: Overcoming all attacks, He, the uninjured mind (power) of the gods, Agni, is most mightily renowned.

column1: abhi prayāṁsi vāhasā dāśvān aśnoti martyaḥ kṣayam pāvaka śociṣaḥ
column2: Through the vehicle 1 (which carries the gods) towards the delights (of sacrifice), the worshipping mortal attains the dwelling-place 2 of (Agni) whose flames are purifying.

column1: pari viśvāni su dhitā agneḥ aśyāma manma bhiḥ viprāsaḥ jāta vedasaḥ
column2: May we, the priests, by our prayers obtain all the blissful gifts of Agni Gâtavedas.

column1: agne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe tve iti devāsaḥ ā īrire
column2: Agni! May we win all the best things in (the trials of) strength. In thee the gods have established them 1.

column1: indrāgnī iti ā gatam sutam gīḥ bhiḥ nabhaḥ vareṇyam asya pātam dhiyā iṣitā
column2: Indra-Agni, in consequence of our prayers come hither to the pressed (Soma), to the precious cloud 1. Drink of it incited by our thoughts (i. e. by our prayers).

column1: indrāgnī iti jarituḥ sacā yajñaḥ jigāti cetanaḥ ayā pātam imam sutam
column2: Indra-Agni, the brilliant 1 sacrifice of him who praises you goes forward together (with the Soma libations, the praises, &c.). Thus drink this pressed (Soma)!

column1: indram agnim kavi chadā yajñasya jūtyā vr̥ṇe tā somasya iha tr̥mpatām
column2: By this stirring sacrifice I choose Indra and Agni who show themselves as sages 1; may they here satiate themselves with Soma.

column1: tośā vr̥tra hanā huve sa jityvānā aparājitā indrāgnī iti vāja sātamā
column2: I call the bounteous 1, the killers of foes 2, the united conquerors, unconquered, Indra-Agni, the greatest winners of booty.

column1: pra vām arcanti ukthinaḥ nītha vidaḥ jaritāraḥ indrāgnī iti iṣaḥ ā vr̥ṇe
column2: The praisers rich in hymns, knowing all the ways (of the sacrifice), laud you. Indra-Agni, I choose the food (which you give).

column1: indrāgnī iti navatim puraḥ dāsa patnīḥ adhūnutam sākam ekena karmaṇā
column2: Indra-Agni, you have hurled down by one deed the ninety strongholds together of which the Dâsas were the lords.

column1: indrāgnī iti apasaḥ pari upa pra yanti dhītayaḥ r̥tasya pathyāḥ anu
column2: Indra-Agni, the thoughts (of the worshippers) go forward towards (you) from the work (of sacrifice) along the paths of Rita.

column1: indrāgnī iti taviṣāṇi vām sadha sthāni prayāṁsi ca yuvoḥ ap tūryam hitam
column2: Indra and Agni, yours are powerful abodes and delights. You cross the waters: this is the deed which belongs to you 1.

column1: indrāgnī iti rocanā divaḥ pari vājeṣu bhūṣathaḥ tat vām ceti pra vīryam
column2: Indra and Agni, you display the lights of heaven in your deeds of strength; that mighty deed of yours has been known far and wide.

column1: pra vaḥ devāya agnaye barhiṣṭham arca asmai gamat devebhiḥ ā saḥ naḥ yajiṣṭhaḥ barhiḥ ā sadat
column2: To this god Agni I sing 1 for you most powerfully. May he come to us with the gods; may he, the best sacrificer, sit down on the sacrificial grass.

column1: r̥ta vā yasya rodasī iti dakṣam sacante ūtayaḥ haviṣmantaḥ tam īl̥ate tam saniṣyantaḥ avase
column2: The righteous one to whose skill the two worlds (Heaven and Earth) and (all) blessings cling—Him the men rich in offerings magnify, Him those who long for gain, that they may obtain his blessing.

column1: saḥ yantā vipraḥ eṣām saḥ yajñānām atha hi saḥ agnim tam vaḥ duvasyata dātā yaḥ vanitā magham
column2: He, the priest, is the guide of these (men) 1, and he indeed (is the guide) of sacrifices. Praise ye this Agni who is the giver, the winner of wealth.

column1: saḥ naḥ śarmāṇi vītaye agniḥ yacchatu śam tamā yataḥ naḥ pruṣṇavat vasu divi kṣiti bhyaḥ ap su ā
column2: May this Agni give us most blissful shelter for our (sacrificial) feast, whence he may shower wealth on us in heaven, the (human) dwellings 1, and in the waters.

column1: dīdi vāṁsam apūrvyam vasvībhiḥ asya dhīti bhiḥ r̥kvaaṇaḥ agnim indhate hotāram viśpatim viśām
column2: The singers kindle Agni, the Hotri, the lord of the tribes, the brilliant, the wonderful, with his excellent thoughts 1.

column1: uta naḥ brahman aviṣaḥ uktheṣu deva hūtamaḥ śam naḥ śoca marut vr̥dhaḥ agne sahasra sātamaḥ
column2: And mayst thou, the best invoker of the gods, help us in our spell, in our hymns. Shine bliss on us, Agni whom the Maruts strengthen 1, the greatest winner of thousandfold (wealth).

column1: nu naḥ rāsva sahasra vat toka vat puṣṭi mat vasu dyumat agne su vīryam varṣiṣṭham anupa kṣitam
column2: Now bestow on us thousandfold wealth with offspring and prosperity, splendid, most powerful, and undecaying abundance in heroes, O Agni!

column1: ā hotā mandraḥ vadathāni asthāt satyaḥ yajvā kavi tamaḥ saḥ vedhāḥ vidyut rathaḥ sahasaḥ putraḥ agniḥ śociḥ keśaḥ pr̥thivyām pājaḥ aśret
column2: The joy-giving Hotri has taken his place at the sacrifices 1, He the true, the sacrificer, the highest sage, the worshipper. Agni whose chariot is lightning, the son of strength, whose hair is flame, has spread forth his light over the earth.

column1: ayāmi te namaḥ uktim juṣasva r̥ta vaḥ tubhyam cetate sahasvaḥ vidvān ā vakṣi viduṣaḥ ni ṣatsi madhye ā barhiḥ ūtaye yajatra
column2: It 1 has been offered to thee—be pleased with the adoring speech 2—to thee who is observant of it, O righteous, strong one. Bring hither thou who art wise, the wise (gods). Sit down on the sacrificial grass in the middle (of it) for bliss, O worshipful one!

column1: dravatām te uṣasā vājayantī iti agne vātasya pathyābhiḥ accha yat sīm añjanti pūrvyam haviḥ bhiḥ ā vandhurāiva tasthatuḥ duroṇe
column2: To thee, Agni, Night and Dawn who further thy strength 1, shall hasten on the paths of the wind. When (the mortals) anoint the ancient one 2 with offerings, they 3 stand in the house as on a chariot-seat 4.

column1: mitraḥ ca tubhyam varuṇaḥ sahasvaḥ agne viśve marutaḥ sumnam arcan yat śociṣā sahasaḥ putra tiṣṭhāḥ abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryaḥ nr̥r̥n
column2: Mitra and Varuna, O strong Agni, and all the Maruts shall sing to thee a pleasant song, when thou, O son of strength, standest with thy flames, a sun spreading out men 1 over the (terrestrial) dwellings.

column1: vayam te adya rarima hi kāmam uttāna hastāḥ namasā upa sadya yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devān asredhatā manmanā vipraḥ agne
column2: We have given thee thy desire to-day, sitting down near thee adoringly with outstretched hands 1: sacrifice thou to the gods as a priest with thy mind most skilled in sacrifice, with unerring thoughts, O Agni!

column1: tvat hi putra sahasaḥ vi pūrvīḥ devasya yanti ūtayaḥ vi vājāḥ tvam dehi sahasriṇam rayim naḥ adrogheṇa vacasā satyam agne
column2: From thee indeed, O son of strength, proceed manifold divine blessings and gains 1. Give us thousandfold true wealth according to thy guileless word, O Agni!

column1: tubhyam dakṣa kavikrato itikavi krato yāni imā deva martāsaḥ adhvare akarma tvam viśvasya su rathasya bodhi sarvam tat agne amr̥ta svada iha
column2: What we have done here for thee at this sacrifice, we mortals, O skilful and thoughtful god, take thou notice of all that, O (god) with the good chariot 1; make all this (sacrificial food) here savoury, immortal Agni!

column1: vi pājasā pr̥thunā śośucānaḥ bādhasva dviṣaḥ rakṣasaḥ amīvāḥ su śarmaṇaḥ br̥hataḥ śarmaṇi syām agneḥ aham su havasya pra nītau
column2: Flaming with thy broad stream of light beat away fiends, sorcerers, plagues. May I dwell in the protection of the great, well-protecting (god), under the guidance of Agni who readily listens to our call.

column1: tvam naḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vi uṣṭau tvam sūre ut ite bodhi gopāḥ janma iva nityam tanayam juṣasva stomam me agne tanvā su jāta
column2: Be thou our protector when this dawn shines forth, he thou (our protector) when the sun has risen. Cherish, O Agni, well-born in body, this praise of mine as (a man rejoices) in the birth (of a son), in his own offspring 1.

column1: tvam nr̥ cakṣāḥ vr̥ṣabha anu pūrvīḥ kr̥ṣṇāsu agne aruṣaḥ vi bhāhi vaso iti neṣi ca parṣi ca ati aṁhaḥ kr̥dhi naḥ rāye uśijaḥ yaviṣṭha
column2: Beholding men, shine thou after many (dawns) 1, O bull, Agni, red in the dark (nights). O Vasu! Lead us and bring us across anguish. Help us, the Usigs 2, to wealth 3, thou youngest (of the gods)!

column1: aṣāl̥haḥ agne vr̥ṣabhaḥ didīhi puraḥ viśvāḥ saubhagā sam jigīvān yajñasya netā prathamasya pāyoḥ jāta vedaḥ br̥hataḥ su pranīte
column2: Shine, O Agni, thou the invincible bull, who hast conquered all strongholds and all delights, the leader of the first, the protecting 1, mighty sacrifice, O Gâtavedas, best guide.

column1: acchidrā śarma jaritariti purūṇi devān accha dīdyānaḥ su medhāḥ rathaḥ na sasniḥ abhi vakṣi vājam agne tvam rodasī iti naḥ sumeke itisu meke
column2: O singer, thou who art wise, brightly shining towards the gods 1, bring to us thy many perfect shelters, and gain like a victorious car 2; Agni, (carry) thou (hither) towards us the two well-established 3 worlds (Heaven and Earth).

column1: pra pīpaya vr̥ṣabha jinva vājān agne tvam rodasī iti naḥ sudogheitisu doghe devebhiḥ deva su rucā rucānaḥ mā naḥ martasya duḥ matiḥ pari sthāt
column2: O bull, increase and rouse our gains. Agni! (Increase) for us the two worlds (Heaven and Earth) rich in milk, O god together with the gods, shining with beautiful shine! May a mortal's hatred never enclose us.

column1: il̥ām agne puru daṁsam sanim goḥ śaśvat tamam havamānāya sādha syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te su matiḥ bhūtu asme iti
ayam agniḥ su vīryasya īśe mahaḥ saubhagasya rāyaḥ īśe su aapatyasya go mataḥ īśe vr̥tra hathānām
column2: This Agni rules over abundance in valiant men, over great happiness. He rules over wealth consisting in offspring and cows; he rules over the killing of foes.

column1: imam naraḥ marutaḥ saścata vr̥dham yasmin rāyaḥ śe vr̥dhāsaḥ abhi ye santi pr̥tanāsu duḥ dhyaḥ viśvāhā śatrum ādabhuḥ
column2: O Maruts 1, ye men, cling to this furtherer 2 who possesses joy-furthering boons—(the Maruts) who 3 in battles overcome ill-minded (foes), who have deceived the enemy 4 day by day.

column1: saḥ tvam naḥ rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhavaḥ agne su vīryasya tuvi dyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvataḥ anamīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
column2: As such, O bounteous Agni, prepare 1 us riches 2 and wealth in valiant men, which, O highly glorious one, may be most exalted, rich in offspring, free from plagues, and powerful.

column1: cakriḥ yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā abhi sasahiḥ cakriḥ deveṣu ā duvaḥ ā deveṣu yatate ā su vīrye ā śaṁse uta nr̥ṇām
column2: The maker who victoriously (stands) over all beings, the maker who makes the praise arrive among the gods 1: he stands firm among the gods, among the host of heroes, firm also in the praise of men.

column1: mā naḥ agne amataye mā avīratāyai rīradhaḥ mā agotāyai sahasaḥ putra mā nide apa dveṣāṁsi ā kr̥dhi
column2: Give us not up, Agni, to want of thought 1 nor to want of heroes nor to want of cows, O son of strength, nor to the scoffer. Drive away hostile powers 2.

column1: śagdhi vājasya su bhaga prajāvataḥ agne br̥hataḥ adhvare sam rāyā bhūyasā sr̥ja mayaḥ bhunā tuvi dyumna yaśasvatā
column2: Help us at this sacrifice, O blessed one, with mighty gain which is accompanied by offspring, O Agni! Let us be united with greater, gladdening, glorious wealth, O thou of mighty splendour!

column1: sam idhyamānaḥ prathamā anu dharma sam aktu bhiḥ ajyate viśva vāraḥ śociḥ keśaḥ ghr̥ta nirnik pāvakaḥ su yajñaḥ agniḥ yajathāya devān
column2: He who is inflamed after the primitive ordinances, is anointed with ointments 1, the giver of all treasures, he whose hair is flame, whose stately robe is ghee, the purifier, skilled in sacrifice, Agni—that he may sacrifice to the gods.

column1: yathā ayajaḥ hotram agne pr̥thivyāḥ yathā divaḥ jāta vedaḥ cikitvān eva anena haviṣā yakṣi devān manuṣvat yajñam pra tira imam adya
column2: As thou hast performed, O Agni, the Hotri's duty for the Earth, as thou hast done it for Heaven, O Gâtavedas, full of intelligence, in the same way sacrifice with this offering to the gods. Prosper this sacrifice to-day as thou hast done for Manus.

column1: trīṇi āyūṁṣi tava jāta vedaḥ tisraḥ ājānīḥ uṣasaḥ te agne tābhiḥ devānām avaḥ yakṣi vidvān atha bhava yajamānāya śam yoḥ
column2: Thou hast three lives, O Gâtavedas, and three births from the Dawn 1, O Agni! Being wise, sacrifice with these to the favour of the gods, and bring luck and welfare to the sacrificer.

column1: agnim su dītim su dr̥śam gr̥ṇantaḥ namasyāmaḥ tvā īḍyam jāta vedaḥ tvām dūtam aratim havya vāham devāḥ akr̥ṇvan amr̥tasya nābhim
column2: Praising Agni full of splendour, full of beauty, we adore thee, O Gâtavedas, deserving to be magnified. Thee the gods have made their messenger, their steward 1, and carrier of offerings, the navel of immortality.

column1: yaḥ tvat hotā pūrvaḥ agne yajīyān dvitā ca sattā svadhayā ca śam bhuḥ tasya anu dharma pra yaja cikitvaḥ atha naḥ dhāḥ adhvaram deva vītau
column2: O Agni, the Hotri who before thee was an excellent sacrificer, who verily 1 sat down and brought luck by himself 2 sacrifice according to his rules, O intelligent one, and set down our sacrifice at the feast of the gods.

column1: bhava naḥ agne su manāḥ upa itau sakhāiva sakhye pitarāiva sādhuḥ puru druhaḥ hi kṣitayaḥ janānām prati pratīcīḥ dahatāt arātīḥ
column2: Be kind, O Agni, when we approach thee, as a friend a friend, as parents 1, a straight leader. For full of deceit are the tribes of men: burn thou against (all) malign powers so that they turn back.

column1: tapo iti su agne antarān amitrān tapa śaṁsam araruṣaḥ parasya tapo iti vaso iti cikitānaḥ acittān vi te tiṣṭhantām ajarāḥ ayāsaḥ
column2: Burn, O Agni, the nearer enemies, burn the curse of the distant evil-doer. Burn, O Vasu, seeing the unseen ones. May thy never-ageing, never-tiring flames 1 spread out.

column1: idhmena agne icchamānaḥ ghr̥tena juhomi havyam tarase balāya yāvat īśe brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ imām dhiyam śata seyāya devīm
column2: Wishing for (thy blessings), O Agni, by fuel and ghee I offer this sacrificial food for (the attainment of) advancing power and of strength; worshipping thee with my spell as far as I have power (I offer) this divine prayer for the attainment of hundred(fold blessings).

column1: ut śociṣā sahasaḥ putra stutaḥ br̥hat vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi revat agne viśvāmitreṣu śam yoḥ marmr̥jma te tanvam bhūri kr̥tvaḥ
column2: (Shining) forth with thy flame, O son of strength, praised (by us), bestow mighty vigour on those who toil for thee, bright luck and welfare, O Agni, on the Visvâmitras! We have cleaned thy body many times.

column1: kr̥dhi ratnam su sanitaḥ dhanānām saḥ gha it agne bhavasi yat sami ddhaḥ stotuḥ duroṇe su bhagasya revat sr̥prā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṁṣi
column2: Give us treasures, O best gainer of riches: such indeed art thou, Agni, when thou hast been kindled. In the blessed praiser's house thou hast placed, together with wealth, thy mighty(?) arms 1, thy marvellous shapes.

column1: agnim hotāram pra vr̥ṇe miyedhe gr̥tsam kavim viśva vidam amūram saḥ naḥ yakṣat deva tātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanate maghāni
column2: I choose Agni as Hotri at this sacrificial meal, the clever sage all-knowing and not foolish. May he, the excellent sacrificer, sacrifice for us amid the host of the gods; may he obtain liberal boons (for us) for the sake of wealth and strength.

column1: pra te agne haviṣmatīm iyarmi accha su dyumnām rātinīm ghr̥tācīm pra dakṣiṇit devatātim urāṇaḥ sam rāti bhiḥ vasu bhiḥ yajñam aśret
column2: To thee, O Agni, I stretch forth the (ladle) rich in sacrificial food, splendid, full of gifts, full of ghee. From left to right, choosing the host of the gods 1, he has established the sacrifice with gifts and goods 2.

column1: saḥ tejīyasā manasā tvāūtaḥ uta śikṣa su apatyasya śikṣoḥ agne rāyaḥ nr̥ tamasya pra bhūtau bhūyāma te su stutayaḥ ca vasvaḥ
column2: Whoever is favoured by thee, is blessed with the sharpest spirit. Favour him with good offspring, O god rich in favours 1! Agni, may we, (dwelling) in the copiousness of manliest wealth, be rich in perfect praise of thee, the Vasu.

column1: bhūtīni hi tve iti dadhire anīkā agne devasya yajyavaḥ janāsaḥ saḥ ā vaha devatātim yaviṣṭha śardhaḥ yat adya divyam yajāsi
column2: On thee indeed, O Agni, sacrificing men have put many faces of (thee) the god 1. Bring hither then the host of the gods, O youngest one, when thou wilt sacrifice to-day to the divine host 2.

column1: yat tvā hotāram anajan miyedhe ni ṣādayantaḥ yajathāya devāḥ saḥ tvam naḥ agne avitā iha bodhi adhi śravāṁsi dhehi naḥ tanūṣu
column2: When the gods will anoint thee as the Hotri at the sacrificial meal making thee sit down for the sacrifice, be thou here, O Agni, our furtherer, and bestow glory on our bodies.

column1: agnim uṣasam aśvinā dadhi krām vi uṣṭiṣu havate vahniḥ ukthaiḥ su jyotiṣaḥ naḥ śr̥ṇvantu devāḥ sa joṣasaḥ adhvaram vāvaśānāḥ
column2: The carrier (of the gods) 1 calls by his hymns Agni, Ushas (dawn), the two Asvins, Dadhikrâ 2 at daybreak. May the gods rich in light, unanimously longing for our sacrifice, hear us.

column1: agne trī te vājinā trī ṣadha sthā tisraḥ te jihvāḥ r̥ta jāta pūrvīḥ ti sraḥ oṁ iti te tanvaḥ deva vātāḥ tābhiḥ naḥ pāhi giraḥ apra yucchan
column2: Agni, threefold is thy strength; three are thy abodes; three are thy many tongues, O thou who art born in Rita! And three, O Agni, are thy bodies beloved by the gods. With these protect our prayers unremittingly.

column1: agne bhūrīṇi tava jāta vedaḥ deva svadhāvaḥ amr̥tasya nāma yāḥ ca māyā māyinām viśvam inva tve iti pūrvīḥ sam dadhuḥ pr̥ṣṭabandho itipr̥ṣṭa bandho
column2: 1 Agni! Many are the names, O Gâtavedas, of thee the immortal one, O self-dependent god! And whatever the secret powers of the powerful 2 are, thou all-enlivener, in thee they have placed together (those) many (powers), O (god) after whose relations men ask 3.

column1: agniḥ netā bhagaḥ iva kṣitīnām daivīnām devaḥ r̥tu pāḥ r̥ta vā saḥ vr̥tra hā sanayaḥ viśva vedāḥ parṣat viśvā ati duḥ itā gr̥ṇantam
column2: Agni is the divine leader of the divine tribes like Bhaga, the guardian of the seasons 1, the righteous. May He, the killer of Vritra 2, the ancient one, the possessor of all wealth, bring the singer across all troubles.

column1: dadhi krām agnim uṣasam ca devīm br̥haspatim savitāram ca devam aśv inā mitrāvaruṇā bhagam ca vasūn rudrān ādityān iha huve
column2: I invite hither 1 Dadhikrâ 2, Agni, and the goddess Ushas, Brihaspati and the god Savitri, the Asvins, Mitra and Varuna and Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras, and Âdityas.

column1: imam naḥ yajñam amr̥teṣu dhehi īmā havyā jāta vedaḥ juṣasva stokānām agne medasaḥ ghr̥tasya hotariti pra aśāna prathamaḥ ni sadya
column2: Take this our sacrifice to the immortals; accept graciously these offerings, O Gâtavedas. O Agni, partake of the drops of fat and ghee, O Hotri, having sat down as the first.

column1: ghr̥ta vantaḥ pāvaka te stokāḥ ścotanti medasaḥ sva dharman deva vītaye śreṣṭham naḥ dhehi vāryam
column2: To thee, O purifier, the drops of fat mixed with ghee drip down. O (god) who followest thy own ordinances, give us the best boon for this feast to which the gods come eagerly.

column1: tubhyam stokāḥ ghr̥ta ścutaḥ agne viprāya santya r̥ṣiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ sam idhyase yajñasya pra avitā bhava
column2: To thee, the priest, O Agni, (belong) the drops dripping with ghee, O good one! Thou art kindled as the best Rishi. Be a furtherer of our sacrifice!

column1: tubhyam ścotanti adhrigo ity adhir go śacī vaḥ stokāsaḥ agne medasaḥ ghr̥tasya kavi śastaḥ br̥hatā bhānunā ā agāḥ havyā juṣasva medhira
column2: For thee, O liberal one 1, full of power, the drops of fat and ghee drip down, O Agni! Praised by the sages thou hast come hither with mighty light. Accept graciously the offerings, O wise one!

column1: ojiṣṭham te madhyataḥ medaḥ ut bhr̥tam pra te vayam dadāmahe ścotanti te vs iti stokāḥ adhi tvaci prati tān deva śaḥ vihi
column2: For thee the richest fat 1 has been taken out from the midst. We give it to thee. On thy skin, O Vasu, the drops drip down. Accept them eagerly for each of the gods.

column1: ayam saḥ agniḥ yasmin somam indraḥ sutam dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ sahasriṇam vājam atyam na saptim sasavān san stūyase jāta vedaḥ
column2: This is that Agni with whom the desiring Indra took the pressed Soma into his body. Having obtained thousandfold strength like a horse, a racer 1, thou art praised, O Gâtavedas!

column1: agne yat te divi varcaḥ pr̥thivyām yat oṣadhīṣu ap su ā yajatra yena antarikṣam uru ātatantha tveṣaḥ saḥ bhānuḥ arṇavaḥ nr̥ cakṣāḥ
column2: 1 Thy splendour, O Agni, which dwells in heaven and on earth, in the plants, O worshipful one, and in the waters, wherewith thou hast spread through the wide air—that light of thine is fierce, waving 2, man-beholding.

column1: agne divaḥ arṇam accha jigāsi accha devān ūciṣe dhiṣṇyā ye yā rocane parastāt sūryasya yāḥ ca avastāt upa tiṣṭhante āpaḥ
column2: Agni, thou goest to the floods of heaven. Thou hast spoken to the gods who are liberal (?) 1. (Thou goest) to the waters which (dwell) on high in the ether of the sun, and to those which approach below.

column1: purīṣyāsaḥ agnayaḥ pravaṇebhiḥ sa joṣasaḥ juṣantām yajñam adruhaḥ anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ mahīḥ
column2: May the fires of the soil united with those on the hill-sides 1, without guile graciously accept our sacrifice and plentiful food free from all plague.

column1: il̥ām agne puru daṁsam sanim goḥ śaśvat tamam havamānāya sādha syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te su matiḥ bhūtu asme iti
niḥ mathitaḥ su dhitaḥ ā sadha sthe yuvā kaviḥ adhvarasya pra netā jūryat su agniḥ ajaraḥ vaneṣu atra dadhe amr̥tam jāta vedāḥ
column2: Produced by attrition, well preserved in his abode, the young sage, the leader of worship, Agni ever young in the forests 1 that grow old—Gâtavedas, has here assumed immortality 2.

column1: amanthiṣṭām bhāratā revat agnim deva śravāḥ deva vātaḥ su dakṣam agne vi paśya br̥hatā abhi rāyā iṣām naḥ netā bhavatāt anu dyūn
column2: The two Bharatas 1, Devasravas and Devavâta, in the midst of wealth have produced by attrition Agni the skilful (god). Agni, look forth with mighty wealth, and then be 2 for us a guide of food day by day.

column1: daśa kṣipaḥ pūrvyam sīm ajījanan su jātam mātr̥ṣu priyam agnim stuhi daiva vātam deva śravaḥ yaḥ janānām asat vaśī
column2: 1 The ten fingers have brought him to the birth, the ancient, beloved (Agni), well born in his mothers 2. Praise, O Devasravas, the Agni of Devavâta who 3 should be the lord of people.

column1: ni tvā dadhe vare ā pr̥thivyāḥ il̥āyāḥ pade su dina tve ahnām dr̥ṣat vatyām mānuṣe āpayāyām sarasvatyām revat agne didīhi
column2: I have laid 1 thee 2 down in the best (place) of the earth 3, in the place of Ilâ 3, in the auspiciousness of days. O Agni, as the god who has belonged to Manus 4, shine with wealth on the Drishadvatî, on the Âpayâ, on the Sarasvatî.

column1: il̥ām agne puru daṁsam sanim goḥ śaśvat tamam havamānāya sādha syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te su matiḥ bhūtu asme iti
agne sahasva pr̥tanāḥ abhi mātīḥ apa asya dustaraḥ taran arātīḥ varcaḥ dhāḥ yajña vāhase
column2: Agni, be victorious in battles; thrust away the plotters. Difficult to overcome, overcoming malign powers, bestow splendour on (the worshipper) who fits out the sacrifice as a vehicle 1.

column1: agne il̥ā sam idhyase vīti hotraḥ amartyaḥ juṣasva su naḥ adhvaram
column2: Agni, thou art kindled with nourishment 1, the immortal offerer of a feast (to the gods). Accept graciously our worship.

column1: agne dyumnena jāgr̥ve sahasaḥ sūno iti āhuta ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama
column2: Agni, wakeful one, son of strength, into whom offerings are poured, sit down with thy splendour on this sacrificial grass of mine.

column1: agne viśvebhiḥ agni bhiḥ devebhiḥ mahaya giraḥ yajñeṣu ye oṁ iti cāyavaḥ
column2: Agni, together with all Agnis, with the gods exalt our prayers and those who are respectful at the sacrifices.

column1: agne dāḥ dāśuṣe rayim vīra vantam parīṇasam śiśīhi naḥ sūnu mataḥ
column2: Agni, give wealth to the worshipper, abundance in valiant men; further us 1 that we may be rich in sons.

column1: agne divaḥ sūnuḥ asi pra cetāḥ tanā pr̥thivyāḥ uta viśva vedāḥ r̥dhak devān iha yaja cikitvaḥ
column2: Agni, thou art for ever the wise son of Heaven and of the Earth, the all-wealthy one. In thy peculiar way 1 sacrifice here to the gods, O intelligent one!

column1: agniḥ sanoti vīryāṇi vidvān sanoti vājam amr̥tāya bhūṣan saḥ naḥ devān ā iha vaha purukṣo itipuru kṣo
column2: Agni, the knowing, obtains (for his worshipper) heroic powers; he obtains (for him) strength, being busy for the sake of immortality. Bring then the gods hither, O (Agni), rich in food.

column1: agniḥ dyāvāpr̥thivī iti viśvajanyeitiviśva janye ā bhāti devī iti amr̥teiti amūraḥ kṣayan vājaiḥ puru candraḥ namaḥ bhiḥ
column2: Agni, the wise, shines on Heaven and Earth, the two immortal goddesses who encompass all people—he who rules through his strength, and who is full of light through adoration.

column1: agne indraḥ ca dāśuṣaḥ duroṇe suta vataḥ yajñam iha upa yātam amardhantā soma peyāya devā
column2: Agni and Indra, come hither to the sacrifice in the house of the worshipper rich in pressed (Soma), never failing, ye two gods, at the drink of Soma.

column1: agne apām sam idhyase duroṇe nityaḥ sūno iti sahasaḥ jāta vedaḥ sadha sthāni mahayamānaḥ ūtī
column2: Agni, thou art kindled in the house of the waters, (our) own (god), O son of strength, Gâtavedas, who exaltest the abodes (in which thou dwellest) by thy blessing.

column1: vaiśvānaram manasā agnim ni cāyya haviṣmantaḥ anu ṣatyam svaḥ vidam su dānum devam rathiram vasu yavaḥ gīḥ bhiḥ raṇvam kuśikāsaḥ havāmahe
column2: With our offerings revering in our mind Agni Vaisvânara, the follower of truth, the finder of the sun—we, the Kusikas 1, desirous of goods, call with our prayers the god who gives rain, the charioteer, the, cheerful.

column1: tam śubhram agnim avase havāmahe vaiśvānaram mātariśvānam ukthyam br̥haspatim manuṣaḥ deva tātaye vipram śrotāram atithim raghu syadam
column2: We call that beautiful Agni to help us, Vaisvânara, Mâtarisvan the praiseworthy 1; we the men (call) Brihaspati 2 for (the worship) of the divine host, the priest who hears us, the. guest who swiftly glides along.

column1: aśvaḥ na krandan jani bhiḥ sam idhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhiḥ yuge yuge saḥ naḥ agniḥ su vīryam su aśvyam dadhātu ratnam amr̥teṣu jāgr̥viḥ
column2: Vaisvânara, neighing like a horse, is kindled by the women 1, by the Kusikas, from age to age; may this Agni give us abundance in valiant men and in horses and treasures, he who wakes among the immortals.

column1: pra yantu vājāḥ taviṣībhiḥ agnayaḥ śubhe sam miślāḥ pr̥ṣatīḥ ayukṣata br̥hat ukṣaḥ marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ pra vepayanti parvatān adābhyāḥ
column2: May the Vâgas 1 come forward, the Agnis with their powers. United 2 they have harnessed the spotted deer for their triumphal procession 3. The Maruts, mightily growing, the all-wealthy, make the mountains tremble, the unbeguiled ones.

column1: agni śriyaḥ marutaḥ viśva kr̥ṣṭayaḥ ā tveṣam ugram avaḥ īmahe vayam te svāninaḥ rudriyāḥ varṣa nirnijaḥ siṁhāḥ na heṣa kratavaḥ su dānavaḥ
column2: The Maruts who possess the beauty of Agni 1, belong to all races of men. We implore their fierce, strong help. They are tumultuous, the sons of Rudra, clothed in rain, hot-spirited like lions 2, givers of rain.

column1: vrātam vrātam gaṇam gaṇam suśasti bhiḥ agneḥ bhāmam marutām ojaḥ īmahe pr̥ṣat aśvāsaḥ anavabhra rādhasaḥ gantāraḥ yajñam vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
column2: We implore with our best praises every host, every troop (of the Maruts) 1, the splendour of Agni, the power of the Maruts. With the spotted deer as horses 2, with gifts that cannot be taken away, they go to the sacrifice wise in the (sacrificial) ordinances 3.

column1: agniḥ asmi janmanā jāta vedāḥ ghr̥tam me cakṣuḥ amr̥tam me āsan arkaḥ tri dhātuḥ rajasaḥ vi mānaḥ ajasraḥ gharmaḥ haviḥ asmi nāma
column2: Agni am I, by birth Gâtavedas. Ghee is my eye; (the drink of) immortality is in my mouth. The threefold song 1 traversing the aerial space, the imperishable Gharma 2, the sacrificial food am I by name.

column1: tri bhiḥ pavitraiḥ apupot hi arkam hr̥dā matim jyotiḥ anu pra jānan varṣiṣṭham ratnam akr̥ta svadhābhiḥ āt it dyāvāpr̥thivī iti pari apaśyat
column2: With three purifying strainers he (Agni) purified the song, with his heart the thought, discovering the light. The mightiest treasure he produced by the powers of his own nature, and then he looked over heaven and earth.

column1: śata dhāram utsam akṣīyamāṇam vipaḥ citam pitaram vaktvānām mel̥im madantam pitroḥ upa sthe tam rodasī iti pipr̥tam satya vācam
column2: Carry him who is the inexhaustible spring with a hundred rills, who has knowledge of prayers (?), the father of (every speech) that should be uttered, the roaring one 1, gladly excited in the lap of his parents—carry him the truth-speaking across (all dangers), O ye two worlds!

column1: pra vaḥ vājāḥ abhi dyavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ ghr̥tācyā devān jigāti sumnayuḥ
column2: Forward (goes) your 1 strength tending heavenward, rich in offerings, with the (ladle) full of ghee. To the gods goes (the worshipper) desirous of their favour.

column1: īl̥e agnim vipaḥ citam girā yajñasya sādhanam śruṣṭī vānam dhita vānam
column2: I magnify 1 with prayer Agni who has knowledge of prayers (?), the accomplisher of sacrifice, who hears us, and in whom (manifold wealth) has been laid down.

column1: agne śakema te vayam yamam devasya vājinaḥ ati dveṣāṁsi tarema
column2: O Agni, may we be able to bridle thee the strong god 1; may we overcome (all) hostile powers.

column1: sam idhyamānaḥ adhvare agniḥ pāvakaḥ īḍyaḥ śociḥ keśaḥ tam īmahe
column2: Agni, inflamed at the sacrifice, the purifier who should be magnified, whose hair is flame—him we approach (with prayers).

column1: pr̥thu pājāḥ amartyaḥ ghr̥ta nirnik su āhutaḥ agniḥ yajñasya havya vāṭ
column2: With his broad stream of light the immortal Agni, clothed in ghee, well served with oblations, is the carrier of offerings at the sacrifice.

column1: tam sa bādhaḥ yata srucaḥ itthā dhiyā yajña vantaḥ ā cakruḥ agnim ūtaye
column2: Holding the (sacrificial) ladles, performing the sacrifice they have with right thought pressingly brought Agni hither 1 for help.

column1: hotā devaḥ amartyaḥ purastāt eti māyayā vidathāni pra codayan
column2: The Hotri, the immortal god goes in front with his secret power 1, instigating the sacrifices 2.

column1: vājī vājeṣu dhīyate adhvareṣu pra nīyate vipraḥ yajñasya sādhanaḥ
column2: The strong (horse, i. e. Agni) is set at the races. He is led forth at the sacrifices, the priest, the accomplisher of sacrifice.

column1: dhiyā cakre vareṇyaḥ bhūtānām garbham ā dadhe dakṣasya pitaram tanā
column2: He has been produced 1 by prayer, the excellent one. I have established 2 him, the germ of beings, for ever the father of Daksha 3.

column1: ni tvā dadhe vareṇyam dakṣasya il̥ā sahaḥ kr̥ta agne su dītim uśijam
column2: I have laid thee down 1, the excellent one, with the nourishment 2 of Daksha, O thou who art produced by power, O Agni, thee the resplendent one, O Usig 3.

column1: agnim yanturam ap turam r̥tasya yoge vanuṣaḥ viprāḥ vājaiḥ sam indhate
column2: The priests, eager to set to work the Rita 1, kindle with quick strength Agni the governor 2, him who crosses the waters 3.

column1: ūrjaḥ napātam adhvare dīdi vāṁsam upa dyavi agnim īl̥e kavi kratum
column2: I magnify 1 the child of vigour at this sacrifice, who shines under the heaven, the thoughtful Agni.

column1: īl̥enyaḥ namasyaḥ tiraḥ tamāṁsi darśataḥ sam agniḥ idhyate vr̥ṣā
column2: He who should be magnified and adored, who is visible through the darkness, Agni, the manly, is kindled 1.

column1: vr̥ṣo iti agniḥ sam idhyate aśvaḥ na deva vāhanaḥ tam haviṣmantaḥ īl̥ate
column2: Agni, the manly, is kindled, he who draws hither the gods like a horse. The (worshippers) rich in offerings magnify him.

column1: vr̥ṣaṇam tvā vayam vr̥ṣan vr̥ṣaṇaḥ sam idhīmahi agne dīdyatam br̥hat
column2: We the manly ones will kindle thee the manly (god), O manly Agni who shinest mightily.

column1: agne juṣasva naḥ haviḥ purol̥āśam jāta vedaḥ prātaḥ sāve dhiyāvaso itidhiyāvaso
column2: O Agni Gâtavedas, accept graciously our offering, the sacrificial cake at the morning libation, O god who givest wealth for our prayers.

column1: purol̥āḥ agne pacataḥ tubhyam vā gha pari kr̥taḥ tam juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
column2: The sacrificial cake, O Agni, has been baked or made ready for thee: accept it graciously, O youngest (god).

column1: agne vīhi purol̥āśam āhutam tiraḥ ahnyam sahasaḥ sūnuḥ asi adhvare hitaḥ
column2: Agni, accept eagerly the sacrificial cake which has been offered, which has stood overnight. Thou art the son of strength, established at the sacrifice.

column1: mādhyandine savane jāta vedaḥ purol̥āśam iha kave juṣasva agne yahvasya tava bhāga dheyam na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
column2: At the midday libation, Gâtavedas, accept here graciously the sacrificial cake, O sage. Agni, the wise ones do not diminish at the sacrificial distributions 1 the portion which belongs to thee, the vigorous one 2.

column1: agne tr̥tīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ purol̥āśam sahasaḥ sūno iti āhutam atha deveṣu adhvaram vipanyayā dhāḥ ratna vantam amr̥teṣu jāgr̥vim
column2: Agni, at the third libation take joyfully the sacrificial cake, O son of strength, which has been offered. And in thy admirable way place our wakeful sacrifice, blessed with treasures, before the immortal gods.

column1: agne vr̥dhānaḥ āhutim purol̥āśam jāta vedaḥ juṣasva tiraḥ ahnyam
column2: Agni, grown strong, O Gâtavedas, accept graciously our offering, the sacrificial cake which has stood overnight.

column1: asti idam adhi manthanam asti pra jananam kr̥tam etām viśpatnīm ā bhara agnim manthāma pūrva thā
column2: 1 This is the support on which the rubbing (for producing the fire) is performed 2; the creative organ 3 has been prepared. Bring hither the house-wife 4; let us produce Agni by rubbing in the old way.

column1: araṇyoḥ ni hitaḥ jāta vedāḥ garbhaḥ iva su dhitaḥ garbhiṇīṣu dive di ve īḍyaḥ jāgr̥vat bhiḥ haviṣmat bhiḥ manuṣyebhiḥ agniḥ
column2: In the two fire-sticks dwells Gâtavedas, as the germ (lies) safe in pregnant women—Agni who should be magnified 1 day by day by wakeful men who bring offerings.

column1: uttānāyām ava bhara cikitvān sadyaḥ pra vītā vr̥ṣaṇam jajāna aruṣa stūpaḥ ruśat asya pājaḥ il̥āyāḥ putraḥ vayune ajaniṣṭa
column2: Place it 1 skilfully into her who lies extended 2. Having conceived she has quickly given birth to the manly one. He whose summit is red—bright is his splendour—the son of Ilâ has been born in the (due) way 3.

column1: il̥āyāḥ tvā pade vayam nābhā pr̥thivyāḥ adhi jāta vedaḥ ni dhīmahi agne havyāya vol̥have
column2: In the place of Ilâ, on the navel of the earth we will lay thee down, Gâtavedas, that thou, O Agni, mayst carry the offerings (to the gods).

column1: manthata naraḥ kavim advayantam pra cetasam amr̥tam su pratīkam yajñasya ketum prathamam purastāt agnim naraḥ janayata su śevam
column2: Rub, ye men, the truthful sage, the wise, the immortal, the fair-faced. Bring forth, ye men, Agni, the banner of sacrifice, the first in the front, the gracious one.

column1: yadi manthanti bāhu bhiḥ vi rocate aśvaḥ na vājī aruṣaḥ vaneṣu ā citraḥ na yāman aśvinoḥ ani vr̥taḥ pari vr̥ṇakti aśmanaḥ tr̥ṇā dahan
column2: When they produce him by rubbing with their arms, he shines forth laming in the wood like a red race-horse. Like the bright one on the path of the Asvins 1 the unrestrained (Agni) spares the stones, burning the grass 2.

column1: jātaḥ agniḥ rocate cekitānaḥ vājī vipraḥ kavi śastaḥ su dānuḥ yam devāsaḥ īḍyam viśva vidam havya vāham adadhuḥ adhvareṣu
column2: Agni, when born, shines forth resplendent, the racer, the priest, praised by the sages, the giver of rain, whom the gods placed in the sacrifices, to be magnified, as the omniscient carrier of the sacrificial offerings.

column1: sīda hotariti sve oṁ iti loke cikitvān sādaya yajñam su kr̥tasya yonau deva avīḥ devān haviṣā yajāsi agne br̥hat yajamāne vayaḥ dhāḥ
column2: Sit down, O Hotri, in the space which is thine, as the knowing one. Place the sacrifice in the abode of good works (i. e. on the altar). Eagerly longing for the gods thou shalt worship the gods by offerings. Agni, bestow mighty vigour on the sacrificer.

column1: kr̥ṇota dhūmam vr̥ṣaṇam sakhāyaḥ asredhantaḥ itana vājam accha ayam agniḥ pr̥tanāṣāṭ su vīraḥ yena devāsaḥ asahanta dasyūn
column2: Produce a mighty 1 smoke, ye friends. Without fail go forward towards strength. This Agni is the conqueror in battles, rich in valiant men, he by whom the gods have overpowered the Dasyus.

column1: ayam te yoniḥ r̥tviyaḥ yataḥ jātaḥ arocathāḥ tam jānan agne ā sīda atha naḥ vardhaya giraḥ
column2: This is thy birth-place in due time whence born thou shonest forth; knowing it, O Agni, sit down on it, and make our prayers prosper.

column1: tanū napāt ucyate garbhaḥ āsuraḥ narāśaṁsaḥ bhavati yat vi jāyate mātariśvā yat amimīta mātari vātasya sargaḥ abhavat sarīmaṇi
column2: He is called Tanûnapât as the Asura's germ. Narâsamsa he becomes when he is born, Mâtarisvan when he has been shaped in the mother 1. And he has become the rush of the wind in his swift course 2,

column1: suniḥ mathā niḥ mathitaḥ su nidhā ni hitaḥ kaviḥ agne su adhvarā kr̥ṇu devān deva yate yaja
column2: Rubbed forth by skilful rubbing, established by skilful establishing, as a sage, O Agni, perform excellent sacrifices. Sacrifice to the gods for him who is devoted to the gods 1.

column1: ajījanan amr̥tam martyāsaḥ asremāṇam taraṇim vīl̥u jambham daśa svasāraḥ agruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṁsam jātam abhi sam rabhante
column2: The mortals have generated the immortal one, the … 1, advancing one with strong jaws. The ten unwedded sisters 2 united take care of the man (Agni) when he has been born.

column1: pra sapta hotā sanakāt arocata mātuḥ upa sthe yat aśocat ūdhani na ni miṣati su raṇaḥ dive dive yat asurasya jaṭharāt ajāyata
column2: He the god of the seven Hotris shone forth from of old, when he flamed up in his mother's lap, at her udder. Day by day the joyous one never closes his eyes, when he has been born from the Asura's (i. e. of the Heaven's?) belly 1.

column1: amitra yudhaḥ marutām iva pra yāḥ prathama jāḥ brahmaṇaḥ viśvam it viduḥ dyumna vat brahma kuśikāsaḥ ā īrire ekaḥ ekaḥ dame agn im sam īdhire
column2: The onsets of (Agni) when he attacks his enemies, are like those of the Maruts. (He is) the first-born (son) of the sacred spell. They know every (fire) 1. The Kusikas have raised their brilliant spell; they have kindled Agni, every one in his house.

column1: yat adya tvā pra yati yajñe asmin hotariti cikitvaḥ avr̥ṇīmahi iha dhruvam ayāḥ dhruvam uta aśamiṣṭha#aḥ pra jānan vidvān upa yāhi somam
column2: After we had chosen thee here to-day, O wise Hotri, while this sacrifice was going on, thou hast firmly sacrificed and firmly laboured. Come to this Soma, expert and knowing!

column1: tvām hi agne sadam it sa manyavaḥ devāsaḥ devam aratim ni erire iti kratvā ni erire amartyam yajata martyeṣu ā devam ādevam janata pra cetasam viśvam ādevam janata pra cetasam
column2: Thee, O Agni, the gods concordantly have ever set to work as their divine steward; with this intention 1 they have set thee to work. They have generated 2 thee, O worshipful one 2, the immortal among the mortals, the wise, god-loving god; they have generated every wise, god-loving (Agni) 3.

column1: saḥ bhrātaram varuṇam agne ā vavr̥tsva devān accha su matī yajña vanasam jyeṣṭham yajña vanasam r̥ta vānam ādityam carṣaṇi dhr̥tam rājānam carṣaṇi dhr̥tam
column2: Do thou, [O Agni 1,] turn to brother Varuna, towards the gods 2 with thy kindness 3, to (Varuna) who accepts the sacrifice, to the eldest (god) who accepts the sacrifice, the righteous Âditya who supports the (human) tribes, the king who supports the (human) tribes.

column1: sakhe sakhāyam abhi ā vavr̥tsva āśum na cakram rathyāiva raṁhyā asmabhyam dasma raṁhyā agne mr̥l̥īkam varuṇe sacā vidaḥ marut su viśva bhānuṣu tokāya tuje śuśucāna śam kr̥dhi asmabhyam dasma śam kr̥dhi
column2: O friend, turn to thy friend (Varuna), as a wheel of a chariot 1 rapidly (follows) the swift (horse), for our sake, O wonderful one, rapidly. O Agni, find mercy (for us) with Varuna, with the all-brilliant Maruts. Bless (us), O flaming one, that we may propagate ourselves, that we may press onward; bless us, O wonderful one!

column1: tvam naḥ agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya hel̥aḥ ava yāsisīṣṭhāḥ yajiṣṭhaḥ vahni tamaḥ śośucānaḥ viśvā dveṣāṁsi pra mumugdhi asmat
column2: Mayst thou, O Agni, who knowest Varuna, deprecate for us the god's anger. Being the best sacrificer, the best carrier (of the gods), flaming, remove from us all hatred.

column1: saḥ tvam naḥ agne avamaḥ bhava ūtī nediṣṭhaḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vi uṣṭau ava yakṣva naḥ varuṇam rarāṇaḥ vīhi mr̥l̥īkam su havaḥ naḥ edhi
column2: As such, O Agni, be for us the lowest  1 (god) with thy help, our nearest (friend) while this dawn shines forth. Being liberal (towards us), cause, by sacrificing, Varuna to go away from us. Love mercy; readily hear our call.

column1: asya śreṣṭhā su bhagasya sam dr̥k devasya citra tamā martyeṣu śuci ghr̥tam na taptam aghnyāyāḥ spārhā devasya maṁhanāiva dhenoḥ
column2: His, the fortunate god's, appearance is excellent, and most brilliant among mortals. Like the bright, heated butter of the cow (the appearance) of the god is lovely, like the bountifulness of a milch-cow.

column1: triḥ asya tā paramā santi satyā spārhā devasya janimāni agneḥ anante antariti pari vītaḥ ā agāt śuciḥ śukraḥ aryaḥ rorucānaḥ
column2: Three 1 are those highest, true, and lovely births of this god Agni. Being enveloped in the infinite 2 he has come hither, the bright, brilliant, shining Aryan.

column1: saḥ dūtaḥ viśvā it abhi vaṣṭi sadma hotā hiraṇya rathaḥ ram sujihvaḥ rohit aśvaḥ vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā sadā raṇvaḥ pitumatī iva saṁsat
column2: He, the messenger, longs for all seats, the Hotri with the golden chariot, with the lovely tongue, with the red horses, of marvellous appearance, brilliant, always lovely like an assembly abundant in food.

column1: saḥ cetayat manuṣaḥ yajña bandhuḥ pra tam mahyā raśanayā nayanti saḥ kṣeti asya duryāsu sādhan devaḥ martasya sadhani tvam āpa
column2: He, the kinsman of sacrifice, has enlightened men 1. They lead him forward by a great rope 2. He dwells in his (the mortal's) dwelling, accomplishing (his task). The god has obtained the companionship of the mortal.

column1: saḥ tu naḥ agniḥ nayatu pra jānan accha ratnam deva bhaktam yat asya dhiyā yat viśve amr̥tāḥ akr̥ṇvan dyauḥ pitā janitā satyam ukṣan
column2: May this Agni, the knowing one, lead us to the god-given treasure which belongs to him 1. That (treasure) which all the immortals have created by their thought, which Dyaus, the father, the begetter (has created): that real (treasure) they have besprinkled 2.

column1: saḥ jāyata prathamaḥ pastyāsu mahaḥ budhne rajasaḥ asya yonau apāt aśīrṣā guhamānaḥ antā āyoyuvānaḥ vr̥ṣabhasya nīl̥e
column2: He has been born in the dwellings as the first, at the bottom of the great (air) 1, in the womb of this air 2, footless, headless, hiding both his ends, drawing towards himself (his limbs?), in the nest of the bull 3.

column1: pra śardhaḥ ārta prathamam vi panyā r̥tasya yonā vr̥ṣabhasya nīl̥e spārhaḥ yuvā vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā sapta priyāsaḥ ajanayanta vr̥ṣṇe
column2: The host 1 came forth wonderfully at first, in the womb of Rita, in the nest of the bull 2, lovely and young, of marvellous appearance, and brilliant 3. Seven friends 4 were born for the bull.

column1: asmākam atra pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ abhi pra seduḥ r̥tam āśuṣāṇāḥ aśma vrajāḥ su dughā vavre antaḥ ut usrāḥ ājan uṣasaḥ huvānāḥ
column2: Here our human fathers have sat down 1, aspiring after Rita 2. Invoking the dawns 3, they have driven out the milch-cows which dwelt in the rock-stable, in the prison.

column1: te marmr̥jat a dadr̥ vāṁsaḥ adrim tat eṣām anye abhitaḥ vi vocan paśva yantrāsaḥ abhi kāram arcan vidanta jyotiḥ cakr̥panta dhībhiḥ
column2: Having rent the rock they cleaned themselves. Others around told forth that (deed) of theirs. Taking … as an instrument (?) 1, they sang triumphantly 2. They found the light; they chanted their prayers.

column1: te gavyatā manasā dr̥dhram ubdham gāḥ yemānam pari santam adrim dr̥l̥ham naraḥ vacasā daivyena vrajam go mantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ
column2: Longing for the cows in their mind, those men, the Usigs 1, have opened with godly words the fast-holding, closed rock, which enclosed and encompassed the cows, the firm stable full of cows.

column1: te manvata prathamam nāma dhenoḥ triḥ sapta mātuḥ paramāṇi vindan tat jānatīḥ abhi anūṣata vrāḥ āviḥ bhuvat aruṇīḥ yaśasā goḥ
column2: They have devised the first name of the milch-cow; they have found the three times seven highest (names or essences) of the mother 1. The hosts 2, understanding this, acclaimed. The red one 3 became visible through the brilliant (milk?) 4 of the cow.

column1: neśat tamaḥ dudhitam rocata dyauḥ ut devyāḥ uṣasaḥ bhānuḥ arta ā sūryaḥ br̥hataḥ tiṣṭhat ajrān r̥ju marteṣu vr̥jina ca paśyan
column2: The confused 1 darkness disappeared; the sky appeared in splendour; the shine of the goddess Dawn rose up. The Sun ascended to the wide plains, beholding right and wrong deeds among the mortals.

column1: āt it paścā bubudhānāḥ vi akhyan āt it ratnam dhārayanta dyu bhaktam viśve viśvāsu duryāsu devāḥ mitra dhiye varuṇa satyam astu
column2: Then, afterwards, being awoke they looked around; then they took that treasure given by Heaven, all the gods in all the houses. O Mitra, may true (fulfilment) belong to (our) prayer, O Varuna!

column1: accha voceya śuśucānam agnim hotāram viśva bharasam yajiṣṭham śuci ūdhaḥ atr̥ṇat na gavām andhaḥ na pūtam pari siktam aṁśoḥ
column2: I will address flaming Agni, the Hotri, the supporter of everything 1, the best sacrificer. He has perforated, as it were, the pure udder of the cows, (and has made flow the milk) purified like the poured sap of the Soma shoots.

column1: viśveṣām aditiḥ yajñiyānām viśveṣām atithiḥ mānuṣāṇām agniḥ devānām avaḥ āvr̥ṇānaḥ su mr̥l̥īkaḥ bhavatu jāta vedāḥ
column2: He, the Aditi (i. e. the freedom) of all the worshipful gods, the guest 1 of all men, Agni, choosing (for us) the protection of all gods—may he, Gâtavedas, be merciful.

column1: yaḥ martyeṣu amr̥taḥ r̥ta vā devaḥ deveṣu aratiḥ ni dhāyi hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ mahnā śucadhyai havyaiḥ agniḥ manuṣaḥ īrayadhyai
column2: He who has been established as the steward among the mortals, the immortal, righteous one, and among the gods, being a god himself, the Hotri, the best sacrificer shall mightily flame 1; Agni shall rise up 1 with the offerings of Manus.

column1: iha tvam sūno iti sahasaḥ naḥ adya jātaḥ jātān ubhayān antaḥ agne dūtaḥ īyase yyjānaḥ ṣv r̥ju muṣkān vr̥ṣaṇaḥ śukrān ca
column2: Here, O Agni, son of strength, thou goest for us to-day as a messenger, thou who art born, between the two races (of men and gods), having harnessed, O tall one, thy puissant, manly, brilliant (stallions) 1.

column1: atyā vr̥dhasnū itivr̥dha snū rohitā ghr̥tasnūitighr̥ta snū r̥tasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā antaḥ īyase aruṣā yujānaḥ yuṣmān ca devān viśaḥ ā ca martān
column2: Harnessing the two mighty, red steeds that swim in ghee—(the steeds) of Rita, I think, that are most swift with their mind 1, the ruddy ones, thou goest (as a messenger) between you, the gods, and the tribes of men 2.

column1: aryamaṇam varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇūiti marutaḥ aśvinā uta su aśvaḥ agne su rathaḥ su rādhāḥ ā it oṁ iti vaha su haviṣe janāya
column2: O Agni, with thy good horses, and thy good chariot, rich in bounties, bring hither from among them (the gods) 1 Aryaman, Varuna, and Mitra, Indra and Vishnu, the Maruts and the Asvins, to him who offers good oblations.

column1: go mān agne avi mān aśvī yajñaḥ nr̥vat sakhā sadam it apra mr̥ṣyaḥ il̥āvān eṣaḥ asura prajāvān dīrghaḥ rayiḥ pr̥thu budhnaḥ sabhāvān
column2: This sacrifice, O Agni, is rich in cows 1, in sheep and horses, in manly friends; it is never to be despised; it is rich in nourishment, O wonderful lord 2, rich in offspring; it is long-lasting wealth, broad-based, with (brilliant) assemblies.

column1: yaḥ te idhmam jabharat siṣvidānaḥ mūrdhānam vā tatapate tvāyā bhuvaḥ tasya sva tavān pāyuḥ agne viśvasmāt sīm agha yataḥ uruṣya
column2: 1 Be a self-strong protector, O Agni, of the man who in the sweat of his brow brings fuel to thee 2, or heats his head desirous to worship thee. Deliver him from every harmful man.

column1: yaḥ te bharāt anni yate cit annam ni śiṣat mandram atithim ut īrat ā deva yuḥ inadhate duroṇe tasmin rayiḥ dhruvaḥ astu dāsvān
column2: The man who brings food to thee who art desirous of food, he who stirs up 1 the cheerful guest and rouses him, the godly man who kindles thee in his dwelling: to him may belong lasting and generous wealth.

column1: yaḥ tvā doṣā yaḥ uṣasi pra śaṁsāt priyam vā tvā kr̥ṇavate haviṣmān aśvaḥ na sve dame ā hemyāvān tam aṁhasaḥ pīparaḥ dāśvāṁsam
column2: The sacrificer who praises thee in the evening and in the morning and gratifies thee; that liberal man thou shouldst bring across all distress, like a well-impelled horse 1, (dwelling) in his house.

column2: The man who worships thee, the immortal one, O Agni, and who honours thee, holding the sacrificial ladle—may he, the toiling (sacrificer), not be deprived of wealth; may no distress that comes from a harmful (foe), surround him.

column1: yasya tvam agne adhvaram jujoṣaḥ devaḥ martasya su dhitam rarāṇaḥ prītā it asat hotrā sā yaviṣṭha asāma yasya vidhataḥ vr̥dhāsaḥ

column2: May he, the knowing one, distinguish wisdom and folly of mortals 1, like straight and crooked backs (of horses) 2. And for the sake of wealth and noble offspring, O god, grant us Diti and keep off Aditi 3.

column1: kavim śaśāsuḥ kavayaḥ adabdhāḥ ni dhārayantaḥ duryāsu āyoḥ ataḥ tvam dr̥śyān agne etān paṭ bhiḥ paśyeḥ adbhutām aryaḥ evaiḥ
column2: The undeceived sages instructed the sage (Agni), setting him down in the dwellings of Âyu 1. Hence mayst thou behold, O Agni, with thy eyes 2 these beings visible and secret (that move) on the Arya's ways 3.

column2: Bring thou, O Agni, youngest (god), who art a good guide, a plentiful, brilliant treasure to the worshipper who presses Soma, who serves thee and toils, to help him, O brisk one, who fillest the dwellings of peoples.

column2: 1 And whatsoever we have done, O Agni, out of devotion for thee, with our feet 2, with our hands, with our bodies: (in those deeds of ours) the wise have held up the Rita, aspiring after it, like those who manage a chariot by means of the two pole-arms (?) 3.

column2: And may we be born from the Dawn, the mother, as the seven priests 1, as the first worshippers among men 2. May we be the Aṅgiras, the sons of Heaven. May we flaming break the rock which contains the prize of the contest 3.

column1: idam oṁ iti tyat mahi mahām anīkam yat usriyā sacata pūrvyam gauḥ r̥tasya pade adhi dīdyānam guhā raghu syat raghu yat viveda
column2: He has found in secret that great face of the great ones which the bright cow accompanied 1, the ancient (face) shining in the abode of Rita, the quickly running, quickly moving.

column1: adha dyutānaḥ pitroḥ sacā āsā amanuta guhyam cāru pr̥śneḥ mātuḥ pade parame anti sat goḥ vr̥ṣṇaḥ śociṣaḥ pra yatasya jihvā
column2: And resplendent near his parents (Heaven and Earth), in their presence, he thought of the secret, good (name?) of Prisni. The tongue of the manly, forward-bent flame (seized) that which was near at hand in the highest abode of the mother, the cow 1.

column1: r̥tam voce namasā pr̥cchyamānaḥ tava āśasā jāta vedaḥ yadi idam tvam asya kṣayasi yat ha viśvam divi yat oṁ iti draviṇam yat pr̥thivyām
column2: I speak, when being asked, Rita (i. e. truth), out of reverence (for Agni, or for the gods), out of hope 1 placed in thee, O Gâtavedas, as I am here 2. Thou rulest over all this wealth whatever (dwells) in heaven and earth.

column1: kim naḥ asya draviṇam kat ha ratnam vi naḥ vocaḥ jāta vedaḥ ci kitvān guhā adhvanaḥ paramam yat naḥ asya reku padam na ni dānāḥ aganma
column2: Which of this wealth is ours, what treasure? Mayst thou who knowest it declare to us (that treasure), O Gâtavedas! What is the highest (aim) of this our way, is hidden. We have not come scolding to an empty (?) 1 place.

column1: kā maryādā vayunā kat ha vāmam accha gamema raghavaḥ na vājam kadā naḥ devīḥ amr̥tasya patnīḥ sūraḥ varṇena tatanan uṣasaḥ
column2: 1 What is the limit, what the objects? What pleasant (wealth) may we obtain as swift (horses gain) the prize? When will the Dawns, the divine consorts of the immortal, expand over us with the sun's splendour?

column1: anireṇa vacasā phalgvena pratītyena kr̥dhunā atr̥pāsaḥ adha te agne k im iha vadanti anāyudhāsaḥ āsatā sacantām
column2: And what do those insatiable ones here say, O Agni, with their sapless, feeble, weak speech that has to be listened to? Let them unarmed fall into nothingness.

column1: asya śriye sam idhānasya vr̥ṣṇaḥ vasoḥ anīkam dame ā ruroca ruśat vasānaḥ sudr̥śīka rūpaḥ kṣitiḥ na rāyā puru vāraḥ adyaut
column2: The face of this kindled, manly Vasu has shone gloriously in the house. Clothed in brilliancy, with his shape beautiful to behold, the bountiful has shone like a house 1 with its wealth.

column1: ūrdhvaḥ oṁ iti su ṇaḥ adhvarasya hotaḥ agne tiṣṭha deva tātā yajīyān tvam hi viśvam abhi asi manma pra vedhasaḥ cit tirasi manīṣām
column2: Stand upright for us, O Agni, Hotri of the sacrifice, the best performer of sacrifices among the gods. For thou art the master of every thought; thou promotest the worshipper's prayer.

column1: amūraḥ hotā ni asādi vikṣu agniḥ mandraḥ vidatheṣu pra cetāḥ ūrdhvam bhānum savitāiva aśret metāiva dhūmam stabhāyat upa dyām
column2: The unerring Hotri has sat down among the people, joy-giving Agni, the wise one at the sacrifices 1. Like Savitri he has sent his light upward. Like a builder he has reared his smoke up to the sky.

column1: yatā su jūrṇiḥ rātinī ghr̥tācī pra dakṣiṇit deva tātim urāṇaḥ ut oṁ iti svaruḥ nava jāḥ na akraḥ paśvaḥ anakti su dhitaḥ su mekaḥ
column2: 1 (The ladle) glowing, filled with gifts, with butter, is stretched forth. From left to right (does Agni move) choosing the divine people. Upright (stands) the (sacrificial) post like a new-born foal 2; well-placed, well-established it anoints the victims 3.

column1: stīrṇe barhiṣi sam idhāne agnau ūrdhvaḥ adhvaryuḥ jujuṣāṇaḥ asthāt pari agniḥ paśu pāḥ na hotā tri viṣṭi eti pra divaḥ urāṇaḥ
column2: After the sacrificial grass has been spread and the fire kindled, the delighted Adhvaryu has stationed himself upright. Agni, the Hotri, chosen from of old, goes round thrice, like a shepherd.

column1: pari tmanā mita druḥ eti hotā agniḥ mandraḥ madhu vacāḥ r̥ta vā dravanti asya vājinaḥ na śokāḥ bhayante viśvā bhuvanā yat abhrāṭ
column2: As Hotri, measuredly running, Agni, the joy-giving, sweet-tongued, the righteous, goes around by his own might. His flames run forward like race-horses; all beings are afraid when he has shone forth.

column1: bhadrā te agne su anīka sam dr̥k ghorasya sataḥ viṣuṇasya cāruḥ na yat te śociḥ tamasā varanta na dhvasmānaḥ tanvi repaḥ ā dhuri ti
column2: Beautiful, O fair-faced Agni, is thy aspect, who art terrible and manifold; pleasant (it is). As they have not hindered thy light by darkness, no bespatterers have left stains on thy body.

column1: na yasya sātuḥ janitoḥ avāri na mātarāpitarā nu cit iṣṭau adha mitraḥ na su dhitaḥ pāvakaḥ agniḥ dīdāya mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
column2: He whose mother (?) 1 has not been hindered from giving birth, nor his father and mother whenever they were incited (?) 2: this Agni, the purifier, well-established like Mitra 3, has shone among the tribes of men,—

column1: dviḥ yam pañca jījanan sam vasānāḥ svasāraḥ agnim mānuṣīṣu vi kṣu uṣaḥ budham atharyaḥ na dantam śukram su āsam paraśum na t igmam
column2: Agni, whom the twice-five sisters 1, dwelling together, have engendered among the human tribes, who awakes at dawn, who is bright like an elephant's (?) 2 tooth, whose mouth is beautiful, who is sharp like an axe.

column1: tava tye agne haritaḥ ghr̥ta snāḥ rohitāsaḥ r̥ju añcaḥ su añcaḥ aruṣāsaḥ vr̥ṣaṇaḥ r̥ju muṣkāḥ ā deva tātim ahvanta dasmāḥ
column2: 1 Agni, those golden horses of thine swimming in ghee, the red ones which go straight forward, the fleet ones, the brilliant, manly, wonderful horses, puissant stallions, have called hither the divine people.

column1: ye ha tye te sahamānāḥ ayāsaḥ tveṣāsaḥ agne arcayaḥ caranti śyenāsaḥ na duvasanāsaḥ artham tuvi svaṇasaḥ mārutam na śardhaḥ
column2: Those victorious, never-tiring 1, fierce flames of thine, O Agni, which move about, hasten 2 to their goal like hawks; they roar mightily like the host of the Maruts.

column1: akāri brahma sam idhāna tubhyam śaṁsāti uktham yajate vi oṁ iti dhāḥ hotāram agnim manuṣaḥ ni seduḥ namasyantaḥ uśijaḥ śaṁsam āyoḥ
column2: 1 (This) hymn has been produced for thee, O Agni, when thou wert kindled. May (the priest) recite the litany; mayst thou distribute (treasures) to him who sacrifices. Men have set down Agni as the Hotri, the Usigs, adoring (Him), the praise of Âyu 2.

column1: ayam iha prathamaḥ dhāyi dhātr̥ bhiḥ hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ yam apnavānaḥ bhr̥gavaḥ vi rurucuḥ vaneṣu citram vi bhvam viśe viśe
column2: This (Agni) has been established here as the first by the establishers, the Hotri, the best sacrificer who should be magnified at the sacrifices, whom Apnavâna and the Bhrigus have made shine, brilliant in the woods, spreading to every house.

column1: agne kadā te ānuṣak bhuvat devasya cetanam adha hi tvā jagr̥bhrire matārsaḥ vikṣu īḍyam
column2: Agni! When will the splendour of thee, the god, appear in the right way? For verily the mortals have seized thee who shouldst be magnified in the houses.

column1: r̥ta vānam vi cetasam paśyantaḥ dyām iva str̥ bhiḥ viśveṣām adhvarāṇām haskartāram dame dame
column2: Seeing the righteous, wise one, like the heaven with the stars, who produces joy at all sacrifices, from house to house—

column1: āśum dūtam vivasvataḥ viśvāḥ yaḥ carṣaṇīḥ abhi ā jabhruḥ ketum āyavaḥ bhr̥gavāṇam viśe viśe
column2: The quick messenger of Vivasvat who rules over all human tribes: Him the Âyus have brought hither to every house, the light, him who belongs to the Bhrigus.

column1: tam īm hotāram ānuṣak cikitvāṁsam ni sedire raṇvam pāvaka śociṣam yajiṣṭham sapta dhāma bhiḥ
column2: Him the knowing one they have set down in the right way as the Hotri, the gay one with his purifying flames, the best sacrificer with his seven (forms 1)—

column1: tam śaśvatīṣu mātr̥ṣu vane ā vītam aśritam citram santam guhā hitam su vedam kūcit arthinam
column2: Him who is enveloped in many mothers, in the wood 1, who does not rest thereon (?) 2, who is brilliant, though hidden in secret, easily to be found, and striving for all that is desired.

column1: sasasya yat vi yutā sasmin ūdhan r̥tasya dhāman raṇayanta devāḥ mahān agniḥ namasā rāta havyaḥ veḥ adhvarāya sadam it r̥ta vā
column2: When the gods rejoiced in the … of the herbs 1, in that udder 2, in the foundation of Rita 3, the great -Agni, to whom offerings are made with adoration, the righteous one, always approached eagerly for the sake of sacrifice.

column1: veḥ adhvarasya dūtyāni vidvān ubhe iti antariti rodasī iti sam cikitvān dūtaḥ īyase pra divaḥ urāṇaḥ viduḥ taraḥ divaḥ ārodhanāni
column2: 1 Thou, the knowing one, hast eagerly performed the messengership of the sacrifice, looking over both ends, over the two worlds. Thou goest as a messenger, chosen from of old, thou who knowest best the ascents to heaven.

column1: kr̥ṣṇam te ema ruśataḥ puraḥ bhāḥ cariṣṇu arciḥ vapuṣām it ekam yat apra vītā dadhate ha garbham sadyaḥ cit jātaḥ bhavasi it oṁ iti dūtaḥ
column2: Thy path is black. Light is before thee, the red one. Thy flame is speedy. This is one of the wonders: when the virgin conceives (thee as her) child 1, thou becomest a messenger, as soon as thou art born.

column1: sadyaḥ jātasya dadr̥śānam ojaḥ yat asya vātaḥ anu vāti śociḥ vr̥ṇakti tigmām ataseṣu jihvām sthirā cit annā dayate vi jambhaiḥ
column2: As soon as he is born, his strength shows itself, when the wind blows upon his flame. He turns his sharp tongue among the dry brushwood. Even solid food he tears to pieces with his teeth.

column1: tr̥ṣu yat annā tr̥ṣuṇā vavakṣa tr̥ṣum dūtam kr̥ṇute yahvaḥ agniḥ vātasya mel̥im sacate ni jūrvan āśum na vājayate hinve arvā
column2: When he thirstily has grown strong by thirsty food 1, restless Agni appoints a thirsty messenger. Consuming (the wood) he follows the … 2 of the wind. He seems to drive forward a quick horse; the racer speeds along.

column1: dūtam vaḥ viśva vedasam havya vāham amartyam yajiṣṭham r̥ñjase girā
column2: I press on for you with my prayer to the all-possessing messenger, the immortal bearer of offerings, the best sacrificer.

column1: saḥ hi veda vasu dhitim mahān ārodhanam divaḥ saḥ devān ā iha vakṣati
column2: He, the great one, knows indeed the place of wealth 1, the ascent to heaven; may he, (therefore,) conduct the gods hither.

column1: saḥ veda devaḥ ānamam devān r̥ta yate dame dāti priyāṇi cit vasu
column2: He, the god, knows how to direct the gods for the righteous (worshipper), in his house. He gives (us) wealth dear (to us).

column1: saḥ hotā saḥ it oṁ iti dūtyam cikitvān antaḥ īyate vidvān ārodhanam divaḥ
column2: He is the Hotri; he who knows the office of a messenger, goes to and fro (between men and gods), knowing the ascent to heaven.

column1: te syāma ye agnaye dadāśuḥ havya dātibhiḥ ye īm puṣyantaḥ indhate
column2: May we be of those who have worshipped Agni with the gift of offerings, who cause him to thrive and kindle him.

column1: te rāyā te su vīryaiḥ sasa vāṁsaḥ vi śr̥ṇvire ye agnā dadhire duvaḥ
column2: The men who have brought worship to Agni, are renowned as successful by wealth and by powerful offspring.

column1: asme iti rāyaḥ dive dive sam carantu puru spr̥haḥ asme iti vājāsaḥ īratām
column2: May much-desired wealth come to us day by day; may gains arise among us.

column1: saḥ vipraḥ carṣaṇīnām śavasā mānuṣāṇām ati kṣiprāiva vidhyati
column2: He (Agni), the priest of the tribes, (the priest) of men, pierces (all hostile powers) by his might as with a tossing 1 (bow).

column1: agne mr̥l̥a mahān asi yaḥ īm ā deva yum janam iyetha barhiḥ āsadam
column2: Agni, have mercy! Thou art great, who hast come to this pious man to sit down on the sacrificial grass.

column1: saḥ mānuṣīṣu duḥ dabhaḥ vikṣu pra avīḥ amartyaḥ dūtaḥ viśveṣām bhuvat
column2: He who cannot be deceived, the zealous, the immortal has among men become the messenger of all.

column1: saḥ sadma pari nīyate hotā mandraḥ diviṣṭiṣu uta potā ni sīdati
column2: He, the joy-giving Hotri, is led around the sacred seat at the heaven-aspiring sacrifices. And he sits down as the Potri also.

column1: uta gnāḥ agniḥ adhvare uto iti gr̥ha patiḥ dame uta brahmā ni sīdati
column2: Agni sits down also as (the sacrificer's) wife 1 at the sacrifice, and as the master of the house in the house, and as the Brahman 2.

column1: veṣi hi adhvari yatām upa vaktā janānām havyā ca mānuṣāṇām
column2: Thou zealously approachest as the Upavaktri 1 of the people who perform the sacrificial service, and (thou approachest) the offerings of men.

column1: veṣi it oṁ iti asya dūtyam yasya jujoṣaḥ adhvaram havyam martasya vol̥have
column2: And thou zealously performest the messenger-ship for the man in whose sacrifice thou takest pleasure, in order to bear the mortal's offering (to the gods).

column1: asmākam joṣi adhvaram asmākam yajñam aṅgiraḥ asmākam śr̥ṇudhi havam
column2: Find pleasure 1 in our rites, in our sacrifice, O Aṅgiras. Hear our call!

column1: pari te duḥ dabhaḥ rathaḥ asmān aśnotu viśvataḥ yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ
column2: May thy unerring chariot, by which thou protectest the worshippers, encompass us from every side.

column1: agne tam adya aśvam na stomaiḥ kratum na bhadram hr̥di spr̥śam r̥dhyāma te ohaiḥ
column2: 1 O Agni! May we to-day successfully perform, with thy heedfulness 2, this praise 3 which touches thy heart, which is like a horse, like auspicious power of the mind.

column1: adha hi agne kratoḥ bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ rathīḥ r̥tasya br̥hataḥ babhūtha
column2: For verily thou, O Agni, hast become the charioteer of auspicious power of the mind, of real ability, and of the mighty Rita.

column1: ebhiḥ naḥ arkaiḥ bhava naḥ arvāṅ svaḥ ṇa jyotiḥ agne viśvebhiḥ su manāḥ anīkaiḥ
column2: Through these our hymns direct thyself hither-wards to us like the sun with its light 1, O Agni, gracious with all thy faces.

column1: ābhiḥ te adya gīḥ bhiḥ gr̥ṇantaḥ agne dāśema pra te divaḥ na stanayanti śuṣmāḥ
column2: May we to-day worship thee, O Agni, praising thee with these songs. Thy roarings thunder like (the thunder) of Heaven.

column1: tava svādiṣṭhā agne sam dr̥ṣṭiḥ idā cit ahnaḥ idā cit aktoḥ śriye rukmaḥ na rocate upāke
column2: Thy sweetest aspect, O Agni, shines near us for glory's sake, now by day, now by night, like gold.

column1: ghr̥tam na pūtam tanūḥ arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam tat te rukmaḥ na rocata svadhāvaḥ
