column2: Like purified ghrita is thy stainless body; (it is) brilliant gold: that (body) of thine has shone 1, O self-dependent one, like gold.

column1: kr̥tam cit hi sma sanemi dveṣaḥ agne inoṣi martāt itthā yajamānāt r̥ta vaḥ
column2: For even a malice which one has committed, thou verily drivest away entirely, O righteous Agni, from the sacrificing mortal 1.

column1: śivā naḥ sakhyā santu bhrātrā agne deveṣu yuṣme iti sā naḥ nābhiḥ sadane sasmin ūdham
column2: May our friendship, O Agni, our brotherhood with you, the gods, be blessed. This is our navel (i. e. relation) in our seat, in this udder 1.

column1: bhadram te agne sahasin anīkam upāke ā rocate sūryasya ruśat dr̥śe dadr̥śe nakta yā cit arūkṣitam dr̥śe ā rūpe annam
column2: Thy auspicious face, O mighty Agni, shines in the neighbourhood of the sun 1. Brilliant to see, it is seen even by night. Soft to behold is the food in thy (beautiful) body 2.

column1: vi sāhi agne gr̥ṇate manīṣām kham vepasā tuvi jāta stavānaḥ viśvebhiḥ yat vavanaḥ śukra devaiḥ tat naḥ rāsva su mahaḥ bhūri manma
column2: O Agni, disclose (wise) thoughts for him who praises thee; (disclose) the opening, when thou, O strong-born, hast been praised with trembling. Grant unto us, O very great one, such a rich prayer as thou with all the gods wilt hold dear, O brilliant one.

column1: tvat agne kāvyā tvam manīṣāḥ tvat ukthā jāyante rādhyāni tvat eti draviṇam vīra peśāḥ itthādhiye dāśuṣe martyāya
column2: From thee, O Agni, genius is born, from thee (wise) thoughts, from thee beneficent hymns. From thee comes wealth adorned with heroes 1 to the thus-minded mortal who worships thee.

column1: tvat vājī vājam bharaḥ vi hāyāḥ abhiṣṭi kr̥t jāyate satya śuṣmaḥ tvat rayiḥ deva jūtaḥ mayaḥ bhuḥ tvat āśuḥ jūju vān agne arvā
column2: Thee, O Agni, the pious mortals seek to win by their prayers as the first, thee the god with agreeable speech, O immortal, who drivest away malice, the household god, the lord of the house, the wise one.

column1: tvām agne prathamam deva yantaḥ devam bhartā amr̥ta mandra jihvam dveṣaḥ yutam ā vivāsanti dhībhiḥ damūnasam gr̥ha patim amūram
column2: (Drive) far from us senselessness and anguish; (drive) far all ill-will from him whom thou attendest 1. Be gracious at evening, Agni, son of strength, to him whom thou, the god, attendest with welfare.

column1: yaḥ tvām agne inadhate yata sruk triḥ te annam kr̥ṇavat sasmin ahan saḥ su dyumnaiḥ abhi astu pra sakṣat tava kratvā jāta vedaḥ cikitvān
column2: May the man who holds the sacrificial ladle and kindles thee, O Agni, who thrice prepares food for thee on this day, victoriously overcome (his foes) through his lustre, wise through the power of thy mind, O Gâtavedas.

column1: idhmam yaḥ te jabharat śaśramāṇaḥ mahaḥ agne anīkam ā saparyan saḥ idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣasam puṣyan rayim sacate ghnan amitrān
column2: 1 He who toiling brings fuel to thee, doing service to thy, the great (god's) face, O Agni, kindling thee at evening and at dawn—he prospers, obtains wealth, and destroys his enemies.

column1: agniḥ āśe br̥hataḥ kṣatriyasya agniḥ vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ dadhāti ratnam vidhate yaviṣṭhaḥ vi ānuṣak martyāya svadhāvān
column2: Agni is master of mighty royal power 1; Agni (is master) of gain, of the highest wealth. He, the youngest, self-dependent (god) in the right way distributes treasures to the mortal worshipper.

column1: yat cit hi te puruṣa trā yaviṣṭha acitti bhiḥ cakr̥ma kat cit āgaḥ kr̥dhi su asmān aditeḥ anāgān vi enāṁsi śiśrathaḥ viṣvak agne
column2: Whatever sin, O youngest (god), we have committed against thee in thoughtlessness, men as we are 1, make thou us sinless before Aditi; release us from (every) guilt on all sides, O Agni!

column1: mahaḥ cit agne enasaḥ abhīke ūrvāt devānām uta martyānām mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam it riṣāma yaccha tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
column2: Even from great guilt, O Agni, from the prison of gods and of mortals—let us, thy friends, never be harmed; grant luck and weal to kith and kin.

column1: yathā ha tyat vasavaḥ gauryam cit padi sitām amuñcata yajatrāḥ evo iti su asmat muñcata vi aṁhaḥ pra tāri agne pra taram naḥ āyuḥ
column2: 1 As you formerly have released, O Vasus, the buffalo cow bound by the foot, O worshipful gods, thus take away from us this distress. May, O Agni, our life be further prolonged.

column1: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat vi bhātīnām su manāḥ ratna dheyam yātam aśvinā su kr̥taḥ duroṇam ut sūryaḥ jyotiṣā devaḥ eti
column2: Benevolent Agni has looked on the breaking of the shining dawns, on the bestowal of treasures. Come to the dwelling of the virtuous (mortal), ye Asvins. The god Sûrya rises with his light.

column1: ūrdhvam bhānum savitā devaḥ aśret drapsam davidhvat go iṣaḥ na satvā anu vratam varuṇaḥ yanti mitraḥ yat sūryam divi ārohayanti
column2: The god Savitri has sent his light upward 1, shaking his banner 2 like a warrior who fights for cows 3. Varuna and Mitra follow the law, when they make the Sun rise on heaven.

column1: yam sīm akr̥ṇvan tamase vi pr̥ce dhruva kṣemāḥ anava syantaḥ atharm tam sūryam haritaḥ sapta yahvīḥ spaśam viśvasya jagataḥ vahanti
column2: Him whom (the gods) dwelling in firm peace, and never losing their object, have created for dispersing the darkness—Him, the Sun, the all-observer, the seven young fallow mares carry forward.

column1: vahiṣṭebhiḥ vi haran yāsi tantum ava vyayan asitam deva vasma davidhvataḥ raśmayaḥ sūryasya carma iva ava adhuḥ tamaḥ ap su antariti
column2: With (thy horses) most ready to run thou goest 1 forward, spreading out thy web (of light), removing (from the world) the black cloth (of darkness), O god. The rays of the Sun have shaken 2 the darkness, and have sunk it into the waters like a hide.

column1: anāyataḥ ani baddhaḥ kathā ayam nyaṅ uttānaḥ ava padyate na kayā yāti svadhayā kaḥ dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ sam r̥taḥ pāti nākam
column2: Unsupported, unattached, spread out downwards-turned—how is it that he 1 does not fall down? By what power of his does he move? Who has seen (that)? Erected as the pillar of Heaven he protects the firmament.

column1: prati agniḥ uṣasaḥ jāta vedāḥ akhyat devaḥ rocamānāḥ mahaḥ bhiḥ ā nāsatyā uru gāyā rathena imam yajñam upa naḥ yātam accha
column2: Agni Gâtavedas, the god, has looked on the dawns that shine with all their might 1. Come hither, O Nâsatyas 2, wide-ruling (gods), on your chariot to this our sacrifice.

column1: ūrdhvam ketum savitā devaḥ aśret jyotiḥ viśvasmai bhuvanāya kr̥ṇvan ā aprāḥ dyāvāpr̥thivī iti antarikṣam vi sūryaḥ raśmi bhiḥ cekitānaḥ
column2: The god Savitri has sent his shine upward, producing light for the whole world. The Sun, shining with his rays, has filled Heaven and Earth and the air.

column1: āvahantī aruṇīḥ jyotiṣā ā agāt mahī citrā raśmi bhiḥ cekitānā pra bodhayantī su vitāya devī uṣāḥ īyate su yujā rathena
column2: The red one 1, carrying hither (bliss) 2, has come with her light, the great, brilliant one, shining with her rays. Ushas, the goddess, awakening (all beings) to welfare, goes along on her well-yoked chariot.

column1: ā vām vahiṣṭhāḥ iha te vahantu rathāḥ aśvāsaḥ uṣasaḥ vi uṣṭau ime hi vām madhu peyāya somāḥ asmin yajñe vr̥ṣaṇā mādayethām
column2: May those chariots and horses, most ready to drive, drive you 1 hither at the break of dawn. For these Somas are for you that you may drink the honey-drink 2. Rejoice, O manly ones, at this sacrifice.

column1: anāyataḥ ani baddhaḥ kathā ayam nyaṅ uttānaḥ ava padyate na kayā yāti svadhayā kaḥ dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ sam r̥taḥ pāti nākam
agniḥ hotā naḥ adhvare vājī san pari nīyate devaḥ deveṣu yajñiyaḥ
column2: Agni, the Hotri, he who is a strong horse, is led around at our sacrifice, the god worshipful among the gods.

column1: pari tri viṣṭi adhvaram yāti agniḥ rathīḥ iva ā deveṣu prayaḥ dadhat
column2: Agni goes thrice 1 around the sacrifice, like a charioteer, conveying the enjoyment 2 to the gods.

column1: pari vāja patiḥ kaviḥ agniḥ havyāni akramīt dadhat ratnāni dāśuṣe
column2: Agni, the lord of booty, the sage, has circumambulated the oblations, bestowing treasures on the worshipper.

column1: ayam yaḥ sr̥ñjaye puraḥ daiva vāte sam idhyate dyu mān amitra dambhanaḥ
column2: This (is the Agni) who is kindled in the front for Devavâta's son, the Sriñgaya 1, the brilliant (god), the deceiver of foes.

column1: asya gha vīraḥ īvataḥ agneḥ īśīta martyaḥ tigma jambhasya mīl̥huṣaḥ
column2: May the strong mortal be the master of this (god), of an Agni like this, with sharp teeth and bountiful.

column1: tam arvantam na sānasim aruṣam na divaḥ śiśum marmr̥jyante dive dive
column2: 1 Him they clean day by day like a racer that wins (booty), like (Soma), the red young child of Heaven 2.

column1: bodhat yat mā hari bhyām kumāraḥ sāha devyaḥ accha na hūtaḥ ut aram
column2: When Sahadeva's son, the prince, thought of me with two bay horses 1, I rose up like one who is called.

column1: uta tyā yajatā harī iti kumārāt sāhadevyāt pra yatā sadyaḥ ā dade
column2: And immediately I accepted from Sahadeva's son, the prince, those adorable two bay horses which he offered me.

column1: eṣaḥ vām devau aśvinā kumāraḥ sāha devyaḥ dīrgha āyuḥ astu somakaḥ
column2: May this prince Somaka, Sahadeva's son, live long, for your sake, O divine Asvins!

column1: tam yuvam devau aśvinā kumāram sāha devyam dīrgha āyuṣam kr̥ṇotana
column2: Give long life, O divine Asvins, to this son of Sahadeva, the prince!

column1: abodhi agniḥ sam idhā janānām prati dhenum iva āyatīm uṣasam yahvāḥ iva pra vayām ut jihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam accha
column2: Agni has been wakened by the fuel of men, in face of the Dawn who approaches like a milch-cow. His flames stream forward to the sky like quick (birds) that fly up to a branch.

column1: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvaḥ agniḥ su manāḥ prātaḥ asthāt sam iddhasya ruśat adarśi pājaḥ mahān devaḥ tamasaḥ niḥ amoci
column2: The Hotri has been wakened that there may be sacrifice for the gods. Gracious Agni has stood upright in the morning. When he has been kindled, his brilliant stream of flames has been seen. The great god has been released from darkness.

column1: yat īm gaṇasya raśanām ajīgariti śuciḥ aṅkte śuci bhiḥ go bhiḥ agniḥ āt dakṣiṇā yujyate vāja yantī uttānām ūrdhvaḥ adhayat juhūbhiḥ
column2: When he has wakened the string of the crowd (of worshippers) 1, the bright Agni anoints himself with bright cows 2. Then the Dakshinâ is yoked, striving for gain 3. He who stands upright has, by the sacrificial ladles, sucked her who lies extended 4.

column1: agnim accha deva yatām manāṁsi cakṣūṁṣī iva sūrye sam caranti yat īm suvāte uṣasā virūpeitivi rūpe śvetaḥ vājī jāyate agre ahnām
column2: Towards Agni the minds of the pious turn together as (all) eyes (turn) to the sun. When both Dawns of different colour 1 give birth to him, the white racer is born at the beginning of days.

column1: janiṣṭa hi jenyaḥ agre ahnām hitaḥ hiteṣu aruṣaḥ vaneṣu dame dame sapta ratnā dadhānaḥ agniḥ hotā ni sasāda yajīyān
column2: For He, the noble one, has been born at the beginning of days, the red one has been laid down in the woods that have been laid down. Agni, the Hotri, the best sacrificer, has sat down, bestowing his seven treasures on every house.

column1: agniḥ hotā ni asīdat yajīyān upa sthe mātuḥ surabhau oṁ iti loke yuvā kaviḥ puruniḥ ṣṭhaḥ r̥ta vā dhartā kr̥ṣṭīnām uta madhye iddhaḥ
column2: Agni, the Hotri, the best sacrificer, sat down in the mother's lap, in the sweet-smelling place, the young sage growing up in many places, the righteous one, the supporter of tribes, and kindled in their midst.

column1: pra nu tyam vipram adhvareṣu sādhum agnim hotāram īl̥ate namaḥ bhi ḥ ā yaḥ tatāna rodasī iti r̥tena nityam mr̥janti vājinam ghr̥tena
column2: They magnify with adorations that priest efficacious at sacrifices, Agni the Hotri, who has spread himself over heaven and earth according to Rita; they groom (Agni), the own racer (of men), with Ghrita.

column1: mārjālyaḥ mr̥jyate sve damūnāḥ kavi praśastaḥ atithiḥ śivaḥ naḥ sahasra śr̥ṅgaḥ vr̥ṣabhaḥ tat ojā viśvān agne sahasā pra asi anyān
column2: He who likes to be groomed, is groomed in his own (abode), the house-friend 1, praised by sages, our auspicious guest, the bull with a thousand horns who has the strength of such a one. O Agni! By this power thou surpassest all other (beings).

column1: pra sadyaḥ agne ati eṣi anyān āviḥ yasmai cāru tamaḥ babhūtha īl̥enyaḥ vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā priyaḥ viśām atithiḥ mānuṣīṇām
column2: O Agni! Thou overtakest all other (beings) in one moment (for the sake of him) to whom Thou hast become visible as the fairest one, thou who shouldst be magnified, the wonderful, brilliant one, the beloved guest of human clans.

column1: tubhyam bharanti kṣitayaḥ yaviṣṭha balim agne antitaḥ ā uta dūrāt ā bhandiṣṭhasya su matim cikiddhi br̥hat te agne mahi śarma bhadram
column2: To thee, O youngest (god), the tribes bring tribute, O Agni, from near and far. Behold 1 the grace of the most glorious (god)! Mighty, O Agni, is thy great and glorious shelter.

column1: ā adya ratham bhānu maḥ bhānum antam agne tiṣṭha yajatebhiḥ sam antam vidvān pathīnām uru antarikṣam ā iha devān haviḥ adyāya vakṣi
column2: Mount to-day, O shining Agni, the shining car, in the neighbourhood of the worshipful (gods). Knowing the paths, the wide air 1, bring hither the gods that they may eat the oblation.

column1: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vacaḥ vandāru vr̥ṣabhāya vr̥ṣṇe gaviṣṭhiraḥ namasā stomam agnau divi iva rukmam uru vyañcam aśret
column2: We have pronounced an adoring speech to the holy sage, to the manly bull. Gavishthira adoringly has sent his song of praise to Agni as the gold (i. e. the sun) far-reaching (is sent by the gods upward) to the sky.

column1: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ sam ubdham guhā bibharti na dadāti pitre anīkam asya na minat janāsaḥ puraḥ paśyanti ni hitam aratau
column2: The young mother carries in secret the boy confined 1; she does not yield him to the father. People do not see before them his fading 2 face laid down with the Arâti 3.

column1: kam etam tvam yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna pūrvīḥ h i garbhaḥ śaradaḥ vavardha apaśyam jātam yat asūta mātā
column2: Who is that boy, O young woman, whom thou, the Peshî 1, carriest? It is the queen who has borne him. Through many autumns the fruit of the womb has increased. I saw him born when his mother gave birth to him.

column1: hiraṇya dantam śuci varṇam ārāt kṣetrāt apaśyam āyudhā mimānam dadānaḥ asmai amr̥tam vipr̥kvat kim mām anindrāḥ kr̥ṇavan anukthāḥ
column2: I saw him the gold-toothed, brilliant-coloured preparing his weapons far from his dwelling-place 1. After I have offered to him the ambrosia cleared (from all impure mixture) 2—what may the Indra-less, the hymnless do to me?

column1: kṣetrāt apaśyam sanutariti carantam su mat yūtham na puru śobhamānam na tāḥ agr̥bhran ajaniṣṭa hi saḥ paliknīḥ it yuvatayaḥ bhavanti
column2: I saw him, the highly shining (Agni), walking far from his dwelling-place, like (a bull) together with the herd 1. Those (women) have not held him, for he has been born. The young women become grey 2.

column1: ke me maryakam vi yavanta gobhiḥ na yeṣām gopāḥ araṇaḥ cit āsa ye īm jagr̥bhuḥ ava te sr̥jantu ā ajāti paśvaḥ upa naḥ cikitvān
column2: Who have separated my young bull from the cows that 1 had no cow-herd, not even a stranger? May those who have held him, let him loose. May he, the knowing one, lead the cattle towards us.

column1: vasām rājānam vasatim janānām arātayaḥ ni dadhuḥ martyeṣu brahmāṇi atreḥ ava tam sr̥jantu ninditāraḥ nindyāsaḥ bhavantu
column2: Him, the king of dwellings (?) 1, the dwelling-place of people, the Arâtis have laid down 2 among men. May the spells of Atri loose him. May the reproachers become reproachable (themselves).

column1: śunaḥ śepam cit ni ditam sahasrāt yūpāt amuñcaḥ aśamiṣṭa hi saḥ eva asmat agne vi mumugdhi pāsān hotariti cikitvaḥ iha tu ni sadya
column2: Thou hast loosed the bound Sunahsepa from the thousand sacrificial posts; for he toiled (worshipping thee). Thus, O Agni, loose from us the fetters, O knowing Hotri, sitting down here.

column1: hr̥ṇīyamānaḥ apa hi mat aiye pra me devānām vrata pāḥ uvāca indraḥ vidvān anu hi tvā cacakṣa tena aham agne anu śiṣṭaḥ ā agām
column2: 1 For thou hast gone away 2 from me, because thou wert angry; (this) the protector of the laws of the gods 3 has told me. (But) Indra, the knowing one, has looked after thee. Instructed by him, O Agni, I have come hither.

column1: vi jyotiṣā br̥hatā bhāti agniḥ āviḥ viśvāni kr̥ṇute mahi tvā pra adevīḥ māyāḥ sahate duḥ evāḥ śiśīte śr̥ṅgeiti rakṣase vi nikṣe
column2: Agni shines with mighty light; he makes all things visible by his greatness. He conquers godless, wicked wiles. He sharpens his two horns in order to pierce the Rakshas.

column1: uta khānāsaḥ divi santu agneḥ tigma āyudhāḥ rakṣase hantavai oṁ iti made cit asya pra rujanti bhāmāḥ na varante pari bādhaḥ adevīḥ
column2: And may the roarings of Agni mount up to the sky, with sharp weapons in order to kill the Rakshas. In his rapture his flames break down (everything); the godless hindrances do not hold him back.

column1: etam te stomam tuvi jāta vipraḥ ratham na dhīraḥ su apāḥ atakṣam yadi it agne prati tvam deva haryāḥ svaḥ vatīḥ apaḥ ena jayema
column2: This song of praise, O strong-born (Agni), I, the priest, have fashioned for thee, as a skilful workman (builds) a chariot 1. If thou acceptest that (praise), O god Agni, may we conquer thereby waters together with the sun.

column1: tuvi grīvaḥ vr̥ṣabhaḥ vavr̥dhānaḥ aśatru aryaḥ sam ajāti vedaḥ iti imam agnim amr̥tāḥ avocan barhiṣmate manave śarma yaṁsat havi ṣmate manave śarma yaṁsat
column2: May the bull 1 with mighty neck, grown strong, with no foe to resist him, get together the niggard's wealth. Thus the immortal (gods) have spoken to this Agni: may he grant protection to the man who has spread the Barhis; may he grant protection to the man who brings offerings.

column1: tvam agne varuṇaḥ jāyase yat tvam mitraḥ bhavasi yat sam iddhaḥ tve viśve sahasaḥ putra devāḥ tvam indraḥ dāśuṣe martyāya
column2: Thou, O Agni, art Varuna, when born; thou becomest Mitra when kindled. In thee, O son of strength, the Visvedevâs (dwell). Thou art Indra for the mortal worshipper.

column1: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnām nāma svadhāvan guhyam bibharṣi añjanti mitram su dhitam na gobhiḥ yat dampatī itidam patī sa manasā kr̥ṇoṣi
column2: Thou becomest Aryaman when thou bearest 1 the secret name of the maidens, O self-dependent one. They anoint (thee) with cows 2 like the well-established Mitra 3, when thou makest husband and wife one-minded.

column1: tava śriye marutaḥ marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram padam yat viṣṇoḥ upa mam ni dhāyi tena pāsi guhyam nāma gonām
column2: For thy glory the Maruts have cleansed themselves 1, who are thy fair and brilliant offspring, O Rudra 2! The footprint of Vishnu which is put down in the highest place: therewith thou protectest the secret name of the cows.

column1: tava śriyā su dr̥śaḥ deva devāḥ puru dadhānāḥ amr̥tam sapanta hotāram agnim manuṣaḥ ni seduḥ daśasyantaḥ uśijaḥ śaṁsam āyoḥ
column2: By thy beauty, O god, the gods are beautiful to behold 1. Assuming many (powers or goods) they attached themselves to immortality. Men have set down Agni as the Hotri, the Usigs, honouring (him), the praise of Âyu 2.

column1: na tvat hotā pūrvaḥ agne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paraḥ asti svadhāvaḥ viśaḥ ca yasyāḥ atithiḥ bhavāsi saḥ yajñena vana vat deva martān
column2: There is no (other) Hotri before thee, a better sacrificer 1; no one surpasses thee, O self-dependent one, by wisdom. And that house of which thou art the guest, he 2, O god, will overcome the mortals by his sacrifice.

column1: vayam agne vanuyāma tvāūtāḥ vasu yavaḥ haviṣā budhyamānāḥ vayam sa marye vidatheṣu ahnām vayam rāyā sahasaḥ putra martān
column2: May we overcome the mortals, O Agni, protected by thee, striving for wealth, awaking (thee) with offerings; may we (overcome mortals) in the contest, in the distribution 1 of days; may we (overcome them) by wealth, O son of strength!

column1: yaḥ naḥ āgaḥ abhi enaḥ bharāti adhi it agham agha śaṁse dadhāta jahi cikitvaḥ abhi śastim etām agne yaḥ naḥ marcayati dvayena
column2: If a man should turn upon us sin or guilt, bring ye the evil on him who pronounces evil spells (against us). Destroy, O knowing one, such a curse, O Agni, (of a man) who injures us by falsehood.

column1: tvām asyāḥ vi uṣi deva pūrve dūtam kr̥ṇvānāḥ ayajanta havyaiḥ sam sthe yat āgne īyase rayīṇām devaḥ martaiḥ vasu bhiḥ idhyamānaḥ
column2: Thee, O god, the ancient (mortals) have made their messenger at the break of this (dawn), and have sacrificed with their oblations, when thou goest along, O Agni, in the abode of wealth, a god kindled by the mortals and by the Vasus.

column1: ava spr̥dhi pitaram yodhi vidvān putraḥ yaḥ te sahasaḥ sūno iti ūhe kadā cikitvaḥ abhi cakṣase naḥ agne kadā r̥ta cit yātayāse
column2: Protect the father—drive away (evil) as the knowing one—(the father) who is considered 1 as thy son, O son of strength 2. When, O sapient (Agni), wilt thou look upon us? When wilt thou, who knowest Rita, requite (human deeds)?

column1: bhūri nāma vandamānaḥ dadhāti pitā vaso iti yadi tat joṣayāse kuvit devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam agniḥ vanate vavr̥dhānaḥ
column2: The father 1 adoring gives many names to thee, O Vasu, if thou shouldst take pleasure therein. Will not Agni, delighting in his divine power, grant us his favour, he who has grown strong?

column1: tvam aṅga jaritāram yaviṣṭha viśvāni agne duḥ itā ati parṣi stenāḥ adr̥śran ripavaḥ janāsaḥ ajñāta ketāḥ vr̥jināḥ abhūvan
column2: Thou indeed, O Agni, youngest one, bringest thy praiser across all dangers. Thieves have been seen and deceitful men; dishonest people have come with unknown designs.

column1: ime yāmāsaḥ tvadrik abhūvan vasave vā tat it āgaḥ avāci na aha ayam agniḥ abhi śastaye naḥ na riṣate vavr̥dhānaḥ parā dāt
column2: These our processions have been directed towards thee. Yes, to thee, the Vasu, this guilt has been confessed. Verily this Agni, grown strong, will never surrender us to the curse nor to him who does harm to us.

column1: tvām agne vasu patim vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan tvayā vājam vāja yantaḥ jayema abhi syāma pr̥tsutīḥ martyānām
column2: Thee, O Agni, the treasure-lord of treasures, I gladden at the sacrifices, O king! May we, striving for gain, conquer gain through thee; may we overcome the hostilities of mortals.

column1: havya vāṭ agniḥ ajaraḥ pitā naḥ vi bhuḥ vibhāvā su dr̥śīkaḥ asme iti su gārhapatyāḥ sam iṣaḥ didīhi asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṁsi
column2: Agni, the bearer of oblations, our ever-young father, is mighty, brilliant, beautiful to behold among us. Shine (on us) food with a good household 1. Turn all glory towards us 2.

column1: viśām kavim viśpatim mānuṣīṇām śucim pāvakam ghr̥ta pr̥ṣṭham agnim ni hotāram viśva vidam dadhidhve saḥ deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi
column2: Establish Agni as the Hotri, the sage of the clans, the lord of human clans, the bright purifier, whose back is covered with ghee, the omniscient. May he obtain the best goods (for us) among the gods.

column1: juṣasva agne il̥ayā sa joṣāḥ yatamānaḥ raśmi bhiḥ sūryasya juṣasva naḥ sam idham jāta vedaḥ ā ca devān haviḥ adyāya vakṣi
column2: Enjoy thyself, O Agni, joined with Idâ, uniting thyself with the rays of the sun. Enjoy our fuel, O Gâtavedas, and bring the gods hither that they may eat our offerings.

column1: juṣṭaḥ damūnāḥ atithiḥ duroṇe imam naḥ yajñam upa yāhi vidvān viśvā agne abhi yujaḥ vi hatya śatru yatām ā bhara bhojanāni
column2: Welcome, as our household-god and the guest in our dwelling, come to this our sacrifice as the knowing one. Dispelling, O Agni, all (hostile) attempts, bring to us the possessions of those who are at enmity with us.

column1: vedhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kr̥ṇvānaḥ tanve svāyai piparṣi yat sahasaḥ putra devān saḥ agne pāhi nr̥ tama vāje asmān
column2: Drive away the Dasyu with thy weapon, creating strength for thy own body. When thou bringest the gods across (to us), O son of strength, then, O manliest Agni, protect us in (our striving for) gain.

column1: vayam te agne ukthaiḥ vidhema vayam havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadra śoce asme iti rayim viśva vāram sam inva asme iti viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi
column2: May we worship thee, O Agni, with hymns, with offerings, O purifier with glorious light. Stir for us wealth with all goods; bestow on us all riches!

column1: asmākam agne adhvaram juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno iti tri sadhastha havyam vayam deveṣu su kr̥taḥ syāma śarmaṇā naḥ tri varūthena pāhi
column2: Gâtavedas, as with a boat across a river. Agni, being praised with adoration as (thou hast been praised) by Atri, be a protector of our bodies.

column1: viśvāni naḥ duḥ gahā jāta vedaḥ sindhum na nāvā duḥ itā ati parṣi agne atri vat namasā gr̥ṇānaḥ asmākam bodhi avitā tanūnām
column2: Bring us across all difficulties and dangers,

column1: yaḥ tvā hr̥dā kīriṇā manyamānaḥ amaryaḥ johavīmi jāta vedaḥ yaśaḥ asmāsu dhehi pra jābhiḥ agne amr̥ta tvam aśyām
column2: When I, the mortal, call thee, the immortal, thinking of thee with humble mind 1, bestow glory on us, O Gâtavedas; may I attain immortality, O Agni, with my offspring.

column1: yasmai tvam su kr̥te jāta vedaḥ oṁ iti lokam agne kr̥ṇavaḥ syonam aśvinam saḥ putriṇam vīra vantam go mantam rayim naśate svasti
column2: The well-doer to whom thou, O Agni Gâtavedas, createst pleasant freedom, will happily attain wealth with horses and sons, with valiant men and cows.

column1: su samiddhāya śociṣe ghr̥tam tīvram juhotana agnaye jāta vedase
column2: Sacrifice sharp ghrita to the well-kindled light, to Agni Gâtavedas.

column1: narāśaṁsaḥ susūdati imam yajñam adābhyaḥ kaviḥ hi madhu hastyaḥ
column2: May the unbeguiled Narâsamsa make this sacrifice ready; for he is a sage with honey in his hand.

column1: īl̥itaḥ agne ā vaha indram citram iha priyam su khaiḥ rathebhiḥ ūtaye
column2: 1 Agni, magnified by us, bring hither to our help the bright, beloved Indra, with easy-going chariots.

column1: ūrṇa mradāḥ vi prathasva abhi arkāḥ anūṣata bhava naḥ śubhra sātaye
column2: Soft like wool 1 spread thyself (O Barhis). The hymns have been sung to thee. Be to us for success, O beautiful (Barhis)!

column1: devīḥ dvāraḥ vi śrayadhvam supra ayanāḥ naḥ ūtaye pra pra yajñam pr̥ṇītana
column2: O divine, easily passable doors, open yourselves for our protection. Fill the sacrifice (with bliss) further and further!

column1: supratīke itisu pratīke vayaḥ vr̥dhā yahvī r̥tasya mātarā doṣām uṣasam īmahe
column2: We approach (with prayers) Night and Morning, whose face is beautiful, the increasers of vital strength, the two young mothers of Rita.

column1: vātasya patman īl̥itā daivyā hotārā manuṣaḥ imam naḥ yajñam ā gatam
column2: On the wind's flight, magnified, ye two divine Hotris of man, come hither to this our sacrifice.

column1: il̥ā sarasvatī mahī tisraḥ devīḥ mayaḥ bhuvaḥ barhiḥ sīdantu asri dhah
column2: 1 Ilâ, Sarasvatî, and Mahî, the three comfort-giving goddesses, they who do not fail, shall sit down on the sacrificial grass.

column1: śivaḥ tvaṣṭaḥ iha ā gahi vi bhuḥ poṣe uta tmanā yajñe yajñe naḥ ut ava
column2: Come hither as a friend, Tvashtri and mighty in welfare, and also by thyself, protect us in every sacrifice.

column1: yatra vettha vanaspate devānām guhyā nāmāni tatra havyāni gamaya
column2: Where thou knowest, O tree (i. e. sacrificial post), the secret names of the gods, to that place make the offerings go.

column1: svāhā agnaye varuṇāya svāhā indrāya marut bhyaḥ svāhā devebhyaḥ haviḥ
column2: Svâhâ to Agni and Varuna! Svâhâ to Indra and the Maruts! Svâhâ to the gods for our offering!

column1: agnim tam manye yaḥ vasuḥ astam yam yanti dhenavaḥ astam avarntaḥ āśavaḥ astam nityāsaḥ vājinaḥ iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: I think of that Agni who is a Vasu, to whom the milch-cows go home, the swift horses (go) home, (our) own racers (go) home. Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: saḥ agniḥ yaḥ vasuḥ gr̥ṇe sam yam āyanti dhenavaḥ sam arvantaḥ raghu druvaḥ sam su jātāsaḥ sūraya iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: He is Agni who is praised as the Vasu, he to whom the milch-cows come together, and the quickly running horses, and the well-born liberal patrons. Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: agniḥ hi vājinam viśe dadāti viśva carṣaṇiḥ agniḥ rāye su ābhuvam saḥ prītaḥ yāti vāryam iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: For Agni, dwelling among all tribes, gives a racer to the clan. Agni (gives a racer) that is truly helpful for (winning) wealth 1: he (the racer) being well cherished, will attain precious gain. Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: ā te agne idhīmahi dyu mantam deva ajaram yat ha syā te panīyasī sam it dīdayati dyavi iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: May we kindle thee 1, Agni, O god, the brilliant, never ageing, in order that yon highly miraculous fuel of thine 2 may shine in the sky. Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: ā te agne r̥cā haviḥ śukrasya śociṣaḥ pate su candra dasma viśpate havya vāṭ tubhyam hūyate iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: To thee 1, O Agni, our oblation is offered with a Rik, O lord of bright splendour, highly brilliant, wonderful lord of the clan, carrier of oblations! Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: pro iti tye agnayaḥ agniṣu viśvam puṣyanti vāryam te hinvire te invire te iṣaṇyanti ānuṣak iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: Those Agnis make everything precious prosper in the Agnis; they drive forward (precious wealth); they incite it; they speed it hither in the due way 1. Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: tava tye agne arcayaḥ mahi vrādhanta vājinaḥ ye patva bhiḥ śaphānām vrajā bhuranta gonām iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: Those flames of thine, O Agni, the racers, have boasted mightily—they who with the flight of their hoofs have made tremble 1 the stables of the cows. Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: navāḥ naḥ agne ā bhara stotr̥ bhyaḥ su kṣitīḥ iṣaḥ te syāma ye ānr̥cuḥ tvādūtāsaḥ dame dame iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: Bring fresh food with fine dwellings, O Agni, to us, thy praisers! May we be of those who have praised (thee), who have thee as their messenger, house by house. Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: ubhe su candra sarpiṣaḥ darvī iti śrīṇīṣe āsani uto iti naḥ ut pupūryāḥ ukthyeṣu śavasaḥ pate iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: Thou warmest in thy mouth, O highly brilliant one, the two (sacrificial) ladles full of butter. And mayst thou fill us (with gifts) at our hymns, O lord of strength! Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: eva agnim ajuryamuḥ gīḥ bhiḥ yajñebhiḥ ānuṣak dadhat asme iti su vīryam uta tyat āśu aśvyam iṣam stotr̥ bhyaḥ ā bhara
column2: Thus 1 they have driven, they have led 2, Agni in the due way by prayers and sacrifices. May he bestow on us plenty of valiant men, and that plenty of swift horses (wished for) 3. Bring food to thy praisers!

column1: sakhāyaḥ sam vaḥ samyañcam iṣam stomam ca agnaye varṣiṣṭhāya kṣi tīnām ūrjaḥ naptre sahasvate
column2: O friends, (bring) together your united food and praise to Agni, the strongest (god) of (human) dwellings, the offspring of Vigour, the mighty one—

column1: kutra cit yasya sam r̥tau raṇvāḥ naraḥ nr̥ sadane arhantaḥ cit yam indhate sam janayanti jantavaḥ
column2: At whose onslaught 1, wherever it be, men rejoice in the seat of men, whom the worthy ones kindle, whom (human) creatures produce.

column1: sam yat iṣaḥ vanāmahe sam havyā mānuṣāṇām uta dyumnasya śavasā r̥tasya raśmim ā dade
column2: When we get together the food and the offerings of men, he has grasped, with the strength of his splendour, the rein of Rita.

column1: saḥ sma kr̥ṇoti ketum ā naktam cit dūre ā sate pāvakaḥ yat vanaspatīn pra sma mināti ajaraḥ
column2: He indeed produces light even by night to him who is afar, when he, the ever-young purifier, destroys the lords of the forest.

column1: ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati abhi īm aha sva jenyam bhūma pr̥ṣṭāiva ruruhuḥ
column2: He at whose officiating (men) pour down the offering of their sweat on the paths—to Him who is noble by his own nature, the worlds have risen as to ridges (of hills)—

column1: yam martyaḥ puru spr̥ham vidat viśvasya dhāyase pra svādanam pitūnām asta tātim cit āyave
column2: He whom the mortal has acquired, the much-desired (god), for the refreshment of every one, the sweetener of nourishment, the homestead for the Âyu—

column1: saḥ hi ṣma dhanva ākṣitam dātā na dāti ā paśuḥ hiri śmaśruḥ śuci dan r̥bhuḥ anibhr̥ṣṭa taviṣiḥ
column2: He indeed, the beast, mows off deserts and habitable land like a mower, the golden-bearded with brilliant teeth, the Ribhu of undecaying strength.

column1: śuciḥ sma yasmai atri vat pra svadhitiḥ iva rīyate su sūḥ asūta mātā krāṇā yat ānaśe bhagam
column2: The bright one for whom (the ghrita) streams (quickly) like an axe 1, as at (the sacrifice of) Atri. Him the well-bearing mother has born, as soon as 2 she had enjoyed love 3.

column1: ā yaḥ te sarpiḥ āsute agne śam asti dhāyase ā eṣu dyumnam uta śravaḥ ā cittam martyeṣu dhāḥ
column2: He who satisfies thee for refreshment, O Agni who drinkest butter: mayst thou bestow splendour, renown, and (wise) mind on such mortals 1.

column1: iti cit manyum adhrijaḥ tvādātam ā paśum dade āt agne apr̥ṇataḥ atriḥ sasahyāt dasyūn iṣaḥ sasahyāt nr̥r̥n
column2: Thus I have seized upon the spirit of Adhrig(?) as upon a head of cattle given by thee 1. May then Atri, O Agni, overcome the Dasyus who do not give (to the Brahmans); may Isha overcome the men (who do not give).

column1: tvām agne r̥ta yavaḥ sam īdhire pratnam pratnāsaḥ ūtaye sahaḥ kr̥ta puru candram yajatam viśva dhāyasam damūnasam gr̥ha patim vareṇyam
column2: Thee, O Agni, the men who love Rita have kindled, the ancient ones thee the ancient, for the sake of bliss, O (god) who art produced by strength; the highly-brilliant, worshipful, in whom all refreshment dwells, the household god, the lord of the house, the chosen.

column1: tvām agne atithim pūrvyam viśaḥ śociḥ keśam gr̥ha patim ni sedire br̥hat ketum puru rūpam dhana spr̥tam su śarmāṇam su avasam jarat viṣam
column2: Thee, O Agni, the clans have set down, the ancient guest, the flame-haired lord of the house, with mighty light, with many shapes, the winner of prizes, giving good shelter and good help, who is busy among the decayed (wood) 1.

column1: tvām agne mānuṣīḥ īl̥ate viśaḥ hotrāvidam vivicim ratna dhātamam guhā santam su bhaga viśva darśatam tuvi svaṇasam su yajam ghr̥ta śr iyam
column2: Thee, O Agni, the human clans magnify, who knowest (the art of sacrificial) libations, who separatest (what was mixed) 1, the highest bestower of treasures, who, (though) dwelling in secret, O blessed one, (yet) art visible to all, mightily roaring, an excellent sacrificer, shining with ghee.

column1: tvām agne dharṇasim viśva dhā vayam gīḥ bhiḥ gr̥ṇantaḥ namasā upa sedima saḥ naḥ juṣasva sam idhānaḥ aṅgiraḥ devaḥ martasya yaśasā sudīti bhiḥ
column2: Thee, O Agni, the supporter, we always have praised with our songs and have sat down near thee with adoration. Thus being kindled, O Aṅgiras, be pleased with us, as a god through the mortal's brilliant (offering) 1, with thy glorious splendours.

column1: tvam agne puru rūpaḥ viśe viśe vayaḥ dadhāsi pratna thā purustuta purūṇi annā sahasā vi rājasi tviṣiḥ sā te titviṣāṇasya na ādhr̥ṣe
column2: Thou, O Agni, manifold-shaped, bestowest vigour on every house in thy ancient way, O much-praised one.! Thou rulest with might over much food. This impetuousness of thine, when thou rushest forward impetuously, is not to be defied.

column1: tvām agne sam idhānam yaviṣṭhya devāḥ dūtam cakrire havya vāhanam uru jrayasam ghr̥ta yonim āhutam tveṣam cakṣuḥ dadhire codayat mati
column2: Thee, O Agni, when kindled, O youngest one, the gods have made their messenger and bearer of oblations. Thee who extendest over wide spaces, who dwellest in ghee, into whom offerings are poured, they have made their eye, impetuous, stirring thoughts.

column1: tvām agne pra divaḥ āhutam ghr̥taiḥ sumna yavaḥ su samidhā sam īdhire saḥ vavr̥dhānaḥ oṣadhī bhiḥ ukṣitaḥ abhi jrayāṁsi pārthivā vi t iṣṭhase
column2: Thee, O Agni, on whom offerings of ghee are poured, (men) desirous of thy favour have kindled from of old with good fuel. Thus, grown strong, increased by the plants, thou spreadest thyself over the terrestrial spaces.

column1: tvām agne haviṣmantaḥ devam martāsaḥ īl̥ate manye tvā jāta vedasam saḥ havyā vakṣi ānuṣak
column2: Thee, O Agni, the god, mortals bringing offerings magnify. I deem thee the Gâtavedas. Carry then the offerings (to the gods) in thy due way.

column1: agniḥ hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vr̥kta barhiṣaḥ sam yajñāsaḥ carant i yam sam vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ
column2: Agni is the Hotri of the dwelling where they offer gifts and spread the sacrificial grass, he with whom sacrifices, with whom glorious gains assemble.

column1: uta sma yam śiśum yathā navam janiṣṭa araṇī iti dhartāram mānuṣīṇām viśām agnim su adhvaram
column2: And he whom the kindling-stick has born, the young one, like a young (calf), the supporter of human clans, Agni the best sacrificer—

column1: uta sma duḥ gr̥bhīyase putraḥ na hvāryāṇām puru yaḥ dagdhā asi vanā agne paśuḥ na yavase
column2: And thou showest thyself hard to seize like a son of … 1, thou who art a burner of many woods, O Agni, like an animal (that consumes all grass) on a meadow 2.

column1: adha sma yasya arcayaḥ samyak sam yanti dhūminaḥ yat īmahe tr itaḥ divi upa dhmātāiva dhamati śiśīte dhmātari yathā
column2: 1 And he whose smoky 2 flames come together, when Trita in heaven blows upon him like a smelter, sharpens (him) as in smelting (him) 3…

column1: tava aham agne ūti bhiḥ mitrasya ca praśasti bhiḥ dveṣaḥ yutaḥ na duḥ itā turyāma martyānām
column2: May I through thy protection, O Agni, and through the praises of Mitra—may we 1, like dispellers of malice, overcome the dangers of mortals.

column1: tat naḥ agne abhi naraḥ rayim sahasvaḥ ā bhara saḥ kṣepayat saḥ poṣayat bhuvat vājasya sātaye uta edhi naḥ vr̥dhe
column2: Bring this wealth to us, O powerful Agni, to (these our) men. May he 1 give us dwelling; may he 1 give us prosperity; may he 1 help us in winning booty. And help us to grow strong in fights!

column1: agne ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigo ity adhri go pra naḥ rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām
column2: Agni, bring us the mightiest splendour, O liberal one 1! With wealth and plenty cleave a path for us to booty.

column1: tvam naḥ agne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṁhanā tve iti asuryam ā aruhat krāṇā mitraḥ na yajñiyaḥ
column2: Thou, O wonderful Agni, (protect) us, through thy power of mind, through the bounteousness of thy strength. Upon thee mysterious power has entered. (Thou art) indeed 1 like worshipful Mitra.

column1: tvam naḥ agne eṣām gayam puṣṭim ca vardhaya ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayaḥ naraḥ maghāni ānaśuḥ
column2: Thou, O Agni, increase for our sake the dominion and the prosperity of those liberal givers, (of those) men who have accomplished liberalities (towards us) for our songs of praise.

column1: ye agne candra te giraḥ śumbhanti aśva rādhasaḥ śuṣmebhiḥ śuṣmiṇaḥ naraḥ divaḥ cit yeṣām br̥hat su kīrtiḥ bodhati tmanā
column2: They who adorn prayers for thee, O bright Agni, the givers of horses 1: those men are powerful in their power, whose glory awakes by itself (shining) more mightily than even the sky 2.

column1: tava tye agne arcayaḥ bhrājantaḥ yanti dhr̥ṣṇu yā pari jmānaḥ na vi dyutaḥ svānaḥ rathaḥ na vājayuḥ
column2: Those shining flames of thine, Agni, go fiercely along, like lightnings (flashing) around the earth, like a thundering chariot bent on victory.

column1: nu naḥ agne ūtaye sa bādhasaḥ ca rātaye asmākāsaḥ ca sūrayaḥ vi śvāḥ āsāḥ tarīṣaṇi
column2: Now then, Agni, (come) for our protection, and for the reward of the urgent (worshipper)! May our liberal patrons pass across 1 all regions 2!

column1: tvam naḥ agne aṅgiraḥ stutaḥ stavānaḥ ā bhara hotaḥ vibhva saham rayim stotr̥ bhyaḥ stavase ca naḥ uta edhi pr̥t su naḥ vr̥dhe
column2: Thou, O Agni, Aṅgiras, who hast been praised and who art being praised, bring us, O Hotri, wealth which overpowers (even) skilful men, to thy praisers, and thou shalt be praised by us. And help us to grow strong in fights 1.

column1: anasya gopāḥ ajaniṣṭa jāgr̥viḥ agniḥ su dakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase ghr̥ta pratīkaḥ br̥hatā divi spr̥śā dyu mat vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ
column2: The guardian of people, the watchful one, Agni, the highly dexterous, has been born, for the sake of new welfare. With ghrita on his face, with his mighty, heaven-touching (light) he, the bright one, brilliantly shines for the Bharatas.

column1: yajñasya ketum prathamam puraḥ hitam agnim naraḥ tri sadhasthe sam īdhire indreṇa devaiḥ saratham saḥ barhiṣi sīdat ni hotā yajathāya su kratuḥ
column2: Agni, the beacon of sacrifice, the first Purohita 1 men have kindled in the threefold abode 2. (Driving) on the same chariot with Indra and with the gods, he, the highly wise Hotri, has sat down on the Barhis for sacrificing.

column1: asam mr̥ṣṭaḥ jāyase mātroḥ śuciḥ mandraḥ kaviḥ ut atiṣṭhaḥ vivasvataḥ ghr̥tena tvā avardhayan agne āhuta dhūmaḥ te ketuḥ abhavat divi śr̥itaḥ
column2: Though not cleansed, thou art born bright from thy two mothers 1. Thou hast arisen as the joy-giving sage belonging to Vivasvant 2 They have strengthened thee by ghrita, O Agni, into whom oblations are poured. Smoke, reaching the sky, has become thy beacon.

column1: agniḥ naḥ yajñam upa vetu sādhu yā agnim naraḥ vi bharante gr̥he gr̥he agniḥ dūtaḥ abhavat havya vāhanaḥ agnim vr̥ṇānāḥ vr̥ṇate kavi kratum
column2: May Agni straightway come to our sacrifice. Men carry Agni here and there, house by house. Agni has become the messenger, the carrier of oblations. Choosing Agni they choose a thoughtful (god).

column1: tubhya idam agne madhumat tamam vacaḥ tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śam hr̥de tvām giraḥ sindhum iva avanīḥ mahīḥ ā pr̥ṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca
column2: For thee, O Agni, is this sweetest speech, for thee this prayer; may this one do thy heart good 1! The prayers fill thee with power and strengthen thee, like great rivers the Sindhu.

column1: tvām agne aṅgirasaḥ guhā hitam anu avindan śiśriyāṇam vane vane saḥ jāyase mathyamānaḥ sahaḥ mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasaḥ putram aṅgiraḥ
column2: Thee, O Agni, who wert hidden, dwelling here and there in every wood, the Aṅgiras have discovered 1. Thus thou art born, produced by attrition, a mighty force. Thee, O Aṅgiras, they call the son of strength.

column1: pra agnaye br̥hate yajñiyāya r̥tasya vr̥ṣṇe asurāya manma ghr̥tam na yajñe āsye su pūtam giram bhare vr̥ṣabhāya pratīcīm
column2: To the mighty, sacrificial Agni, to the bull of Rita 1, the Asura, I bring this prayer and this song, which is turned towards him, to (him) the bull, as well-clarified ghrita (is poured) into his mouth at the sacrifice.

column1: r̥tam cikitvaḥ r̥tam it cikiddhi r̥tasya dhārāḥ anu tr̥ndhi pūrvīḥ na aham yātum sahasā na dvayena r̥tam sapāmi aruṣasya vr̥ṣṇaḥ
column2: O knower of Rita, know the Rita! Bore for many streams of Rita. I (do) not (serve) a Yâtu 1 by violence nor by falsehood; I serve the Rita of the red bull 2.

column1: kayā naḥ agne r̥tayan r̥tena bhuvaḥ navedāḥ ucathasya navyaḥ veda me devaḥ r̥tu pāḥ r̥tūnām na aham patim sanituḥ asya rāyaḥ
column2: How, O Agni, performing the Rita through Rita, mayst thou become a witness of our newest 1 hymn? The god, the protector of the seasons, knows of my seasons 2. I (do) not (know another) lord but him who attains (for us) this wealth.

column1: ke te agne ripave bandhanāsaḥ ke pāyavaḥ saniṣanta dyu mantaḥ ke dhāsim agne anr̥tasya pānti ke asataḥ vacasaḥ santi gopāḥ
column2: Who, O Agni, are thy fetterers to (fetter) the impostor 1? What brilliant guardians were successful? Who, O Agni, drink the drink of falsehood? Who are the protectors of untrue speech?

column1: sakhāyaḥ te viṣuṇāḥ agne ete śivāsaḥ santaḥ aśivāḥ abhūvan adhūrṣata svayam ete vacaḥ bhiḥ r̥ju yate vr̥jināni bruvantaḥ
column2: These friends of thine, O Agni, turning themselves from (thee) 1, they who had been kind, have become unkind. They have harmed themselves by their own speeches, uttering wrong words to the righteous.

column1: yaḥ te agne namasā yajñam īṭe r̥tam saḥ pāti aruṣasya vr̥ṣṇaḥ tasya kṣayaḥ pr̥thuḥ ā sādhuḥ etu pra sarsrāṇasya nahuṣasya śeṣaḥ
column2: He who magnifies thy sacrifice, O Agni, by adoration, and serves 1 the Rita of the red bull: may a large, good dwelling come to him, to the offspring of the advancing Nahusha.

column1: arcantaḥ tvā havāmahe arcantaḥ sam idhīmahi agne arcantaḥ ūtaye
column2: Praising we call 1 thee; praising let us kindle 1 thee, Agni, praising, for thy help.

column1: agneḥ stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divi spr̥śaḥ devasya draviṇasyavaḥ
column2: Desirous of riches, we devise to-day an effective song of praise, of Agni the heaven-touching god 1.

column1: agniḥ juṣata naḥ giraḥ hotā yaḥ mānuṣeṣu ā saḥ yakṣat daivyam janam
column2: May Agni take pleasure in our prayers, he who is the Hotri among men. May he sacrifice 1 to the divine host.

column1: tvam agne sa prathāḥ asi juṣṭaḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ tvayā yajñam vi tanvate
column2: Thou, O Agni, art widely extended, the gladly accepted, desirable Hotri; through thee they spread out the sacrifice.

column1: tvām agne vāja sātamam viprāḥ vardhanti su stutam saḥ naḥ rāsva su vīryam
column2: The priests make thee grow, O Agni, the greatest acquirer of wealth, the highly praised one. Bestow thou on us abundance of heroes.

column1: agne nemiḥ arān iva devān tvam pari bhūḥ asi ā rādhaḥ citram r̥ñjase
column2: Agni! Thou encompassest the gods as the felly (encompasses) the spokes (of a wheel). Thou strivest 1 for brilliant wealth.

column1: agnim stomena bodhaya sam idhānaḥ amartyam havyā deveṣu naḥ dadhat
column2: Awaken 1 Agni by thy song of praise, kindling (him) the immortal one. May he place our offerings among the gods.

column1: tam adhvareṣu īl̥ate devam martāḥ amartyam yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane
column2: Him, the immortal god, the mortals magnify at their sacrifices, the best sacrificer among the tribe of men.

column1: tam hi śaśvantaḥ īl̥ate srucā devam ghr̥ta ścutā agnim havyāya vol̥have
column2: Him indeed they all magnify, the god, with the (sacrificial) ladle that overflows with ghrita, Agni, in order that he may bear the oblation.

column1: agniḥ jātaḥ arocata ghnan dasyūn jyotiṣā tamaḥ avindat gāḥ apaḥ svaḥ
column2: Agni when born has shone, killing the Dasyus, (killing) darkness by light. He has found the cows, the waters, the sun 1.

column1: agnim īl̥enyam kavim ghr̥ta pr̥ṣṭham saparyata vetu me ṣr̥ṇavat havam
column2: Worship Agni, the sage who should be magnified, whose back is covered with ghrita. May he come and hear my call 1.

column1: agnim ghr̥tena vavr̥dhuḥ stomebhiḥ viśva carṣaṇim su ādhībhiḥ vacasyu bhiḥ
column2: They have made Agni grow by ghrita, him who dwells among all tribes, and by longing, eloquent praises.

column1: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya giram bhare yaśase pūrvyāya ghr̥ta prasattaḥ asuraḥ su śevaḥ rāyaḥ dhartā dharuṇaḥ vasvaḥ agniḥ
column2: I bring a prayer to the worshipper, the renowned sage, the glorious, ancient one. Agni is the highly gracious Asura, taking his seat in ghrita, the holder of wealth, supporting goods.

column1: r̥tena r̥tam dharuṇam dhārayanta yajñasya śoke parame vi oman divaḥ dharman dharuṇe seduṣaḥ nr̥r̥n jātaiḥ ajātān abhi ye nanakṣuḥ
column2: By Rita they have supported the supporting Rita, near the powerful (performer) 1 of sacrifice, in highest heaven, the men who sit 2 on the supporting support of the sky, and who with born (men) attained to the unborn.

column1: aṁhaḥ yuvaḥ tanvaḥ tanvate vi vayaḥ mahat dustaram pūrvyāya saḥ sam vataḥ nava jātaḥ tuturyāt siṁham na kruddham abhitaḥ pari sthuḥ
column2: Dispelling anguish 1 they spread out for the ancient one 2 his bodies 3, mighty vital power, difficult to overcome. May he, the new-born, traverse the spaces. They have stood round him as round an angry lion.

column1: mātāiva yat bharase paprathānaḥ janam janam dhāyase cakṣase ca vayaḥ vayaḥ jarase yat dadhānaḥ pari tmanā viṣu rūpaḥ jigāsi
column2: When thou carriest, spreading out, man after man like a mother, for their nourishment and for their sight, when thou growest old 1 assuming life after life, thou goest around by thyself in manifold shapes.

column1: vājaḥ nu te śavasaḥ pātu antam urum dogham dharuṇam deva rāyaḥ padam na tāyuḥ guhā dadhānaḥ mahaḥ rāye citayan atrim aspar ity aspaḥ
column2: May gain protect now the boundaries of thy strength, the wide, firmly supporting milkstream 1 of wealth, O god! Putting down thy foot in secret like a thief 2, thou hast enlightened and freed Atri for the sake of wealth mightily 3.

column1: br̥hat vayaḥ hi bhānave arca devāya agnaye yam mitram na praśast i bhiḥ martāsaḥ dadhire puraḥ
column2: Sing 1 (a song that gives) mighty vital power, to the light, to god Agni, whom the mortals have placed in front 2 like Mitra by their praises 3.

column1: saḥ hi dyu bhiḥ janānām hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ vi havyam agniḥ ānuṣak bhagaḥ na vāram r̥ṇvati
column2: For he, Agni, the Hotri of men, day by day, in the arms of Daksha, discloses the offering in the due way, as Bhaga 1 (discloses) a treasure.

column1: asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vr̥ddha śociṣaḥ viśvā yasmin tuvi svaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ
column2: (We abide [?]) in his praise, the liberal (god's), in his friendship, the mightily brilliant one's, in whom, the loudly roaring Aryan, all (beings) have put together their strength.

column1: adha hi agne eṣām su vīryasya maṁhanā tam it yahvam na rodasī iti pari śravaḥ babhūvatuḥ
column2: For verily, O Agni, (thou belongest [?]) to them 1 through thy bounteousness 2 in (bestowing) abundance of heroes. Him indeed, the vigorous one, his glory the two worlds could not encompass 3.

column1: nu naḥ ā ihi vāryam agne gr̥ṇānaḥ ā bhara ye vayam ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacā uta edhi pr̥t su naḥ vr̥dhe
column2: Now then, Agni, come hither and, being praised, bring treasure 1 to us who, we ourselves and our liberal givers, may acquire welfare together. And help us to grow strong in fights.

column1: ā yajñaiḥ deva martyaḥ itthā tavyāṁsam ūtaye agnim kr̥te su adhvare pūruḥ īl̥īta avase
column2: May the mortal truly by sacrifices, O god, (magnify) the stronger one for help; may the Pûru, when good service has been performed, magnify Agni (and thereby draw him) hither for his aid.

column1: asya hi svayaśaḥ taraḥ āsā vi dharman manyase tam nākam citra śociṣam mandram paraḥ manīṣayā
column2: For thou art manifestly considered as his (i. e. Agni's) disposer, highly brilliant by thyself 1: (magnify then Agni who is) a firmament of bright splendour, lovely beyond 2 thought 3.

column1: asya vai asau oṁ iti arciṣā yaḥ ayukta tujā girā divaḥ na yasya retasā br̥hat śocanti arcayaḥ
column2: (It is) yonder (sun?) who verily has been yoked by his (i. e. Agni's) light 1 through the impetuous speech 2—(by the light of Agni) whose flames mightily shine as if (they were made to shine) by the sperm of heaven 3.

column1: asya kratvā vi cetasaḥ dasmasya vasu rathe ā adha viśvāsu havyaḥ agniḥ vikṣu pra śasyate
column2: Through his, the wise one's, insight there is wealth on his, the wonderful (Agni's), chariot. And Agni is praised, he who is to be invoked among all peoples.

column1: nu naḥ it hi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ ūrjaḥ napāt abhiṣṭaye pāhi śagdhi svastaye uta edhi pr̥t su naḥ vr̥dhe
column2: Now indeed our liberal lords have manifestly attained 1 treasure. Offspring of vigour! Protect us for the sake of victory! Help us to welfare! And assist us to grow strong in fights i

column1: prātaḥ agniḥ puru priyaḥ viśaḥ staveta atithiḥ viśvāni yaḥ amartyaḥ havyā marteṣu raṇyati
column2: May Agni, beloved of many, the guest of the house 1, be praised in the morning, the immortal who delights 2 in all offerings among the mortals.

column1: dvitāya mr̥kta vāhase svasya dakṣasya maṁhanā indum saḥ dhatte ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya
column2: 1 To Dvita who by the liberal power of his dexterousness carries away injury 2, this praiser of thine, O immortal, prepares Soma in the due way.

column1: tam vaḥ dīrghāyu śociṣam girā huve maghonām ariṣṭaḥ yeṣām rathaḥ vi aśva dāvan īyate
column2: I call for your sake Him who flames through long life, with the speech that belongs to the liberal patrons 1 whose chariot moves uninjured, O giver of horses 2;

column1: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitiḥ āsan ukthā pānti ye stīrṇam barhiḥ svaḥ nare śravāṁsi dadhire pari
column2: And in whom (dwells) brilliant thought, who guard the hymns of praise in their mouth, (whose) sacrificial grass is spread in the realm of the sun: they have invested themselves with glory.

column1: ye me pañcāśatam daduḥ aśvānām sadha stuti dyu mat agne mahi śravaḥ br̥hat kr̥dhi maghonām nr̥ vat amr̥ta nr̥ṇām
column2: On the liberal patrons who have given me fifty horses for my song of praise 1, bestow brilliant, mighty, high glory, O Agni; on those men (bestow glory) with (valiant) men, O immortal!

column1: abhi ava sthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavreḥ vavriḥ ciketa upa sthe mātuḥ vi caṣte
column2: They are born for retirement 1. Out of the cover he 2 has shone forth, being a cover himself. In the lap of the mother he looks about 3.

column1: juhure vi citayantaḥ animiṣam nr̥mṇam pānti ā dr̥l̥hām puram viviśuḥ
column2: Causing him to discern (the pious and the impious?), they have sacrificed. With unwinking eyes they protect his manly power. They have penetrated into the firm stronghold 1.

column1: ā śvaitreyasya jantavaḥ dyu mat vardhanta kr̥ṣṭayaḥ niṣka grīvaḥ br̥hat ukthaḥ enā madhvā na vāja yuḥ
column2: The people of Svaitreya 1, his clans, have thriven brilliantly. Brihaduktha with a golden ornament at his neck, is eager for the race as if by this honey-drink 2.

column1: priyam dugdham na kāmyam ajāmi jāmyoḥ sacā gharmaḥ na vāja jaṭharaḥ adabdhaḥ śaśvataḥ dabhaḥ
column2: Like the dear milk of love 1—(a thing) unrelated with two (things) related 2—like the gharma vessel with booty in its belly—undeceived, the deceiver of all 3.

column1: krīl̥an naḥ raśme ā bhuvaḥ sam bhasmanā vāyunā vevidānaḥ tāḥ asya san dhr̥ṣajaḥ na tigmāḥ su saṁśitāḥ vakṣyaḥ vakṣaṇe sthāḥ
column2: Sporting, O beam of light, appear to us, joined with the ash, with the wind. May those well sharpened … of his, standing on …, be sharp like… 1.

column1: yam agne vāja sātama tvam cit manyase rayim tam naḥ gīḥ bhiḥ śravāyyam deva trā panaya yujam
column2: 1 Whatever good, O Agni, best acquirer of gain, thou thinkest (fit), praise thou 2 that (good), which is celebrated in songs, among the gods as our share.

column1: ye agne na īrayanti te vr̥ddhāḥ ugrasya śavasaḥ apa dveṣaḥ apa hvaraḥ anya vratasya saścire
column2: They, Agni, who do not set into motion for thee (prayers or offerings), when grown full of mighty strength 1, turn away to encounter the hatred and the tricks of him who follows another (i. e. a wrong) law 2.

column1: hotāram tvā vr̥ṇīmahe agne dakṣasya sādhanam yajñeṣu pūrvyam girā prayasvantaḥ havāmahe
column2: We choose thee as our Hotri, Agni, the giver of skill; offering delight (to thee) we call with our prayer (thee), the foremost at the sacrifices.

column1: itthā yathā te ūtaye sahasāvan dive dive rāye r̥tāya sukrato itisu krato gobhiḥ syāma sadha mādaḥ vīraiḥ syāma sadha mādaḥ
column2: So that we, O strong one, (may be ready) for thy favour, for wealth and Rita, O highly wise one: thus may we day by day rejoice 1 with cows and rejoice with heroes.

column1: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi agne manuṣvat aṅgi raḥ devān deva yate yaja
column2: Let us lay thee down, as Manus did. Let us kindle thee, as Manus did. O Agni Aṅgiras, sacrifice to the gods for the worshippers of the gods as (thou didst) for Manus.

column1: tvam hi mānuṣe jane agne su prītaḥ idhyase srucaḥ tvā yanti ānuṣak su jāta sarpiḥ āsute
column2: For thou, O Agni, art kindled, highly pleased, among human people. To thee the (sacrificial) ladles proceed in due order, O well-born one who drinkest butter.

column1: tvām viśve sajoṣasaḥ devāsaḥ dūtam akrata saparyantaḥ tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īl̥ate
column2: Thee all the gods unanimously have made their messenger. Serving thee, O sage, they magnify at the sacrifices (thee) the god.

column1: devam vaḥ deva yajyayā agnim īl̥īta martyaḥ sam iddhaḥ śukra dīdi hi r̥tasya yonim ā asadaḥ sasasya yonim ā asadaḥ
column2: Let the mortal magnify for your sake Agni, the god, with worship as is due to the gods. Being kindled, O brilliant one, shine! Sit down in the abode 1 of Rita; sit down in the abode of herbs 2.

column1: pra viśva sāman atri vat arca pāvaka śociṣe yaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ hotā mandra tamaḥ viśi
column2: Lo, Visvasâman! Like Atri sing to him who purifies with his flames, to the Hotri who should be magnified at the sacrifices, most delightful in the clan.

column1: ni agnim jāta vedasam dadhāta devam r̥tvijam pra yajñaḥ etu ānuṣak adya devavyacaḥ tamaḥ
column2: 1 Lay down Agni Gâtavedas, the god, the priest. May the sacrifice which best encompasses the gods, proceed to-day in due order.

column1: cikitvit manasam tvā devam martāsaḥ ūtaye vareṇyasya te avasaḥ iyānāsaḥ amanmahi
column2: We, the mortals, approaching thee, the attentive-minded god, for thy help, have thought of thy desirable aid.

column1: agne cikiddhi asya naḥ idam vacaḥ sahasya tam / tvā su śipra dam pate stomaiḥ vardhanti atrayaḥ gīḥ bhiḥ śumbhanti atrayaḥ
column2: Agni, be intent on this—on this our word 1, O strong one. As such, O strong jawed 2 lord of the house, the Atris strengthen thee by their praises; the Atris beautify thee by their prayers.

column1: agne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya pra sahā rayim viśvāḥ yaḥ carṣaṇīḥ abhi āsā vājeṣu sasahat
column2: Agni, bring hither, through the power of thy splendour, powerful wealth which may manifestly prevail over all tribes in the (contests for) booty.

column1: tam agne pr̥tanāsaham rayim sahasvaḥ ā bhara tvam hi satyaḥ adbhutaḥ dātā vājasya go mataḥ
column2: O powerful Agni! Bring hither that wealth powerful in battles. For thou art the true, wonderful giver of booty rich in cows.

column1: viśve hi tvā sa joṣasaḥ janāsaḥ vr̥kta barhiṣaḥ hotāram sadma su priyam vyanti vāryā puru
column2: For all men who have spread out the sacrificial grass, unanimously ask thee, the beloved Hotri in the seats (of sacrifice), for many boons.

column1: saḥ hi sma viśva carṣaṇiḥ abhi māti sahaḥ dadhe agne eṣu kṣayeṣu ā revat naḥ śukra dīdihi dyu mat pāvaka dīdihi
column2: For he who dwells among all tribes, has invested himself with power against assault 1. Agni! In these dwelling-places shine to us richly, O bright one, shine brilliantly, O purifier!

column1: agne tvam naḥ antamaḥ uta trātā śivaḥ bhava varūthyaḥ
column2: Agni, be thou our nearest (friend) and our kind, protecting guardian.

column1: vasuḥ agniḥ vasu śravā accha nakṣi dyumat tamam rayim dāḥ
column2: Agni is Vasu, renowned as Vasu (or, renowned by goods). Obtain, (and) bestow (on us), most brilliant wealth 1.

column1: saḥ naḥ bodhi śrudhi havam uruṣya naḥ agha yataḥ samasmāt
column2: Listen to us then; hear our call; deliver us from every harmful man.

column1: tam tvā śociṣṭha dīdi vaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhi bhyaḥ
column2: We entreat thee now, O brightest, shining (Agni), for thy grace, for our friends.

column1: accha vaḥ agnim avase devam gāsi saḥ naḥ vasuḥ rāsat putraḥ r̥ṣūṇām r̥ta vā parṣati dviṣaḥ
column2: Address thy song 1 for your sake to the god Agni, for his help. He is our Vasu. May the son of the dawns(?) 2 give us (wealth). May the righteous one help us across our enemies.

column1: saḥ hi satyaḥ yam pūrve cit devāsaḥ cit yam īdhire hotāram mandra jihvam it sudīti bhiḥ vibhāvasum
column2: He is the true one, whom the men of old, whom the gods have kindled, the Hotri with the delightful tongue, rich in splendour with glorious shine.

column1: saḥ naḥ dhītī variṣthayā śreṣṭhayā ca su matyā agne rāyaḥ didīhi naḥ suvr̥kti bhiḥ vareṇya
column2: As such, with thy widest thought and with thy best favour, shine wealth on us, excellent Agni, for our beautiful praises 1.

column1: agniḥ deveṣu rājati agniḥ marteṣu āviśan agniḥ naḥ havya vāhanaḥ agnim dhībhiḥ saparyata
column2: Agni reigns among the gods, Agni among mortals, entering among them. Agni is the carrier of our offerings. Serve ye Agni with prayers!

column1: agniḥ tuviśravaḥ tamam tuvi brahmāṇam ut tamam atūrtam śravayat patim putran dadāti dāśuṣe
column2: Agni gives to the worshipper a son most mightily renowned, a knower of mighty spells, most excellent, unconquered, who brings renown to his lord 1.

column1: agniḥ dadāti sat patim sasāha yaḥ yudhā nr̥ bhiḥ agniḥ atyam raghu syadam jetāram aparājitam
column2: Agni gives a good lord who is victorious in battles with his men; Agni (gives) a steed, swiftly running, victorious (in races), unconquered.

column1: yat vāhiṣṭham tat agnaye br̥hat arca vibhāvaso itivibhāvaso mahiṣī iva tvat rayiḥ tvat vājāḥ ut īrate
column2: Sing mightily to Agni the (song) which may best bring him (to us), O (god) rich in splendour 1! From thee (proceeds) wealth (mighty) like a buffalo-cow 2; from thee proceed gains.

column1: tava dyu mantaḥ arcayaḥ grāvāiva ucyate br̥hat uto iti te tanyatuḥ yathā svānaḥ arta tmanā divaḥ
column2: Thy brilliant flames resound mightily like the pressing-stone (of the Soma) 1. And thy roaring arose like thunder by itself from heaven 2.

column1: eva agnim vasu yavaḥ sahasānam vavandima saḥ naḥ viśvā at i dviṣaḥ parṣat nāvāiva su kratuḥ
column2: Thus we have paid homage, desirous of goods, to powerful Agni. May he, the highly wise one, help us, as with a ship, across all enemies.

column1: agne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
column2: Agni, purifier! With thy splendour, with thy delightful tongue, O god, bring hither the gods and perform the sacrifice.

column1: tam tvā ghr̥tasno itighr̥ta sno īmahe citrabhāno iticitra bhāno svaḥ dr̥śam devān ā vītaye vaha
column2: Thee therefore we approach, who swimmest in ghrita 1, O (god) with brilliant light, thee of sun-like aspect. Bring hither the gods that they may feast.

column1: vīti hotram tvā kave dyu mantam sam idhīmahi agne br̥hantam adhvare
column2: Let us kindle thee, O sage, the brilliant offerer of feasts (to the gods), O Agni, the mighty (god) at the sacrifice.

column1: agne viśve bhiḥ ā gahi deve bhiḥ havya dātaye hotāram tvā vr̥ṇīmahe
column2: Agni, come hither with all the gods to the gift of the offering. We choose thee as our Hotri.

column1: yajamānāya sunvate ā agne su vīrya vaha devaiḥ ā satsi barhiṣi
column2: Bring to the sacrificer who presses (Soma), Agni, abundance of heroes. Sit down on the sacrificial grass together with the gods.

column1: sam idhanaḥ sahasra jit agne dharmāṇi puṣyasi devānām dūtaḥ ukthyaḥ
column2: Being kindled, Agni, conqueror of thousandfold (wealth), thou makest the ordinances (of the world) thrive, the praiseworthy messenger of the gods.

column1: ni agnim jāta vedasam hotra vāham yaviṣṭhyam dadhāta devam r̥tvijam
column2: 1 Lay down Agni Gâtavedas, the carrier of offerings, the youngest, the god, the priest.

column1: pra yajñaḥ etu ānuṣak adya devavyacaḥ tamaḥ str̥ṇīta barhiḥ āsade
column2: May the sacrifice which best encompasses the gods, proceed to-day in due order. Spread the sacrificial grass that (the gods) may sit down on it.

column1: ā idam marutaḥ aśvinā mitraḥ sīdantu varuṇaḥ devāsaḥ sarvayā vi śā
column2: May the Maruts, the Asvins, Mitra and Varuna sit down on this (sacrificial grass). the gods with all their folk.

column1: anasvantā sat patiḥ mamahe me gāvā cetiṣṭhaḥ asuraḥ maghonaḥ traivr̥ṣṇaḥ agne daśa bhiḥ sahasraiḥ vaiśvānara tri aruṇaḥ ciketa
column2: The good lord has presented me with two oxen together with a car, the most brilliant Asura among the liberal givers 1. Tryaruna, the son of Trivrishan, O Agni Vaisvânara 2, has distinguished himself by (his gift of) ten thousand (cows?) 3.

column1: yaḥ me śatā ca viṁśatim ca gonām harī iti ca yuktā su dhurā dadāti vaiśvānara su stutaḥ vavr̥dhānaḥ agne yaccha tri aruṇāya śarma
column2: To him who gives me one hundred 1 and twenty cows and two fallow steeds, harnessed and well-yoked, to Tryaruna grant thy protection, Agni Vaisvânara, who art highly praised and grown strong.

column1: eva te agne su matim cakānaḥ naviṣṭhāya navamam trasadasyuḥ yaḥ me giraḥ tuvijātasya pūrvīḥ yuktena abhi tri aruṇaḥ gr̥ṇāti
column2: Thus, O Agni, desiring thy favour 1, Trasadasyu 2 (sings) for the ninth time 3 to thee the youngest (god)—Tryaruna who responds to my, the strong-born's, many hymns with (the gift of) a yoked (chariot) 4—

column1: yaḥ me iti pra vocati aśva medhāya sūraye dadat r̥cā sanim yate dadat medhām r̥ta yate
column2: 1 Who may thus announce me 2 to Asvamedha the liberal (prince): may he give to him who with his verse strives for gain; may he give to him who lives in the Rita for (acquiring) wisdom 3—

column1: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam ut harṣayanti ukṣaṇaḥ aśva medhasya dānāḥ somāḥ iva tri āśiraḥ
column2: Asvamedha whose gifts, a hundred speckled bulls, delight me like Soma juices with threefold admixture 1.

column1: indrāgnī iti śata dāvni aśva medhe su vīryam kṣatram dhārayatam br̥hat divi sūryam iva ajaram
column2: Indra-Agni! Bestow on Asvamedha, the giver of a hundred (bulls), abundance of heroes and mighty royal power, like the never-ageing Sun in heaven.

column1: sam iddhaḥ agniḥ divi śociḥ aśret pratyaṅ uṣasam urviyā vi bhāti eti prācī viśva vārā namaḥ bhiḥ devān īl̥ānā haviṣā ghr̥tācī
column2: Agni kindled has sent his light to the sky; turned towards the dawn he shines far and wide. (The sacrificial ladle) goes forward with adoration, rich in all treasures, magnifying the gods with sacrificial food.

column1: sam idhyamānaḥ amr̥tasya rājasi haviḥ kr̥ṇvantam sacase svastaye viśvam saḥ dhatte draviṇam yam invasi ātithyam agne ni ca dhatte it puraḥ
column2: Being kindled thou reignest over immortality; thou attendest for welfare the man who prepares the sacrificial food. He whom thou furtherest, acquires all wealth and puts in front hospitality (towards thee), O Agni 1.

column1: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāni ut tamāni santu sam jaḥ patyam su yamam ā kr̥ṇuṣva śatru yatām abhi tiṣṭha mahāṁsi
column2: Agni, show thy prowess for the sake of great bliss. May thy splendours be highest. Make our householdership easy to conduct 1. Set thy foot on the greatness of those who show enmity to us.

column1: sam iddhasya pra mahasaḥ agne vande tava śriyam vr̥ṣabhaḥ dyumna vān asi sam adhvareṣu idhyase
column2: I adore thy beauty, Agni, who hast been kindled, who art highly exalted. A bull, brilliant art thou. Thou art kindled at the sacrifices.

column1: sam iddhaḥ agne āhuta devān yakṣi su adhvara tvam hi havya vāṭ asi
column2: Being kindled, Agni into whom offerings are poured, sacrifice to the gods, best sacrificer, for thou art the carrier of oblations.

column1: ā juhota duvasyata agnim pra yati adhvare vr̥ṇīdhvam havya vāhanam
column2: Sacrifice into (Agni); exalt Agni, while the sacrifice is going on. Choose him for your carrier of oblations.
